If I'm anywhere near a dog for more than 5 minutes, my throat will just close up!ScenesPhoebe: That's odd, 'cause this dog's been living here for the past 3 daysScenesChandler: (gasping) Really?ScenesMonica: Chandler, if that dog's been here that long, and you haven't had a reaction, maybe you're not allergic to this dog?ScenesChandler: Well, it still has to go, right?ScenesMonica and Phoebe: Why?ScenesChandler: Okay, it's um…ScenesJoey: (interrupting him) Don't do it!ScenesMonica: Don't do what?ScenesChandler: (to Joey) I have to! Okay? It's time! (Joey shrugs as if to say, "Do what you have to do") Okay, I hate dogs.ScenesAll: What?ScenesPhoebe: Are you crazy?ScenesRoss: Are you out of your mind?ScenesPhoebe: Why?ScenesJoey: Told ya. (Waves bye-bye.)ScenesChandler: They are needy, they are jumpy, and you can't tell what they are thinking, and that scares me a little bit.ScenesRoss: Right, they are scary. (He jumps up, screaming) Ahh, she just ate a treat out of my hand!!!ScenesRachel: Wait a minute. Do you not like all dogs? I mean, not even puppies?ScenesChandler: (scared) Is there a puppy here?ScenesTag: You don't like puppies?ScenesChandler: (to Tag) Okay, you are new!ScenesJoey: Look, Chandler, I told you, never tell anyone about this dog thing. It's like Ross not likin’ ice cream.ScenesPhoebe: You don't like ice cream?ScenesRoss: It's too cold.ScenesChandler: Okay, it's just that dogs make me a little uncomfortable.ScenesRoss: (to Phoebe) It hurts my teeth.ScenesChandler: And I don't wanna say this, I don't you guys to hate me, but uh, I don't think, I can be around that dog anymore. Okay, so either the dog goes, or I go. (An awkward silence ensues.) Oh my god!!Scenes[Time lapse, Ross is still doing Chandler's game. Tag is heading for the balcony.]ScenesRoss: How can I not get this? I'm a college professor; I got 1450 on my S.A.T.s.ScenesMonica: 1250.ScenesRoss: Damn, I forgot you were here.ScenesPhoebe: All right. We're gonna take Clunkers to Ross’s. We'll be back in a minute. (Gets up with Monica to do so.)ScenesRachel: Oh, wait before you guys go, can I just ask you a question?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesRachel: When a guy breaks up with his girlfriend, what is an appropriate amount of time to wait before you make a move?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I'd say about a month.ScenesMonica: Really? I'd say 3 to 4.ScenesJoey: Half hour. (Rachel turns to look at him and he nods yes.)ScenesRachel: Interesting.ScenesMonica: When it's your assistant, I would say never.ScenesJoey: All right, Rach, the big question is, does he like you? All right? Because if he doesn't like you, this is all a moo-point.ScenesRachel: Huh. A moo-point?ScenesJoey: Yeah, it's like a cow's opinion. It just doesn't matter. It's moo.ScenesRachel: (to Monica and Phoebe) Have I been living with him for too long, or did that all just make sense?ScenesMonica: Please, don't listen to Joey, okay. Would you look at him? He-he’s obviously depressed. He's away from his family; he's spending Thanksgiving with strangers.   What he needs right now is for you to be his friend.ScenesRachel: You're right, I'm sorry. Thank you. Okay, that's what I'm gonna do.ScenesJoey: Fine! Take their advice. No one ever listens to me. When the package is this pretty, no one cares what's inside.Scenes[Cut to the balcony, Tag is looking down while Rachel enters.]ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesTag: Hey.ScenesRachel: How are you holding up?ScenesTag: Not bad.ScenesRachel: Yeah? I'm sorry about your girlfriend.ScenesTag: Thanks.ScenesRachel: So were you guys together a long time?ScenesTag: A year. On and off. I kinda thought we'd end up together. I don't anymore.ScenesRachel: Now that she broke up with you?ScenesTag: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Yeah. Hmmmm.ScenesTag: It's weird. I always used to assume, that I would meet someone and fall in love and be happy and all that was just a given. But lately it's like what if it's not. Do you ever have that feeling?ScenesRachel: No…Yeah, all the time, constantly. It's terrifying. But you know that I figure it…it has to work out.ScenesTag: Why?ScenesRachel: Because, uh—it has to.ScenesTag: You have all the answers, don't you?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I know, I do. I really do.ScenesTag: Hey, thanks for talking to me.ScenesRachel: Well, what is a boss for? Hug it out! (They hug)ScenesJoey: (through the window) All right, he likes you back! Huh? Told ya, you should go for it!ScenesTag: What?ScenesJoey: (realizes what he said) Street noise drowned any of that out? (Rachel moves madly towards him) No, all right, I see you later, okay... (Turns away embarrassed)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Balcony, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Tag: What did Joey say? I like you back?ScenesRachel: Uh, yeah, well, see, he… Joey knows, that I'm-I'm very insecure about my back and, and…you're hugging me, so obviously you are not repulsed by it, yeah!ScenesTag: Wait-wait a minute; that doesn't make any sense.ScenesRachel: No? (He shakes his head) All right, here's the truth um, Joey said what he said, because um, I'm attracted to you.ScenesTag: Wow. (He starts to walk towards the railing.)ScenesRachel: Yeah, I admit it. I have a crush on you, and uh, and, and I know that's crazy because we work together, and-and nothing could ever happen, and the last thing I want to do is-is to freak you out or make you feel uncomfortable. Which is why it would be really great if you said something right about now.ScenesTag: (looking at the street) Oh my god! Those guys are stealing my car! (He points down to the street)ScenesRachel: What?ScenesTag: Right there! That's my car! (Sound of a breaking car-window) Hey!!ScenesRachel: Okay, that's gonna take them a minute. Do you have anything else you wanna get off your chest?ScenesTag: I can't believe this! (He walks back in again)ScenesRachel: (she hurries after him) Wait, we still have time to talk and they’re-they're not even in the car yet! (She takes a quick look down the street.) Oh look, there they go, okay. (She hurries in, too)

rows.Scenes: Ross' apartment, Monica and Phoebe sitting on the floor next to Clunkers basket.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay Phoebe, we should probably go back now.ScenesPhoebe: (doing Clunkers) Please don't leave me, I'll be lonely.ScenesMonica: Stop it. Stop! Okay let's go. We can be strong.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, okay.Scenes[They both get up and head for the door. Clunkers whines a little]ScenesMonica: Oh my god! Did you hear that? She said Monica! (She goes back to Clunkers again) Oooh, I can't leave her!ScenesPhoebe: You know if you want, we can sneak the dog back in and Chandler wouldn't even know.ScenesMonica: That's not gonna work.ScenesPhoebe: I've had that dog there for three days and Chandler had no idea. He's not so smart.ScenesMonica: Hey! I didn't know either.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but you kinda knew that something was going on, didn't you?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I knew.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's. Ross lays a lot off small papers, shaped like the U.S. states onto the floor making a map with the states. Phoebe enters]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Where's Chandler?ScenesChandler: (comes out of the bathroom) Here I am.ScenesPhoebe: Wash your hands!!!ScenesChandler: How did you…know? (Heads back into the bathroom)Scenes[Phoebe waves Monica in. Monica sneaks in with the bag with Clunkers in it and heads for Phoebe's room.]ScenesRoss: Hey! What's she doing back here?ScenesMonica: Relax, Ross. She's not made of ice cream!ScenesRoss: Hey look, Phoebe. I, uh, I laid out the states geographically...ScenesPhoebe: (interrupts him) No, no, we don't really have time for this right now. Okay, we have to keep Chandler away from my bedroom.ScenesRoss: Yeah, but, but look what I'm...ScenesPhoebe: See, this is exactly what we do not have time for. (She rushes into her room)ScenesChandler: (comes out of the bathroom) Where's Monica?ScenesRoss: Um, in Phoebe's room. You can't go in there.ScenesChandler: Why not?Scenes(We can hear the dog whining at a high pitch.)ScenesRoss: Monica's crying. She's very upset about this whole Clunkers thing.ScenesChandler: Well, I, I should go in there.ScenesRoss: No. No, no. She doesn't want to see you right now.ScenesChandler: Why not?ScenesRoss: Because you sent away the dog!ScenesChandler: This is ridiculous. (He heads for Phoebe's bedroom)ScenesRoss: Oh, is it? Is it? Look, when Monica and I were kids, we had a dog named Rover. And, uh, one day, my dad decides, he doesn't like dogs. So Monica and her friend…Phyllis…take away the dog. And that was the last time we ever saw him. Don't you see? This is just like that. Only with a few details changed.ScenesJoey: (entering) Okay, I'm in my sweat pants. Bring on the food! (Sees that Chandler has a worried look on his face) What's the matter?ScenesChandler: Monica's all upset, because I sent Clunkers away.ScenesJoey: So? Bring the dog back, you're a hero.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I can be a hero, I could do that. I could, I could do... I, w-w-what if, what if it attacks me?ScenesJoey: Chandler, it's like a big gerbil.ScenesChandler: And that doesn't scare you? (He walks out)ScenesJoey: Ross, you need some help?ScenesRoss: From you? (He does a weird desperate laughter, like he's almost crying) Yes, please!ScenesJoey: (sits down next to Ross) First of all, Utah? Dude, you can't just make stuff up!Scenes[Time lapse, Ross still laying a lot out the states.]ScenesRoss: I hate America! When I finish this game, I swear I am moving.Scenes[Joey stands up again. Rachel enters the door]ScenesJoey: Hey! Tag's still talking to the police.ScenesRachel: Yeah, ohh! Why, damnit, why did I open my mouth? (In a girlish voice) I have a crush on you; I am attracted to you. (Back to normal again) Gee, I-I know that I freaked him outScenesJoey: If you said it like that, you probably did, yeah.Scenes[Rachel walks past Joey towards the couch]ScenesPhoebe: (opens her bedroom door and peeks out) Hey, is Chandler here?ScenesChandler: No, no he went for a walk.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, but you cannot tell him... but look whose back!Scenes[The dog barks, runs out of Phoebe's room and jumps onto the couch]ScenesRachel: (gasps) Hi!ScenesJoey: Oh No-no-no-no-no-no-no! He went over to Ross' to bring the dog back here!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, the dog's not going to be there!ScenesJoey: You think?Scenes[The door opens and Chandler comes in. Rachel covers the door with a blanket]ScenesMonica: Hi, honey.ScenesChandler: Please, please, please, don't be mad at me.ScenesMonica: What? Why, why would...ScenesPhoebe: (interrupts her, to Monica) Shh, wait and see. Maybe we will, maybe we won't.ScenesChandler: Okay, I went over to Ross' apartment to bring back Clunkers. Y’know, for you, and…(Clears his throat) I left the door open and she must have gotten out and I looked everywhere, all over the apartment, including the roof, which FYI Ross, one of your neighbors, growing weed. I couldn't find him, and I am so, so, so, sorry. But I do know where we could all go ease the pain. (Points up and then over to the street)ScenesPhoebe: We have good news, look whose back!ScenesRachel: (uncovers the dog) Hi!ScenesChandler: Clunkers?! Oh my god!ScenesMonica: That's right, she came back all by herself.ScenesPhoebe: It's a Thanksgiving miracle!ScenesChandler: (to Clunkers) It is so good to see you!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, she came all the way back from Ross' building. Oh, the things she must have seen! And then she climbed up the fire escape and she tapped on the window with her teeny little paw and then we ran to let her in…(Realizes, that Chandler starts to not believing her) I went to far, didn't I? When should I have stopped?Scenes[Time lapse, after dinner. Ross stands up from his self-made map.]ScenesRoss: Okay, maybe this is so hard, because there aren't 50 states. Let me tell you something, I have 49 states, and there are no more! I-I think, I should be able to eat something.ScenesChandler: It's up to you.Scenes[Ross whines and starts working again. The door opens and Tag enters.]ScenesRachel: Oh, hi! How are you doing?ScenesTag: I'm okay. I gotta go down to the police station and look at mug shots.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesTag: Thanks for having me over, you guys.ScenesRoss: Tag? Y-You're going? (Comes over to Tag) Uh we didn't, uh we didn't get the chance to talk. Uh, so, where did you say you're from again?ScenesTag: Colorado.ScenesRoss: Ah, what good are you. (Walks back to his map dejectedly.)Scenes[Rachel and Tag go into the hall.]ScenesRachel: Look, um, I think we should talk about what happened on the terrace.ScenesTag: Okay.ScenesRachel: Ah, I-I never should have said what I said. It—y’know what? It just doesn't matter how I feel. I mean we work together, so nothing could really ever happen between us, and what I would love is just to go to work on Monday, and-and never talk about this again, okay? Big day Monday lots to do. So, we're okay?ScenesTag: Um, I'm not.ScenesRachel: Oh, god, I know it, that I freaked you out.ScenesTag: No, you didn't. The only thing that freaked me out was you saying that nothing could ever happen between us.ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesTag: Yeah, so, please don't fire me for doing this. (He kisses her)ScenesRachel: Okay, well, that's one less thing we have to do on Monday.ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, later that night, there is someone knocking on the door and Chandler stumbles out into the living room, turns on the light, looks through the peephole, and opens the door.]
rows.Content: Ross: Delaware! (Starting to cry.) Delaware!ScenesChandler: All right.ScenesRoss: (hands Chandler his pad and walks in) I want my turkey now!ScenesChandler: You got it. (Starts looking at the pad, while Ross got the turkey out of the fridge and starts to unwrap and it) You got Nevada twice.ScenesRoss: (pauses) I know.ScenesChandler: Yeah. (Throws the pad on the table and heads for the bedroom)ScenesEndScenesThe One With All The CandyScenesWritten by: Wil CalhounScenesDirected by: David SchwimmerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Park, Ross is teaching Ben how to ride a bike. Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are they also.]
rows.Content: Ben: (on the bike) I’m ready!ScenesRoss: You sure?ScenesBen: Uh-huh!ScenesChandler: Okay, let me just straighten out your helmet there. (Does so.)ScenesBen: (To Chandler) Thanks daddy.ScenesRoss: No-no, one daddy, two mommies. All right, it’s all yours. (Ross pushes him off.)ScenesChandler: Okay. Okay.ScenesRoss: Yes! Yes! Yes!! (Everyone stands and claps.)ScenesPhoebe: His first big kid’s bike, this is so exciting!ScenesMonica: Oh yeah, I remember mine! Ohh, it was my sixth birthday, my dad took me to the park, I got it, and…it bent.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: I never had a bike of my own.ScenesRoss: (shocked) What?!ScenesPhoebe: Well, we didn’t have a lot of money. But the girl across the street had the best bike! It was pink and it had rainbow colored tassels hanging off the handle grips, and-and-and a bell and this big, white wicker basket with those plastic daisies stuck on.ScenesChandler: That sounds like my first bike. (They all turn and look at him.) My dad gave me his old one.ScenesRoss: Ohh.ScenesMonica: Did the girl ever let you ride it?ScenesPhoebe: No! But she gave me the box that it came in. It had a picture of the bike on the front. (They’re all speechless) So I would sit on it and my step-dad would drag me around the backyard.ScenesRoss: That is so unfair!ScenesPhoebe: Not really, I got to drag him around too! (They all nod, "Oh.")ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is cooking, Joey is eating, and Chandler is entering from the bedroom.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! What are you guys doing?ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesMonica: Making holiday candy for the neighbors.ScenesChandler: I’m sorry, who?ScenesMonica: I’m gonna hang this basket (Points to the one sitting on the table) on the door and when the neighbors walk by they can all take a piece.ScenesChandler: But we don’t know the neighbors.ScenesJoey: I do. There’s uh, let’s see, Guy With a Mustache, Smokes-A-Lot Lady, Some Kids I’ve Seen, and A Red-haired Guy Who Does Not Like To Be Called Rusty.ScenesMonica: See? This is exactly why I’m making this candy. We can learn their names and get to know our neighbors.ScenesChandler: Wouldn’t it be easier if we just moved?ScenesRachel: (entering, happily) Gooood morning!!ScenesChandler: Eh, somebody’s in a good mood!ScenesRachel: Well, why shouldn’t I be? I have great friends! I have a wonderful job!ScenesMonica: Where you can make out with your assistant.ScenesRachel: Come on, it’s not a big deal! We stayed up all night coming up with a plan so that us dating will not be a problem.ScenesMonica: Oh yeah, what’s the plan?ScenesRachel: (pauses as she thinks and exhales loudly) We… We are not… …going to let it… be a problem.ScenesMonica: Wow! It took you all night to come up with that plan?!ScenesRachel: Well y’know, we did other stuff too. (Joey and Chandler start to giggle.)ScenesMonica: Did you two…ScenesRachel: Oh Monica come on, y’know I don’t sleep with guys on the first date!ScenesMonica: Matt Guire, Mark Lynn, Ben Wire…ScenesRachel: Anymore!!ScenesMonica: Okay.

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Office, she’s at her desk while the mailman delivers her mail and calls Tag in.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi. Tag, I have a conference call today is that correct?ScenesTag: Yes, at 4:00.ScenesRachel: Okay, thank you. That’ll be all. (The mail guy leaves and Tag starts to follow, but Rachel stops him.) (Excitedly) Wait! Wait! (Rushes over and closes the office-door.) Did you see that? That mail guy had no idea there was something going on between us. (They kiss.)ScenesTag: I’d better get back to my desk.ScenesRachel: Okay, you hard worker! I’ll remember to put that in your evaluation.ScenesTag: My what?ScenesRachel: Well, you’ve been here for two months now and your boss is required to hand in a performance evaluation. But y’know, there is one thing that I have yet to evaluate. (She turns around and sweeps the stuff off of her desk and hops up onto it.)ScenesTag: Are you serious?ScenesRachel: No, I’ve just always wanted to do that. Can you help me clean this up?

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Monica and Chandler are returning and Monica finds her basket is empty.]
rows.Content: Monica: The basket is totally empty! My God, the neighbors ate all the candy!ScenesChandler: Well, either that or uh…(Motions towards Joey’s door.)ScenesMonica: Joey!!Scenes(She storms into his apartment to find him with a towel around his shoulders, a bowl on his head, and Phoebe with scissors in her hand.)ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesMonica: Did you eat all the neighbor candy?!ScenesJoey: Uh well yeah, that was the plan, but by the time I got to it there was only a couple of pieces left!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, and they’ve been coming by all day. They love it!ScenesMonica: They love my candy? Oh man!!! I’ve gotta go make more!! (Starts to do so.)ScenesJoey: Hey Mon, you might wanna make some more lasagna too, because something might’ve happened to a huge chunk of it.Scenes(Ross enters.)ScenesMonica: Ross! The neighbors ate all my candy!!ScenesRoss: Mine stole my newspaper! It’s like a crime wave!! (Monica runs to make more candy.) Pheebs, you uh, you got a second.ScenesPhoebe: Sure!ScenesRoss: Yeah, ever since you uh, told me that story about that bike I-I couldn’t stop thinking about it. I mean, everyone should have a-a first bike, so…Scenes(He goes out into the hall and re-enters with a bike exactly like the one Phoebe described earlier.)ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) Oh my God Ross!!ScenesRoss: You like it?ScenesPhoebe: I love it!!ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: Ohh!! Ohh!! And I love you!ScenesRoss: Ahh.ScenesPhoebe: Not that way! But the bike brought you a lot closer!ScenesRoss: Ah! (She hugs him.) Well uh-uh, t-take it downstairs, y’know give it a test ride.ScenesPhoebe: Okay! Oh my God! My first bike! Thank you for the best present I’ve ever gotten.ScenesRoss: (stunned at the complement) You’re welcome.ScenesPhoebe: (starts to leave, but stops) Oh and Chandler’s about to cry.ScenesChandler: (about to cry) Am not!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, the middle of the night, there is someone knocking on the door and Monica and Chandler get up to answer it.]
rows.Content: Monica: (turning a light on) Who is that?!ScenesChandler: Don’t worry, I’m brave! I am brave! I…I am brave! (They get to the door and Monica goes to open it.) No-no-no-no!! (He stops her.) (Through the door.) Can you tell me who is there please?ScenesThe Knocker: My name is Gary, I live upstairs.Scenes(Monica opens the door.)ScenesGary: Hi!ScenesMonica: Hi. Do you know what time it is?ScenesGary: It’s candy time! My roommate says that they taste like little drops of heaven.ScenesMonica: Oh please! (To Chandler) Did you hear that? Little drops of heaven.ScenesChandler: (laughs) 4:00 A.M.ScenesGary: So, can I get some candy?ScenesChandler: I am sorry, but some of us have to get up early and go to work! (Monica looks at him) (To Monica) He does not know that I am not some of us.ScenesMonica: Umm, listen I am sorry, but I’ll put some out first thing in the morning.ScenesGary: Well okay, I’ll swing by later. Do you live in this building?ScenesMonica: Um-hmm.ScenesGary: (looking at Monica.) Mm! Seems like I would’ve remembered you!ScenesChandler: Mm! Night Gar’! (Monica closes the door.)

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Office, she’s slinking out to where Tag works and checks to make sure no one is coming.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (hugging him) So did you read your evaluation yet?ScenesTag: No! It was marked confidential I just sent it down to Human Resources.ScenesRachel: (worried) Okay please, you’re kidding right?! I wrote that one as a joke for you!ScenesTag: A joke they would appreciate?ScenesRachel: I’m thinkin’ no.ScenesTag: What did you say?!ScenesRachel: Umm, I said I thought you were a good kisser, and uh, and that I like your tiney-tiny touchie.ScenesTag: No, not my touchie.ScenesRachel: Well, it gets worse. When asked if you take initiative I wrote, "Yes, he was able to unhook my bra with minimal supervision," and under Problems with Performance I wrote, "Dear God, I hope not," and then uh, then I drew a little smiley face, and then a small pornographic sketch.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey, Monica, Ross, and Chandler are watching Phoebe polish the daisies on her bike outside.]
rows.Content: Monica: Ross! That is so sweet of you to get Phoebe that bike! When I heard the story, I almost cried.ScenesJoey: Almost cried huh? Hear that Chandler? Almost cried!ScenesChandler: Hey, you cry every time somebody talks about Titanic!ScenesJoey: (about to cry) Those two only had each other!ScenesRoss: Phoebe really likes the bike huh?ScenesMonica: Oh yeah! I saw her walkin’ it down the street the other day. She had uh, these flowers in the basket. It was so cute.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I saw her this morning walkin’ it by the park.ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, she was walking the bike? Both times?Scenes[Cut to outside, they’re going to talk to Phoebe about walking the bike.]ScenesJoey: Hey Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Oh hi!ScenesChandler: Hey! So are you enjoying the bike?ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, uh-huh so much!ScenesRoss: Pheebs you uh…you do know how to ride a bike don’t you?ScenesPhoebe: Of course!ScenesMonica: Umm, can we see you ride it?ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (The gang is giggles then Phoebe gets the bike out of the rack, gets on, pushes off, rolls a few feet, and falls over.) See?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is making candy while Chandler and Rachel are taste testing and Joey is on the couch doodling.]
rows.Content: Monica: See, this is why I told you never get involved with your assistant! And here is no such thing as keeping secrets when it comes to affairs. (To Chandler) Did you hear that Chandler? No such thing!ScenesChandler: (with his mouth full) What happened? I’m just eating candy.ScenesRachel: Maybe it’s not as bad as I think. Y’know, maybe they didn’t take it the way I meant it.ScenesChandler: Absolutely! Y’know, because touchie can mean both ass and good worker.ScenesRachel: Ugh, I just gotta get the thing back!ScenesJoey: Hey Rach?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesJoey: That sketch you mentioned? Might it have looked a little something like this? (He shows her what he’s been drawing.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Joey!ScenesChandler: What is the matter with you?ScenesRachel: Ugh!ScenesJoey: Boy I tell ya, this little talent came in handy before I could afford porn.Scenes(There is a knock on the door and Monica answers it. There is a woman standing there.)ScenesThe Woman: Hi! I’m sorry, I know it’s after hours but I really need candy.ScenesMonica: I’m sorry, I can’t help you. See? (Points to her new sign.) Rules are rules.ScenesThe Woman: Please! I have people coming from out of town today! And, I told them all about your candy!ScenesMonica: No kidding, out of towners huh? What did you tell ‘em?ScenesThe Woman: I told ‘em your candy is absolutely indescribable!ScenesMonica: Some people have been saying its y’know little drops of heaven, but whatever.ScenesThe Woman: Please, can’t you help me out?ScenesJoey: (watching the discussion) Hey Chandler, do we know that lady?ScenesChandler: Maybe, isn’t she the woman who lives below you and has sex really loud?ScenesMonica: (still talking to the woman) All right, I’ll do it just this once! But you can’t tell anybody!ScenesThe Woman: (exasperatedly) Yes! Yes! Please, just give it to me!ScenesJoey and Chandler: Yeah, that’s her.ScenesThe Woman: (after Monica gives her the candy) Thank you.ScenesMonica: (closing the door) It’s unbelievable! I-I can’t believe that sign didn’t work!ScenesChandler: Y’know what would work?ScenesMonica: Hmm?ScenesChandler: Stop making candy!ScenesMonica: But they like it!ScenesChandler: You mean they like you.ScenesMonica: Maybe.ScenesChandler: Is that why you became a chef? So that people would like you?ScenesMonica: Oh, you really want to talk about getting people to like you huh, funny man? (Joey laughs but stops when Chandler turns to glare at him.)

rows.Scenes: Central Park, Ross is teaching Phoebe how to ride her bike.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, now just remember everything I taught you and you’ll be fine. Okay? Here we go. Ready…Set…ScenesPhoebe: (hopping off the bike) Wait! This seat is really uncomfortable! Yeah, maybe before we start we should just get another one. Perhaps, like an airplane seat—or a beanbag chair!ScenesRoss: Phoebe, you can’t get out of this! Okay? You have to learn how to ride a bike!ScenesPhoebe: Why? Why do I have to learn?ScenesRoss: Well…In-in case of emergency.ScenesPhoebe: What kind of an emergency?ScenesRoss: Well let there—what if a man comes along and puts a gun to your head and says, "You ride this bike or I’ll sh…I’ll shoot you.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I would ring the bell to distract him and then I would knock the gun out of his hand with a Chinese throwing star.ScenesRoss: Okay, Phoebe just-just get-get on the bike and—Hey! I’ll hold you up and-and push you. Okay?ScenesPhoebe: You won’t let go?ScenesRoss: No!ScenesPhoebe: Swear?!ScenesRoss: I swear!ScenesPhoebe: (thinks it over) Okay.ScenesRoss: Come on. (She gets on the bike.) All right, here we go. All right? (They start.)ScenesPhoebe: All right.ScenesRoss: All right. Feel good?ScenesPhoebe: Well…ScenesRoss: All right, try pedaling.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Does so.)ScenesRoss: That’s it, your doing great.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesRoss: Doing great! Yes-yes-yes! Take control! Yes!ScenesPhoebe: Weee!!! (Ross pushes her and lets go.)ScenesRoss: Yes!! Yes!!! (He starts clapping and Phoebe turns around to look at him and falls off the bike.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Oh! Oh no!! You swore!ScenesRoss: I-I just thought you were doing so well. I…ScenesPhoebe: I am shocked! Shocked!! (She storms off leaving Ross to defend himself from the angry looks from onlookers.)ScenesRoss: It’s a legitimate learning technique. (Looking around and seeing the woman behind him glaring at him.) Wow!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is making candy like mad as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, there’s uh, some people outside, askin’ about candy.ScenesMonica: Well, they’re just gonna have to wait aren’t they? I’ve only got two hands!!ScenesRoss: Need some help?ScenesMonica: No! You don’t know the system! There’ll be nobody messing with the system!ScenesRoss: By the way, the week before your wedding you may not see a lot of me. (She glares at him and he quickly makes his way to Phoebe’s room.)Scenes[Cut to Phoebe’s room, Phoebe has put her helmet on one of her teddy bears and is playing around with it. Ross knocks and pokes his head in the door.]ScenesPhoebe: (seeing him) Oh, hello liar.ScenesRoss: (entering) Look, I-I’m really sorry I let go of the bike.ScenesPhoebe: I could’ve been killed I hope you know!ScenesRoss: I know. I know. But, can we please try it again? Huh? I mean, you were so close Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Well, I would love to but…the bike got stolen and the police have no suspects. (Ross just happens to have his hand on a sheet that is covering something that suspiciously looks like a bike.)ScenesRoss: Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: What?! (Ross rings the bell.) What the hell?!ScenesRoss: All right, y’know what? If you are not going to learn how to ride this bike then I’m sorry, I’m just gonna have to take it back.ScenesPhoebe: What?! Why?!ScenesRoss: Because! Because, it-it-it’s… It’d be like you having this guitar (Points to hers) and-and never playing it. Okay, this guitar wants to be played! And-and this bike wants to be ridden and-and if you don’t ride it you-you’re-you’re killing its spirit! (Pause) The bike is dying.ScenesPhoebe: All right. If you care enough to make up that load of crap, okay.ScenesRoss: Great! Great! (He runs to the door.) You’re making the bike very happy.ScenesPhoebe: (sarcastically) Okay Ross! (Ross exits and she says quietly to the bike) Please don’t die!

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s office, Tag and her are planning how to get the review back.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay, I think we can get the evaluation back before they see it, but we’re gonna have to get into Mr. Zelner’s office. Now, he doesn’t get in until 10, so he’s no problem, but his assistant, Betty, she comes in early to eat her breakfast at her desk.ScenesTag: That’s kinda sad.ScenesRachel: Yeah, well Betty’s kinda sad. Which is why I believe I can lure her away with these chocolates. (Holding up the box of chocolates.) Now, while I distract her, you get in the office.ScenesTag: Got it!ScenesRachel: Let’s roll!Scenes(They start towards the door but are stopped when Mr. Zelner enters.)ScenesMr. Zelner: Hello Rachel, you uh, got a minute?ScenesRachel: (worried and shocked) Yeah, sure Mr. Zelner, for you anything—minute. Okay. Fine. (To Tag) Abort the plan, abort the plan. (She start to usher Tag out.)ScenesMr. Zelner: Uh actually, I’d like to speak with both of you.ScenesRachel: Okay. Uh, well can we, can we get you anything Mr. Zelner? Maybe some chocolates? (Holds up the box.)ScenesMr. Zelner: Umm, no. Thanks, but I’ll give these to Betty. (Rachel glances at Tag to say, "See?") So I read your evaluation of Tag, or to use his full name, Tag Sweetcheeks Jones. Is something going on with you two?ScenesRachel: (laughs) Oh my God. Can you imagine if there was?! I mean, (getting serious) what would happen exactly.ScenesMr. Zelner: Well, I’d be forced to file a report. I’d have to consult with the legal department, and your future at the company would be in jeopardy.ScenesRachel: Well…ScenesTag: (interrupting) Uh Mr. Zelner, I’m the one who filled in that evaluation.ScenesRachel: Oh no-no-no…ScenesTag: (interrupting again) Yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah, I thought it would be funny.ScenesMr. Zelner: You wrote that you have a cute touchie?ScenesTag: (pause) Yes. I have a weird sense of humor, and I’m kinda strangely proud of my butt.ScenesMr. Zelner: It’s kind of a risky joke Tag, and what is-what is this drawing I can’t figure out what this is?ScenesRachel: You’re lookin’ at it upside down—y’know what? (Grabs the evaluation and throws it out.) It doesn’t matter.ScenesMr. Zelner: Yeah, it’s not like I don’t have a sense of humor, huh? Hell, I even enjoy a naughty limerick now and then. But there’s a time and a place, huh?! Unless you uh, have a limerick right now? (They both nod no.) No? Okay, well uh, you’ve (Grabs the chocolates.) got my fax number. (Exits.)ScenesRachel: Whoa! I can’t believe you did that. That was really sweet.ScenesTag: No, don’t worry about it.ScenesRachel: No, you could’ve lost your job.ScenesTag: Are you kidding me?! With a cute butt like this, I’d find work.ScenesRachel: Thank you! You’re great! (They kiss.)ScenesTag: Y’know what?ScenesRachel: What?ScenesTag: I feel great. (Rachel laughs) In fact! (Walks over to her desk, sweeps its contents onto the floor and Rachel just glares at him.) What?ScenesRachel: I… It just—it took me so long to get that desk organized.ScenesTag: Oh, I’m sorry. (He bends over to pick the stuff up.)ScenesRachel: (looking at his butt) There it is. (They hug.)

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Chandler is returning from work to see the hallway jammed full of people waiting outside their door.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (asking a man leaning against the wall) What is going on?ScenesThe Man: We’re waiting for the candy. (Yelling at the door.) Bring out the candy!ScenesJoey: Yeah lady! Give us candy!!ScenesChandler: Joey!ScenesJoey: What’s up buddy?ScenesChandler: What are you doing?ScenesJoey: Waiting for candy.ScenesChandler: Get in here! (They head for the door and Chandler sees Smokes-A-Lot Lady standing next to the door and smoking, to her) Hey, and you can not smoke in here! (Takes the cigarette and takes a drag for himself.) (Exhaling in ecstasy) Merry Christmas.ScenesMonica: (opening the door and frantically) Okay, guys! The candy is coming; I just need another 15 minutes for the chocolate to cool!ScenesAll: We want candy! We want candy now! (And other general commotion sounds.)ScenesChandler: All right everybody! Just be quiet! Be quiet! Be quiet!! Pipe-pipe-pipe down! (They settle down) What is the matter with you people?! This woman was trying to do a nice thing for you. She was making candy so she could try to get to know all of you, and I’ll bet that not one of you can tell me her name! Am I right?ScenesThe Man: (from earlier) Candy Lady?ScenesChandler: No not (imitating) Candy Lady.ScenesJoey: (stepping in and knocking the man over) Hey, if we know it can we have candy?!!ScenesChandler: All right, y’know what? Forget it, all of you forget it! You’ve ruined it! Go home! You’ve ruined it! You’ve ruined it!ScenesJoey: That’s right, it’s all ruined! You guys ruined everything! You ruined it! (Steps into the apartment and Chandler closes the door.) (Joey struts over to the candy and starts eating it.)ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) Thank you.ScenesChandler: You’re welcome. (They kiss.)ScenesMonica: Did you smoke?ScenesChandler: No! Smokes-A-Lot Lady blew smoke directly into my mouth. Eh-uh—are you okay?ScenesMonica: I’m fine now, but it was really scary there for a while. I mean, someone slipped a-a threatening note under the door.ScenesJoey: (with his mouth full) Oh yeah, sorry about that. Mob mentality or whatever, I don’t know… (Grabs the note.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Park, Phoebe is now riding her bike with ease and stops in front of Ross. They both giggle.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: I can’t believe it! I did it! I rode a bike! I never thought I’d be able to do that! Thank you Ross.ScenesRoss: Oh hey, don’t thank me, thank yourself. You’re the one who faced her fears and ultimately overcame them.ScenesPhoebe: Don’t be so corny Ross, it’s not an after-school special. (She rides off and the camera pans down to reveal two shiny, silver training wheels firmly attached.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With the Holiday ArmadilloScenesWritten by: Greg MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is on the phone, Rachel and Monica are sitting in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Buh-bye. (Hangs up the phone) I just got us reservations at Michelle’s and tickets to the Musicman to celebrate our first holiday season as a betroughed couple.ScenesMonica: Betrothed… (Corrects him)ScenesChandler: …betrothed couple.ScenesPhoebe: (entering carrying a skull) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRachel and Monica: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Haaaa... (Puts the skull on the table) ... ahhhh!ScenesChandler: Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Huh?ScenesChandler: Skull?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, it's my mom's.ScenesRachel: (freaking out) Oh my god!!ScenesPhoebe: No, no, no. It's not! It's not my mom. It belonged to mom. Yeah, no, she used to put it out every Christmas to remind us, that even though it's Christmas, people still die. And, you can put candy in it. (She grabs the skull, pulls out a stick of licorice, and takes a bite.)ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesMonica: (Offering Ross the skull) Licorice?ScenesRoss: (Thinking it over) Sure! (Takes one) Hey, I just found out, I get Ben for the holidays this year.ScenesAll: Ohh! That's great!ScenesMonica: Are you gonna dress up as Santa?ScenesRoss: Nope. I mean, I know Susan does every year, but I think I wanna take this year to teach him all about Hanukkah.ScenesPhoebe: And maybe I could teach Ben about the Christmas skull and how people die.ScenesRachel: You may need to use this year to teach Ben about Phoebe.ScenesRoss: Hmm.Scenes(Joey comes out of the bathroom reading a newspaper)ScenesJoey: Hey. (He exits)ScenesRachel: (to Monica) Did you know he was in there?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: How long have we been home?ScenesMonica: About a half an hour.ScenesChandler: Lovely!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is getting a cup of coffee and sits down next to Monica.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey, you know what I was thinking? When we get married, are you gonna change your last name to Bing?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: Why not?ScenesMonica: Bing's weird.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Oh, hey, you guys!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey. Guess what! My landlord just called and my apartment is gonna get ready soon, so I guess I'll be moving out.ScenesMonica: Ahh, Phoebe, I'm gonna miss you!ScenesPhoebe: Yes, you will be very sad. All right, well I gotta go tell Rachel the good news.ScenesChandler: Ohh! You guys gonna be living together again?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, why not?ScenesChandler: Well, she's just so much fun with Joey, I just assumed, she'd still be living with him.ScenesPhoebe: Why do you think, she's having so much fun living with Joey?ScenesChandler: No reason, except…she…told…me.ScenesPhoebe: Really? So she said, she didn’t wanna live with me anymore?ScenesChandler: No! No, she didn't say that. I-I-I think you should talk to Monica now.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, don't worry about it. I'm sure she wants to live with you.ScenesPhoebe: You're sure? You're absolutely sure?ScenesMonica: Well, no. But, um, I bet she probably does.ScenesPhoebe: Probably? Yeah, I don't like that word. (Chandler and Monica look surprised) Kind of what ‘probably’ really means. Yeah, uh-huh. Yeah, oh, "Your mom probably won't kill herself," y’know? I'm sorry, but I'm not hanging all my hopes of Rachel and I living together on-on "Probably!" Y’know? You gotta take care of yourselves! (She starts to walk out) In this world history teaches us nothing! (Exits)ScenesChandler: Bing doesn't seem so weird now, does it?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is sitting behind a red drum set.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey! Great, you’re home! Guess what Phoebe got me for Christmas! (Starts drumming.)ScenesRachel: Drums?ScenesJoey: (yelling) No! Drums!

rows.Scenes: Michelle's, Chandler and Monica enter.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (to the Maitre d') Hi, could we get two burritos to go, please? (Laughs.)ScenesMonica: I'm sorry. But not that sorry, 'cause you don't have to live with it. Um, we have a reservation under the name Chandler Bing.ScenesMaitre d': Oh-kay, we'll have a table for you in about 45 minutes.ScenesChandler: Forty-five minutes? We have tickets to the Musicman at 8:00.ScenesMaitre d': I'm sorry. Christmas is a very busy time, sir.ScenesChandler: Is this because of the burrito thing?ScenesMonica: (pulling Chandler away from the Maitre d') You need to give him money.ScenesChandler: Give him money? It was a joke!ScenesMonica: No, to get a table! Places like are always shakin’ you down. Everybody wants to be paid off.ScenesChandler: Right, calm down, O'Mally. I'll slip him some money.ScenesMonica: You've got to be smooth about it.ScenesChandler: Hey, I can be smooth. (Walks back to the Maitre d', very smoothly) Listen, we're a little bit in a hurry, so, if you can get us a table a little quicker, I'd appreciate it. (Shakes his hand)ScenesMaitre d': Of course, sir.ScenesChandler: Okay. (Walks back to Monica)ScenesMonica: How did it go?ScenesChandler: Had the money in the wrong hand. (Shows her his left hand with the money in it)

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross is whirling Ben around.]
rows.Content: Ross: Wooooooo, hehehe. Hey, ahh, you don't feel like you're gonna throw up, do ya?ScenesBen: No.ScenesRoss: Well, I do, so let's... (Ben and Ross sit down on the couch) So, Ben, you uh, you know what holiday is coming up, don't ya?ScenesBen: Christmas.ScenesRoss: Yep, and you know what other holiday is coming up?ScenesBen: Christmas eve.ScenesRoss: Yes, but also (Pauses to let Ben answer, but he doesn’t.) Hanukkah! See, you're part Jewish, and-and Hanukkah is a Jewish holiday.ScenesBen: Santa has reindeers that can fly!ScenesRoss: Right, um, but, on Hanukkah, Hanukkah is a celebration of a miracle. See, years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees.ScenesBen: (singing) Jingle bells, jingle bells...ScenesRoss: (interrupts him) Okay, that's right, yes, but on Hanukkah, uh, we sing, uh (Sings) Dreidel, dreidel, dreidel, I made you out of clay.ScenesBen: (singing) Rudolph, the red-nosed reindeer...ScenesRoss: (interrupts him again) Okay, it's not a contest.ScenesBen: When is Santa coming?ScenesRoss: Well, how about this year, instead of Santa, we have fun celebrating Hanukkah?ScenesBen: No Santa? Was I bad?ScenesRoss: No! Oh, no-no-no. Hey, you weren't bad, you've been very good, Ben.ScenesBen: Santa's mad at me.ScenesRoss: No, hey-hey, come on, (He grabs Ben and sits him on his lap) Ben, Santa is not mad at you, okay? Hey, you're-you're his favorite little guy!ScenesBen: So Santa's coming?ScenesRoss: (disappointed) Yes! Santa's coming!

rows.Scenes: Michelle's, Chandler and Monica are discussing how to bribe the Maitre d'.]
rows.Content: Monica: It's easy! Just keep it casual! Give him a kind word, shake his hand and give him the money!ScenesChandler: How do you know so much about this?ScenesMonica: I don't know.ScenesChandler: Richard used to do it, didn't he?ScenesMonica: We'd be eating our soup right now.ScenesChandler: Mustached bastard…ScenesMonica: (sees two people exit) Okay, those people just left, come on! Quick! Give him the money and get their table!ScenesChandler: (walks up to the Maitre d') Excuse me...Scenes[Chandler can't find his money in the pocket. In the meantime, another couple shows up, and Chandler turns away to look for his money]ScenesMale Guest: (to the Maitre d') Good evening. (Shakes his hand)ScenesChandler: (finds his money) Ahh-hahaha! (Turns around to give the Maitre d' his money, but he isn't there anymore)

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Phoebe comes up the stairs and hears drumming coming from Joey and Rachel's, so she enters smiling and then sees that Rachel, not Joey, is the one playing.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (stopping at Phoebe’s entrance) Ha!ScenesPhoebe: So you like the drums! That's, that's great! Y’know, I was worried, that, you know, they would maybe an unbearable living situation. All right, okay, well, apparently not! So, yay!ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, Pheebs, check it out, we already learned a song. (To Rachel) Ready? One, two, three, four...Scenes[Rachel hits some tom-toms and ends up on the 'crash'-cymbal, which is in fact a ride-cymbal, but whatever...]ScenesRachel and Joey: Tequila!!ScenesPhoebe: That's fun. (She exits disappointedly.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Gunther is serving Chandler and Monica coffee.]
rows.Content: Gunther: Here you go.ScenesChandler: Thank you Gunther, put it there. (He gets up, and shakes Gunther's hand. A bunch of coins fall out his hand. He sits down next to Monica.) Definitely not easier with coins. (Joey gets up and picks up the coins. Chandler thinks, Joey is just helping him to pick them up.) Thank you.ScenesJoey: Thank you. (He gets up and puts on his jacket.) (Phoebe enters) Hey Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Here. (Gives her the coins) Now I only owe you $49.50.ScenesChandler: Hey Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! (she sits down next to him)ScenesChandler: If you wanna give Joey a Christmas present that disrupts the entire building, why not get him something a little bit more subtle, like a wrecking ball, or a vile of small pox to release in the hallway?ScenesMonica: It's not just the drum noise. Every five minutes, Joey throws his sticks in the air, and I have to hear, "Oh my eye! Oh god, my eye!" I mean, it is so annoying.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, thank you. You see, this is how normal people are supposed to react to drums.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you got Joey drums to annoy Rachel, so she wouldn't wanna live there anymore?ScenesPhoebe: Maybe on some level.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is sitting behind the drums wearing safety goggles, hitting them with his sticks as Rachel watches.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Joey, y’know that you could just not throw the sticks up in the air.ScenesJoey: What is Rock 'n' Roll about that?ScenesPhoebe: (entering with an aquarium covered by a towel) Hey, Joey, I got you another present. (She puts it on the counter)ScenesJoey: Oh wait, before you tell me what it is! (He plays a drum-roll) Okay, what is it?ScenesPhoebe: It's a…tarantula! (Joey almost falls down from his drum-stool jumping up) Oh! God! Rachel, look, I'm sorry. What was I thinking giving Joey this big, gross, scary spider in such a poorly constructed cage?ScenesRachel: What are you talking about? I love them! (Looks into the cage) Yeah, I had a tarantula when I was a kid. But it-it died, because my cat ate it. And then, then my cat died. But Joey, isn't this cool?ScenesJoey: Is it on me? I feel, I feel like it's on me! I got, hey! (He storms into his room)ScenesRachel: Oh, isn't that adorable? Joey is afraid of the tarantula.ScenesPhoebe: (sarcastic) Ah, yeah, he's so adorable, God, he's just so much fun, Joey is the best, I'm glad you're having so much fun here. (She turns around, about to leave)ScenesRachel: What? Wait-wait a minute, what? Phoebe, what's the matter?ScenesPhoebe: Our apartment is ready.ScenesRachel: And that makes you angry because…ScenesPhoebe: Because you would rather live here with Joey.ScenesRachel: Where did you get that?ScenesPhoebe: Monica and Chandler said that you were having so much fun here. And apparently no amount of drums or tarantulas is gonna change that.ScenesRachel: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Hm?ScenesRachel: Did you get all this stuff for Joey to try and drive me out of the apartment? Honey, if you wanted to do that, you might as well just gotten him a fish, you know how fish freaked me out!ScenesPhoebe: (nods along) Fish!ScenesRachel: It wouldn't have mattered anyway, Phoebe, you and I are, are gonna live together, we're roommates; that's the deal.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, but I wanted you to want to live with me, but okay, if you're having so much fun over here…ScenesRachel: Oh, it's so much more fun with you.ScenesPhoebe: We did have fun, didn't we?ScenesRachel: We did!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, anyway, they say, if we want, we can see it tonight.ScenesRachel: Oh, I would love to!ScenesPhoebe: Yay, okay!ScenesRachel: Good, good, good, good, good. (She runs to the drums and gets the sticks)ScenesPhoebe: Great, all right, okay, and Monica ask me to make the drumming stop.ScenesRachel: (with the sticks in her hands) Um... (She goes to the tarantula-cage and puts the sticks into it) Done!

rows.Scenes: Halloween Adventure, a costume shop, there is a salesman behind the counter, Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesSalesman: Hello, Sir. You're here to return those pants?ScenesRoss: No, these are my pants.ScenesSalesman: Oh. Okay! How can I help you?ScenesRoss: Well, uh, do you have a Santa-outfit left?ScenesSalesman: Two days before Christmas? Sorry, man.ScenesRoss: Okay look, do-do, you have anything Christmassy? I promised my son, and I really don't want to disappoint him, um, come on, I…uh, you gotta have something.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica has just opened the door for Ross who is costumed as an Armadillo. Ben is standing next to her.]
rows.Content: Ross: I'm the holiday armadillo! I'm a friend of Santa's and he sent me here to wish you (Points to Ben) a Merry Christmas!ScenesMonica: What happened to Santa, Holiday Armadillo?ScenesRoss: (to Monica) Santa was unavailable so close to Christmas.ScenesMonica: Wow, come in, have a seat. You must be exhausted coming all the way from…Texas.ScenesBen: Texas?ScenesRoss: That's right, Ben. I'm Santa's representative for all the southern states. And Mexico! But, Santa sent me here to give you these presents, Ben. (He tries to bend down to pick up the bag with the presents, but can't because of the costume) Maybe the Lady will help me with these presents.Scenes[Monica picks up the bag, while Ross closes the door and hits Monica with his tail. They walk into the living room, and Monica empties the bag.]ScenesBen: Wow! Thanks!ScenesRoss: You're welcome, Ben. Merry Christmas, ooh, and Happy Hanukkah!ScenesBen: Are you for Hanukkah, too? Because I'm part-Jewish.ScenesRoss: (gasps) You are? Me, too!ScenesMonica: Because Armadillos also wandered in the desert?ScenesRoss: (to Monica) You wanna wander in the hall? (to Ben) Ooh, hey Ben, what if the Holiday Armadillo told you all about the festival of lights?ScenesBen: Cool!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesMonica: Come on Ben.Scenes[Monica and Ben sit down on the couch.]ScenesRoss: Years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees...ScenesChandler: (entering in a Santa costume) Ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas!ScenesBen: Santa! (Runs to Chandler and hugs him)ScenesChandler: Hey! (Grunts as Ben hits him at full speed.)ScenesRoss: What are you doing here, Santa?ScenesChandler: Well, I'm here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weird…turtle-man?ScenesRoss: I'm the Holiday Armadillo, your part-Jewish friend. You sent me here to give Ben some presents. Remember?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesBen: Did you bring me any presents, Santa?ScenesChandler: You bet I did, Ben, put it there! (He shakes Ben's hand, but the money falls out of his hands) (to Monica) Well, it would have worked this time, if his hands weren't so damn small! (Realizes, that Ben is standing right there) Ho, ho, ho!ScenesMonica: Okay Ben, why don't you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo, and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There's a sentence, I never thought I'd say.Scenes[They walk to the kitchen; everyone is lowering their voices]ScenesRoss: (to Chandler) What are you doing?ScenesChandler: You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!ScenesRoss: Thank you, but, but you gotta leave.ScenesChandler: Why?ScenesRoss: Because, I'm finally getting him excited about Hanukkah, and, and you're-you’re wrecking it.ScenesChandler: But I didn't get to shape my belly like a bowl full of jelly.ScenesRoss: I'm sorry, Chandler but this, this is really important to me.ScenesChandler: Fine, I'll give the suit back.Scenes[Ross turns around and walks back to Ben.]ScenesMonica: (to Chandler) Hey, you think, you can keep it another night? (She has a really teasing look on her face and keeps twirling Chandler's beard.)ScenesChandler: Santa? Really?ScenesMonica: Yes, is that okay?ScenesChandler: Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: Then it's okay! (They kiss.)ScenesRoss: Okay Ben, Santa has to go. Say good-bye!ScenesBen: No! Why does he have to go?ScenesChandler: Because, if Santa and the Holiday…Armadillo? (Ross nods) ...are ever in the same room for too long the universe will implode. Merry Christmas!ScenesBen: No! Why can't the Armadillo leave? I want Santa!ScenesRoss: Fine, I-I give up. Santa, Santa can stay.ScenesChandler: Well, I'll stay, but only because I wanna hear about Hanukkah. Ben, will you sit here with Santa and learn about Hanukkah?ScenesBen: Okay, Santa!Scenes(Ross mouths to Chandler, "Thank you," and he mouths, "You’re welcome," back.)ScenesRoss: All right, it's time for the story of Hanukkah. Years and years ago, there were these people called the Maccabees.Scenes[Joey enters in a Superman-costume]ScenesJoey: (entering wearing a Superman costume) Merry Christmas!

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel's, they are entering to check out the newly refurbished apartment.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh wow! Look at this place!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, this is terrible. Oh, they’ve made so many changes I can’t even feel my grandmother’s presence anymore—Ooh! New sconces!ScenesRachel: (yelling from another room) Oh my God!ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRachel: (returning) Okay, remember uh, remember how you told me that your grandmother put up that wall to make that into two bedrooms?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesRachel: And remember how you always said you were afraid the landlord would find out and then tear it down?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Do you really not know where I’m going with this? (Phoebe nods, "No.") It left! It’s one huge room!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! (She runs to see.) (Running back, excitedly) Oh! Wow!!!ScenesRachel: See?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I guess we’ll just have to put the wall back up.ScenesRachel: You can’t, because of the new skylight!ScenesPhoebe: There’s a skylight?! (Runs to see and yells from the bedroom.) Wow!!ScenesRachel: So what should we do? Should we start looking for a new place?ScenesPhoebe: (returning slowly) Y’know I’m-I’m sensing that um, my grandmother would not be comfortable with that.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah? Startin’ to feel her again there are we?ScenesPhoebe: A little bit, yeah.ScenesRachel: Pheebs is your grandmother maybe saying that you should live here alone?ScenesPhoebe: You heard her too?! You have the gift!ScenesRachel: Phoebe, it’s okay. I like living with Joey.ScenesPhoebe: Are you sure?ScenesRachel: Oh please, I hate packing, it’s closer to work, and we do have fun. Although, I’m really gonna miss living with you.ScenesPhoebe: Oh me too.ScenesRachel: I know. (They hug.) Oh-oh, wait did you hear that-hear that? Listen, I’m gettin’ something from your grandmother, she said that since you get to keep the one bedroom apartment you should give Rachel the purple chair?ScenesPhoebe: No, I do not hear that.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Santa (Chandler), Superman (Joey), Ben, and Monica are listening to the Holiday Armadillo (Ross) finish telling the story of Hanukkah.]
rows.Content: Ross: …and the miracle was that that little bit of oil that should’ve just lasted just one day, burned for…ScenesBen: (answering him) Eight whole days.ScenesRoss: That’s right, and that’s why we celebrate Hanukkah today. The end.ScenesBen: Awesome!ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesChandler: My favorite part was when Superman flew all the Jews out of Egypt. (Glaring at Joey who’s nodding.)ScenesRoss: The Armadillo was actually not so thrilled about that part! Okay Ben, it’s time to light the Hanukkah candles! (Santa, Superman, Monica, Ben, and the Holiday Armadillo go over to the menorah to light the candles.)ScenesRachel: (entering with Phoebe) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesRachel: (seeing the collection of characters.) Wow! It looks like the Easter Bunny’s funeral in here.ScenesRoss: Come on, come on, we’re-we’re-we’re lighting the candles!ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.Scenes(They both go over to light the candles.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I understand why Superman is here, but why is there a porcupine at the Easter Bunny’s funeral?ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is closing the door on the tarantula cage.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I got it!ScenesJoey: (yelling from the bedroom) Is it back in the cage?ScenesRachel: Its back in cage!ScenesJoey: Cage closed?ScenesRachel: Joey, would you just come out here and stop being such a baby!Scenes(Joey throws open his door and stands there still in the Superman costume then slowly makes his way to the bathroom while keeping both eyes on the cage.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With the Holiday ArmadilloScenesWritten by: Greg MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is on the phone, Rachel and Monica are sitting in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Buh-bye. (Hangs up the phone) I just got us reservations at Michelle’s and tickets to the Musicman to celebrate our first holiday season as a betroughed couple.ScenesMonica: Betrothed… (Corrects him)ScenesChandler: …betrothed couple.ScenesPhoebe: (entering carrying a skull) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRachel and Monica: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Haaaa... (Puts the skull on the table) ... ahhhh!ScenesChandler: Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Huh?ScenesChandler: Skull?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, it's my mom's.ScenesRachel: (freaking out) Oh my god!!ScenesPhoebe: No, no, no. It's not! It's not my mom. It belonged to mom. Yeah, no, she used to put it out every Christmas to remind us, that even though it's Christmas, people still die. And, you can put candy in it. (She grabs the skull, pulls out a stick of licorice, and takes a bite.)ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesMonica: (Offering Ross the skull) Licorice?ScenesRoss: (Thinking it over) Sure! (Takes one) Hey, I just found out, I get Ben for the holidays this year.ScenesAll: Ohh! That's great!ScenesMonica: Are you gonna dress up as Santa?ScenesRoss: Nope. I mean, I know Susan does every year, but I think I wanna take this year to teach him all about Hanukkah.ScenesPhoebe: And maybe I could teach Ben about the Christmas skull and how people die.ScenesRachel: You may need to use this year to teach Ben about Phoebe.ScenesRoss: Hmm.Scenes(Joey comes out of the bathroom reading a newspaper)ScenesJoey: Hey. (He exits)ScenesRachel: (to Monica) Did you know he was in there?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: How long have we been home?ScenesMonica: About a half an hour.ScenesChandler: Lovely!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is getting a cup of coffee and sits down next to Monica.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey, you know what I was thinking? When we get married, are you gonna change your last name to Bing?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: Why not?ScenesMonica: Bing's weird.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Oh, hey, you guys!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey. Guess what! My landlord just called and my apartment is gonna get ready soon, so I guess I'll be moving out.ScenesMonica: Ahh, Phoebe, I'm gonna miss you!ScenesPhoebe: Yes, you will be very sad. All right, well I gotta go tell Rachel the good news.ScenesChandler: Ohh! You guys gonna be living together again?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, why not?ScenesChandler: Well, she's just so much fun with Joey, I just assumed, she'd still be living with him.ScenesPhoebe: Why do you think, she's having so much fun living with Joey?ScenesChandler: No reason, except…she…told…me.ScenesPhoebe: Really? So she said, she didn’t wanna live with me anymore?ScenesChandler: No! No, she didn't say that. I-I-I think you should talk to Monica now.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, don't worry about it. I'm sure she wants to live with you.ScenesPhoebe: You're sure? You're absolutely sure?ScenesMonica: Well, no. But, um, I bet she probably does.ScenesPhoebe: Probably? Yeah, I don't like that word. (Chandler and Monica look surprised) Kind of what ‘probably’ really means. Yeah, uh-huh. Yeah, oh, "Your mom probably won't kill herself," y’know? I'm sorry, but I'm not hanging all my hopes of Rachel and I living together on-on "Probably!" Y’know? You gotta take care of yourselves! (She starts to walk out) In this world history teaches us nothing! (Exits)ScenesChandler: Bing doesn't seem so weird now, does it?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is sitting behind a red drum set.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey! Great, you’re home! Guess what Phoebe got me for Christmas! (Starts drumming.)ScenesRachel: Drums?ScenesJoey: (yelling) No! Drums!

rows.Scenes: Michelle's, Chandler and Monica enter.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (to the Maitre d') Hi, could we get two burritos to go, please? (Laughs.)ScenesMonica: I'm sorry. But not that sorry, 'cause you don't have to live with it. Um, we have a reservation under the name Chandler Bing.ScenesMaitre d': Oh-kay, we'll have a table for you in about 45 minutes.ScenesChandler: Forty-five minutes? We have tickets to the Musicman at 8:00.ScenesMaitre d': I'm sorry. Christmas is a very busy time, sir.ScenesChandler: Is this because of the burrito thing?ScenesMonica: (pulling Chandler away from the Maitre d') You need to give him money.ScenesChandler: Give him money? It was a joke!ScenesMonica: No, to get a table! Places like are always shakin’ you down. Everybody wants to be paid off.ScenesChandler: Right, calm down, O'Mally. I'll slip him some money.ScenesMonica: You've got to be smooth about it.ScenesChandler: Hey, I can be smooth. (Walks back to the Maitre d', very smoothly) Listen, we're a little bit in a hurry, so, if you can get us a table a little quicker, I'd appreciate it. (Shakes his hand)ScenesMaitre d': Of course, sir.ScenesChandler: Okay. (Walks back to Monica)ScenesMonica: How did it go?ScenesChandler: Had the money in the wrong hand. (Shows her his left hand with the money in it)

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross is whirling Ben around.]
rows.Content: Ross: Wooooooo, hehehe. Hey, ahh, you don't feel like you're gonna throw up, do ya?ScenesBen: No.ScenesRoss: Well, I do, so let's... (Ben and Ross sit down on the couch) So, Ben, you uh, you know what holiday is coming up, don't ya?ScenesBen: Christmas.ScenesRoss: Yep, and you know what other holiday is coming up?ScenesBen: Christmas eve.ScenesRoss: Yes, but also (Pauses to let Ben answer, but he doesn’t.) Hanukkah! See, you're part Jewish, and-and Hanukkah is a Jewish holiday.ScenesBen: Santa has reindeers that can fly!ScenesRoss: Right, um, but, on Hanukkah, Hanukkah is a celebration of a miracle. See, years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees.ScenesBen: (singing) Jingle bells, jingle bells...ScenesRoss: (interrupts him) Okay, that's right, yes, but on Hanukkah, uh, we sing, uh (Sings) Dreidel, dreidel, dreidel, I made you out of clay.ScenesBen: (singing) Rudolph, the red-nosed reindeer...ScenesRoss: (interrupts him again) Okay, it's not a contest.ScenesBen: When is Santa coming?ScenesRoss: Well, how about this year, instead of Santa, we have fun celebrating Hanukkah?ScenesBen: No Santa? Was I bad?ScenesRoss: No! Oh, no-no-no. Hey, you weren't bad, you've been very good, Ben.ScenesBen: Santa's mad at me.ScenesRoss: No, hey-hey, come on, (He grabs Ben and sits him on his lap) Ben, Santa is not mad at you, okay? Hey, you're-you're his favorite little guy!ScenesBen: So Santa's coming?ScenesRoss: (disappointed) Yes! Santa's coming!

rows.Scenes: Michelle's, Chandler and Monica are discussing how to bribe the Maitre d'.]
rows.Content: Monica: It's easy! Just keep it casual! Give him a kind word, shake his hand and give him the money!ScenesChandler: How do you know so much about this?ScenesMonica: I don't know.ScenesChandler: Richard used to do it, didn't he?ScenesMonica: We'd be eating our soup right now.ScenesChandler: Mustached bastard…ScenesMonica: (sees two people exit) Okay, those people just left, come on! Quick! Give him the money and get their table!ScenesChandler: (walks up to the Maitre d') Excuse me...Scenes[Chandler can't find his money in the pocket. In the meantime, another couple shows up, and Chandler turns away to look for his money]ScenesMale Guest: (to the Maitre d') Good evening. (Shakes his hand)ScenesChandler: (finds his money) Ahh-hahaha! (Turns around to give the Maitre d' his money, but he isn't there anymore)

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Phoebe comes up the stairs and hears drumming coming from Joey and Rachel's, so she enters smiling and then sees that Rachel, not Joey, is the one playing.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (stopping at Phoebe’s entrance) Ha!ScenesPhoebe: So you like the drums! That's, that's great! Y’know, I was worried, that, you know, they would maybe an unbearable living situation. All right, okay, well, apparently not! So, yay!ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, Pheebs, check it out, we already learned a song. (To Rachel) Ready? One, two, three, four...Scenes[Rachel hits some tom-toms and ends up on the 'crash'-cymbal, which is in fact a ride-cymbal, but whatever...]ScenesRachel and Joey: Tequila!!ScenesPhoebe: That's fun. (She exits disappointedly.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Gunther is serving Chandler and Monica coffee.]
rows.Content: Gunther: Here you go.ScenesChandler: Thank you Gunther, put it there. (He gets up, and shakes Gunther's hand. A bunch of coins fall out his hand. He sits down next to Monica.) Definitely not easier with coins. (Joey gets up and picks up the coins. Chandler thinks, Joey is just helping him to pick them up.) Thank you.ScenesJoey: Thank you. (He gets up and puts on his jacket.) (Phoebe enters) Hey Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Here. (Gives her the coins) Now I only owe you $49.50.ScenesChandler: Hey Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! (she sits down next to him)ScenesChandler: If you wanna give Joey a Christmas present that disrupts the entire building, why not get him something a little bit more subtle, like a wrecking ball, or a vile of small pox to release in the hallway?ScenesMonica: It's not just the drum noise. Every five minutes, Joey throws his sticks in the air, and I have to hear, "Oh my eye! Oh god, my eye!" I mean, it is so annoying.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, thank you. You see, this is how normal people are supposed to react to drums.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you got Joey drums to annoy Rachel, so she wouldn't wanna live there anymore?ScenesPhoebe: Maybe on some level.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is sitting behind the drums wearing safety goggles, hitting them with his sticks as Rachel watches.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Joey, y’know that you could just not throw the sticks up in the air.ScenesJoey: What is Rock 'n' Roll about that?ScenesPhoebe: (entering with an aquarium covered by a towel) Hey, Joey, I got you another present. (She puts it on the counter)ScenesJoey: Oh wait, before you tell me what it is! (He plays a drum-roll) Okay, what is it?ScenesPhoebe: It's a…tarantula! (Joey almost falls down from his drum-stool jumping up) Oh! God! Rachel, look, I'm sorry. What was I thinking giving Joey this big, gross, scary spider in such a poorly constructed cage?ScenesRachel: What are you talking about? I love them! (Looks into the cage) Yeah, I had a tarantula when I was a kid. But it-it died, because my cat ate it. And then, then my cat died. But Joey, isn't this cool?ScenesJoey: Is it on me? I feel, I feel like it's on me! I got, hey! (He storms into his room)ScenesRachel: Oh, isn't that adorable? Joey is afraid of the tarantula.ScenesPhoebe: (sarcastic) Ah, yeah, he's so adorable, God, he's just so much fun, Joey is the best, I'm glad you're having so much fun here. (She turns around, about to leave)ScenesRachel: What? Wait-wait a minute, what? Phoebe, what's the matter?ScenesPhoebe: Our apartment is ready.ScenesRachel: And that makes you angry because…ScenesPhoebe: Because you would rather live here with Joey.ScenesRachel: Where did you get that?ScenesPhoebe: Monica and Chandler said that you were having so much fun here. And apparently no amount of drums or tarantulas is gonna change that.ScenesRachel: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Hm?ScenesRachel: Did you get all this stuff for Joey to try and drive me out of the apartment? Honey, if you wanted to do that, you might as well just gotten him a fish, you know how fish freaked me out!ScenesPhoebe: (nods along) Fish!ScenesRachel: It wouldn't have mattered anyway, Phoebe, you and I are, are gonna live together, we're roommates; that's the deal.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, but I wanted you to want to live with me, but okay, if you're having so much fun over here…ScenesRachel: Oh, it's so much more fun with you.ScenesPhoebe: We did have fun, didn't we?ScenesRachel: We did!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, anyway, they say, if we want, we can see it tonight.ScenesRachel: Oh, I would love to!ScenesPhoebe: Yay, okay!ScenesRachel: Good, good, good, good, good. (She runs to the drums and gets the sticks)ScenesPhoebe: Great, all right, okay, and Monica ask me to make the drumming stop.ScenesRachel: (with the sticks in her hands) Um... (She goes to the tarantula-cage and puts the sticks into it) Done!

rows.Scenes: Halloween Adventure, a costume shop, there is a salesman behind the counter, Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesSalesman: Hello, Sir. You're here to return those pants?ScenesRoss: No, these are my pants.ScenesSalesman: Oh. Okay! How can I help you?ScenesRoss: Well, uh, do you have a Santa-outfit left?ScenesSalesman: Two days before Christmas? Sorry, man.ScenesRoss: Okay look, do-do, you have anything Christmassy? I promised my son, and I really don't want to disappoint him, um, come on, I…uh, you gotta have something.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica has just opened the door for Ross who is costumed as an Armadillo. Ben is standing next to her.]
rows.Content: Ross: I'm the holiday armadillo! I'm a friend of Santa's and he sent me here to wish you (Points to Ben) a Merry Christmas!ScenesMonica: What happened to Santa, Holiday Armadillo?ScenesRoss: (to Monica) Santa was unavailable so close to Christmas.ScenesMonica: Wow, come in, have a seat. You must be exhausted coming all the way from…Texas.ScenesBen: Texas?ScenesRoss: That's right, Ben. I'm Santa's representative for all the southern states. And Mexico! But, Santa sent me here to give you these presents, Ben. (He tries to bend down to pick up the bag with the presents, but can't because of the costume) Maybe the Lady will help me with these presents.Scenes[Monica picks up the bag, while Ross closes the door and hits Monica with his tail. They walk into the living room, and Monica empties the bag.]ScenesBen: Wow! Thanks!ScenesRoss: You're welcome, Ben. Merry Christmas, ooh, and Happy Hanukkah!ScenesBen: Are you for Hanukkah, too? Because I'm part-Jewish.ScenesRoss: (gasps) You are? Me, too!ScenesMonica: Because Armadillos also wandered in the desert?ScenesRoss: (to Monica) You wanna wander in the hall? (to Ben) Ooh, hey Ben, what if the Holiday Armadillo told you all about the festival of lights?ScenesBen: Cool!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesMonica: Come on Ben.Scenes[Monica and Ben sit down on the couch.]ScenesRoss: Years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees...ScenesChandler: (entering in a Santa costume) Ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas!ScenesBen: Santa! (Runs to Chandler and hugs him)ScenesChandler: Hey! (Grunts as Ben hits him at full speed.)ScenesRoss: What are you doing here, Santa?ScenesChandler: Well, I'm here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weird…turtle-man?ScenesRoss: I'm the Holiday Armadillo, your part-Jewish friend. You sent me here to give Ben some presents. Remember?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesBen: Did you bring me any presents, Santa?ScenesChandler: You bet I did, Ben, put it there! (He shakes Ben's hand, but the money falls out of his hands) (to Monica) Well, it would have worked this time, if his hands weren't so damn small! (Realizes, that Ben is standing right there) Ho, ho, ho!ScenesMonica: Okay Ben, why don't you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo, and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There's a sentence, I never thought I'd say.Scenes[They walk to the kitchen; everyone is lowering their voices]ScenesRoss: (to Chandler) What are you doing?ScenesChandler: You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!ScenesRoss: Thank you, but, but you gotta leave.ScenesChandler: Why?ScenesRoss: Because, I'm finally getting him excited about Hanukkah, and, and you're-you’re wrecking it.ScenesChandler: But I didn't get to shape my belly like a bowl full of jelly.ScenesRoss: I'm sorry, Chandler but this, this is really important to me.ScenesChandler: Fine, I'll give the suit back.Scenes[Ross turns around and walks back to Ben.]ScenesMonica: (to Chandler) Hey, you think, you can keep it another night? (She has a really teasing look on her face and keeps twirling Chandler's beard.)ScenesChandler: Santa? Really?ScenesMonica: Yes, is that okay?ScenesChandler: Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: Then it's okay! (They kiss.)ScenesRoss: Okay Ben, Santa has to go. Say good-bye!ScenesBen: No! Why does he have to go?ScenesChandler: Because, if Santa and the Holiday…Armadillo? (Ross nods) ...are ever in the same room for too long the universe will implode. Merry Christmas!ScenesBen: No! Why can't the Armadillo leave? I want Santa!ScenesRoss: Fine, I-I give up. Santa, Santa can stay.ScenesChandler: Well, I'll stay, but only because I wanna hear about Hanukkah. Ben, will you sit here with Santa and learn about Hanukkah?ScenesBen: Okay, Santa!Scenes(Ross mouths to Chandler, "Thank you," and he mouths, "You’re welcome," back.)ScenesRoss: All right, it's time for the story of Hanukkah. Years and years ago, there were these people called the Maccabees.Scenes[Joey enters in a Superman-costume]ScenesJoey: (entering wearing a Superman costume) Merry Christmas!

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel's, they are entering to check out the newly refurbished apartment.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh wow! Look at this place!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, this is terrible. Oh, they’ve made so many changes I can’t even feel my grandmother’s presence anymore—Ooh! New sconces!ScenesRachel: (yelling from another room) Oh my God!ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRachel: (returning) Okay, remember uh, remember how you told me that your grandmother put up that wall to make that into two bedrooms?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesRachel: And remember how you always said you were afraid the landlord would find out and then tear it down?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Do you really not know where I’m going with this? (Phoebe nods, "No.") It left! It’s one huge room!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! (She runs to see.) (Running back, excitedly) Oh! Wow!!!ScenesRachel: See?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I guess we’ll just have to put the wall back up.ScenesRachel: You can’t, because of the new skylight!ScenesPhoebe: There’s a skylight?! (Runs to see and yells from the bedroom.) Wow!!ScenesRachel: So what should we do? Should we start looking for a new place?ScenesPhoebe: (returning slowly) Y’know I’m-I’m sensing that um, my grandmother would not be comfortable with that.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah? Startin’ to feel her again there are we?ScenesPhoebe: A little bit, yeah.ScenesRachel: Pheebs is your grandmother maybe saying that you should live here alone?ScenesPhoebe: You heard her too?! You have the gift!ScenesRachel: Phoebe, it’s okay. I like living with Joey.ScenesPhoebe: Are you sure?ScenesRachel: Oh please, I hate packing, it’s closer to work, and we do have fun. Although, I’m really gonna miss living with you.ScenesPhoebe: Oh me too.ScenesRachel: I know. (They hug.) Oh-oh, wait did you hear that-hear that? Listen, I’m gettin’ something from your grandmother, she said that since you get to keep the one bedroom apartment you should give Rachel the purple chair?ScenesPhoebe: No, I do not hear that.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Santa (Chandler), Superman (Joey), Ben, and Monica are listening to the Holiday Armadillo (Ross) finish telling the story of Hanukkah.]
rows.Content: Ross: …and the miracle was that that little bit of oil that should’ve just lasted just one day, burned for…ScenesBen: (answering him) Eight whole days.ScenesRoss: That’s right, and that’s why we celebrate Hanukkah today. The end.ScenesBen: Awesome!ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesChandler: My favorite part was when Superman flew all the Jews out of Egypt. (Glaring at Joey who’s nodding.)ScenesRoss: The Armadillo was actually not so thrilled about that part! Okay Ben, it’s time to light the Hanukkah candles! (Santa, Superman, Monica, Ben, and the Holiday Armadillo go over to the menorah to light the candles.)ScenesRachel: (entering with Phoebe) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesRachel: (seeing the collection of characters.) Wow! It looks like the Easter Bunny’s funeral in here.ScenesRoss: Come on, come on, we’re-we’re-we’re lighting the candles!ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.Scenes(They both go over to light the candles.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I understand why Superman is here, but why is there a porcupine at the Easter Bunny’s funeral?ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is closing the door on the tarantula cage.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I got it!ScenesJoey: (yelling from the bedroom) Is it back in the cage?ScenesRachel: Its back in cage!ScenesJoey: Cage closed?ScenesRachel: Joey, would you just come out here and stop being such a baby!Scenes(Joey throws open his door and stands there still in the Superman costume then slowly makes his way to the bathroom while keeping both eyes on the cage.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where They’re Up All NightScenesWritten by: Zack RosenblattScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: The Building’s Roof, the entire gang plus Tag are there to look for a comet. They’re looking for a comet on a roof of a New York apartment building. Yeah, that’s realistic. You might as well look for the moon on a bright sunny day.]
rows.Content: Monica: (looking up) Ross, when’s this comet thing start?ScenesRoss: Well, technically it seven billion years ago… (Well, technically you’d be able to see it for days, well nights; that is if you could see it with all of the bright lights of New York.)ScenesAll: (groaning) Oh no! Oh no! (They all start to get up a leave.)ScenesRoss: Okay! Okay! Fine, I’ll stop! No teaching, okay? We’ll just watch the pretty light streaking across the sky. (Comets don’t streak across the sky, meteors do.) Okay? Who’s official name is Bapstein-King.ScenesAll: Okay! Okay! (They start to leave again.)ScenesPhoebe: (looking up) There it is! Oh, look at that! Isn’t Mother Nature amazing?ScenesChandler: (looking up with her) That’s a plane!ScenesPhoebe: Well, all right. 1700 bags of peanuts flying that high, that’s pretty amazing too.ScenesTag: Hey, I wonder if you can see my apartment from up here.ScenesRachel: No. No, you can’t.ScenesTag: What?ScenesRachel: Oh I don’t-I don’t know.ScenesRoss: Man, look at all those stars! (Yeah, you can see what? Five of them from the city?) Infinite space. It really, really makes you wonder, doesn’t it?ScenesJoey: (looking through his binoculars at a nearby building) Y’know what else makes you wonder?ScenesRoss: Huh?ScenesJoey: Check out the rack on this chick! (Turns around to point it out to Ross and finds that Ross is glaring at him. So he quickly puts his binoculars to his eyes and starts looking for the comet.)ScenesOpening Credits
