rows.Scenes: The Roof, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, we’ve been out here for two hours and we haven’t seen any stupid comets. Can we go now? I mean, Chandler’s getting chilly. (She walks over to where Chandler is bundled up in a big coat and shivering.)ScenesChandler: (with a quivering voice) No, I’m not!ScenesJoey: Then why are you wearing Monica’s jacket?ScenesChandler: Because it’s flattering! (Shivers harder) Come on Monica! Come on Monica! (He goes inside.)ScenesRachel: Yeah actually, I think we’re gonna take off too. We rented a movie.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! I won’t say, ‘no’ to a movie!ScenesRachel: Uh Pheebs, we just actually kinda wanted to be alone.ScenesPhoebe: Shh! Get me out of here.ScenesRachel: Oh. (They leave, leaving just Joey and Ross.)ScenesJoey: (whispering) Ross!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesJoey: Come here, check this out!ScenesRoss: What? Is it the comet? (Runs over to where Joey’s standing.)ScenesJoey: No! No-no. Look, there’s a bug stuck in tar right here. (Bends down to get a closer look.)ScenesRoss: Joey come—I can’t believe—I bring you here to see the Bapstein-King comet, one of nature’s most spectacular phenomenon, and all you care about are bugs stuck in tar and-and some woman!ScenesJoey: (standing up) Y’know, there’s two women dude.ScenesRoss: Show me where?ScenesJoey: Right-right up here. (Starts looking at them through a piece of pipe.)ScenesRoss: (noticing the pipe and looking at the door) Joey where’s the pipe that was holding the door open?ScenesJoey: (annoyed) I don’t know! (Goes back to looking through the pipe.) (Pause) Yeah, I do.ScenesRoss: Joey!ScenesJoey: What?! All right—Hey! Don’t look at me! You’re the one who wanted to come up and look for some stupid Burger King comet!ScenesRoss: It’s called the Bapstein-King comet, okay? (Joey starts to groan.) Hey! Hey! Bapstein was a very well respected astronomer!ScenesJoey: (covering his ears and yelling) Oh no! No! No! (He starts banging on the door.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, Monica is sleeping and Chandler’s sitting in bed, wide awake.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (whispering) Monica!ScenesMonica: She’s sleeping.ScenesChandler: I know, just quick-quick question, quick question. Which one was Deep Impact and which one was Armageddon?ScenesMonica: Deep Impact was the one with Robert Duval, Armageddon is what’s going to happen to you if you wake me up.ScenesChandler: Sorry, I just…can’t sleep. Ooh! (Turns on the light and Monica groans.) Where is that book that you are reading with the two women who were ice-skating and wearing, wearing those hats with the flowers on it? Because every time I look at that cover I’m like…(Fake snores.)ScenesMonica: It is in the living room where there is also a light! And no one will kick you in the shin.ScenesChandler: What?! (Monica kicks him in the shin.) Ow! (He gets out of bed and heads into the living room.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe's apartment, there is a beeping noise coming from the living room and Phoebe sleepily goes to investigate.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (crossing her fingers and closing her eyes) Please don’t be a space ship. Please don’t be a space ship. (She turns on the light and looks around and finds that it’s the smoke detector that’s beeping.) Oh thank God! (She moves a chair over and starts to investigate how to make the beeping turn off, in frustration she yanks the thing off of the wall. She sets it down and heads for bed, just as she gets there it beeps again. She opens the cover and removes the battery, but it still beeps.) How could you be beeping?! I just disconnected you! I took out your battery! How can…ScenesSmoke Detector: Beep!ScenesPhoebe: Don’t interrupt me!!

rows.Scenes: The Roof, Ross and Joey are banging on the door.]
rows.Content: Ross: Rachel!! Monica!!ScenesJoey: Come on!Scenes(Ross gets fed up with Joey’s banging and stops him by pulling him away from the door.)ScenesRoss: I can’t believe this!!ScenesJoey: All right well, y’know…I guess we know what we have to do to get down.ScenesRoss: (standing at the edge of the roof) Yeah, I guess we don’t have a choice. (Screaming to the street) Help us! Please help us! We’re stuck up on the roof and we can’t get down!!!ScenesJoey: Ross. I was thinking we could just go down the fire escape. (Points it out.)ScenesRoss: (To Joey) I know, I wasn’t finished. (Joey motions him to finish.) (Yelling at the street) But don’t worry! We’re gonna go down the fire escape!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's kitchen, Chandler has a jug of milk in his hands and decides to make some warm milk. He opens up the cabinet to get a pot and manages to knock several other pots onto the floor making a lot of noise.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Shhhhhhhhh!!! (Monica enters) I’m sorry, I thought maybe I’d make some warm milk and it would help me sleep.ScenesMonica: With a wok? (Chandler’s holding a wok.) I thought you were going to read my boring book to put you asleep.ScenesChandler: It got interesting! Damn you Oprah!ScenesMonica: Here, let me make the milk, I’m up anyway.ScenesChandler: Hey, y’know what we can do? Y’know, now that we are up? We can just like talk to each other all night long, y’know like we did when we were first going out. It’d be fun!ScenesMonica: Okay that does sound like fun.ScenesChandler: Okay, so how bummed were you when the second sister died huh?ScenesMonica: The second sister dies?!ScenesChandler: (Pause) No. No, I-I was, I was talking about the book I was reading.ScenesMonica: The second sister dies in Archie and Jughead Double Digest?ScenesChandler: That’s correct.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel and Tag are making out on the couch.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You wanna go in the bedroom? It’s a little more comfortable.ScenesTag: Sure.ScenesRachel: Okay. (They start to head for the bedroom) Oh wait! Umm, did you send those contracts to Milan?ScenesTag: If this is your idea of sexy talk? (Shakes his head that it’s not working.)ScenesRachel: No seriously, y’know the contracts I gave you, did you overnight them?ScenesTag: What contracts?ScenesRachel: Okay please tell me that this is just one of your jokes that you do that I don’t get.ScenesTag: Like what?ScenesRachel: Y’know, like the thing when you put the phone in your pants? (He starts laughing.) Tag! I’m serious! This isn’t funny! Those contracts absolutely had to go out today!ScenesTag: Rach, I’m sorry, but you didn’t give me any contracts!ScenesRachel: Yes I did! And I put a little Post-It on it that said, "Must go out today," and underlined today three times and, and then I put a little heart in the corner because I didn’t want to seem to bossy.ScenesTag: I’m telling you, you never gave them to me.ScenesRachel: Y’know what Tag, if we went down to the office you would see those contracts sitting on your desk.ScenesTag: No, I would see you looking embarrassed because they are not on my desk!ScenesRachel: Or maybe you would see me looking embarrassed because you are talking on the phone with your crotch!ScenesTag: You wanna go down to the office right now?ScenesRachel: No! Come on its late, we’re not gonna go down to the office.ScenesTag: Okay I understand. (Sits down.) I wouldn’t want to be proved wrong either.ScenesRachel: Okay get your coat! (They get their coats and start to leave. Rachel suddenly stops and sticks the hand up the back of her shirt.) Oh! When did you unhook this? (Her bra.) Nice work!

rows.Scenes: The Fire Escape, Joey and Ross have reached the last landing. Joey is tugging on the ladder that extends to the ground, but it won’t budge.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right, it won’t go down any further. It’s stuck.ScenesRoss: Ugh. Well, we’re just gonna have to jump. (Joey looks at him.) Yeah. Now, we’re gonna have to make sure to land to the right of that patch of ice, okay? Not hit the dumpster on the other side and uh, and try to avoid that-that weird brownish red stuff in the middle. So, when you get down there…you go up to the roof and you let me in.ScenesJoey: Oh whoa-whoa wait a minute! I have to do it?!ScenesRoss: Yeah! Oh yeah, you’ll be fine! It-it’ll be uh, just like bungy jumping. Y’know? But instead of bouncing back up you-you won’t.ScenesJoey: What if I smack my head on the concrete?ScenesRoss: Well, I’m gonna lie to you Joey, it’s a possibility.ScenesJoey: (looks at the ground and at Ross) I don’t know Ross! I-I tell you what, let’s flip to see who does it, okay? You-you call it in the air, all right?ScenesRoss: Oh, all right. (Joey flips the coin.) Tails! (The coin bounces off of the landing above them and falls to the ground.) Can you-can you see what it is?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesRoss: Okay. Well, you be careful.ScenesJoey: What? No! No Ross! No-no! Stop! I’m not jumping! Okay, look I have an audition tomorrow and I can’t go if I break my leg.ScenesRoss: Well I’m jumping! I have a son! Okay? He won’t have a father if-if I die!ScenesJoey: Well all right so, it looks like we’re even!

rows.Scenes: Phoebe's apartment, Phoebe is still investigating the smoke detector trying to figure out how to stop the beeping.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay. So, this wire is connected to this wire which plugs into here. (She points at each as she says it.) Okay so, to get the beeping to stop all I have to do… (She picks up a shoe and proceeds to pummel the smoke detector. She then gets up and heads to bed, stops, quickly turns around, and is satisfied that the beeping has stopped.) Well done, Pheebs. (She resumes her trek to bed, but is stopped at the entrance to the hallway by the now steady and extremely loud tone emanating from the smoke detector.) (Yelling.) What do you want from me?!!!!!!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's bedroom, Monica is entering with a mug.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, here’s your milk. What do you want to talk about? (She sees that Chandler has fallen asleep and slams the door loudly to wake him up.)ScenesChandler: (startled) What? What? What?ScenesMonica: Ohh! Ohhhh! Were you sleeping sweetie? I’m sorry. Here. (Hands the mug of milk to him.)

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Outer Office, Tag and her are arriving.]
rows.Content: Tag: Okay! Feel free to look, but I’m telling you those contracts are not on this desk.ScenesRachel: Oh how can you possibly know? Look at this mess, Tag! I mean, this is what I’m talking about! You have to be organized! You’ve got newspapers! You’ve got magazines! You got—Ohh! (Finds a picture.) And who is this chippy? A little young for you Tag, but whatever.ScenesTag: It’s my sister.ScenesRachel: Okay, very cute braces. Anyway y’know what, the point is Tag, start looking because you are going to find those contracts on your desk. (She goes into her office.)ScenesTag: So when do you imagine you gave them to me? In the morning or in the afternoon?ScenesRachel: In the afternoon. Mr. Zelner came into my office after lunch. He put them on my desk, and then I put a Post-It on it (Looks down onto her desk and finds the folder with the Post-It on it that contains the contracts she imagined she gave Tag) that said, "Must go out today." So you just keep looking in there! All right?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s outer office, Tag has finished searching his desk and Rachel comes out to try to plant the folder on the desk.]
rows.Content: Tag: It’s not here.ScenesRachel: Puzzler. A bit of a puzzle. Why don’t you um, check the copy room, maybe you left the contracts in there?ScenesTag: How could I have left them in the copy room?ScenesRachel: I don’t know Tag! How can your genitals make phone calls? Okay? It’s not a perfect world! Just go please.ScenesTag: Fine.ScenesRachel: Thank you. (He leaves and she proceeds to plant the folder in his bottom drawer. She then picks up the phone and holds it to her breasts.) Hello? (Hangs up the phone.) I still don’t get it.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's bedroom, Chandler has his eyes closed, while Monica is fully awake.]
rows.Content: Monica: Are you still awake?ScenesChandler: Yeah! You?ScenesMonica: You do know that was me who just said that right? (He doesn’t respond and she turns on the light, waking him.) Hey. As long as we’re both up…ScenesChandler: (intrigued) Yeah? (Monica nods yes.) I hope you’re not thinking about cleaning the living room.

rows.Scenes: The fire escape, Joey and Ross are still trying to figure out how to get down.]
rows.Content: Joey: Man, I’m starving! What the hell was I thinking at dinner?! "Do you want soup or salad?" Both! Always order both!ScenesRoss: (looking in the window behind them) Y’know, y’know I’m lookin’ and I don’t think anyone’s home here. I say we just break the window, crawl through, and-and y’know explain later.ScenesJoey: Yeah? Really? No one’s home?ScenesRoss: I don’t think so. Hello? (Knocks on the glass, which angers the big, large, angry dog behind the glass and causes them to jump to the other side of the landing.) When you get in there… (Joey nods his disapproval.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s apartment building, in desperation she has wrapped up the smoke detector in a blanket and is going to throw it into the trash chute.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay, this is where you and I part ways. (She drops the blanket into the chute.) Noisy bitch!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's bedroom, Chandler is turning on the light to awaken a now sleeping Monica.]
rows.Content: Monica: What?! What are you doing?!ScenesChandler: Do you know what just happened?ScenesMonica: Yeah. We-we had sex and then we fell asleep.ScenesChandler: No. We were in the middle of sex…and you fell asleep.ScenesMonica: Nooo! No, that’s not true. No, best time ever! Yeah, you rocked me world! (She turns out the light to go back to sleep.)ScenesChandler: (turning the light back on) Monica?ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesChandler: I was giving you some of my best moves, and you missed it. So please wake up so we can do it right!ScenesMonica: Okay. Okay, I’m ready. Come on big fella!ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: Give me the good stuff.ScenesChandler: Yeah! (Monica falls asleep) No! No! No! Don’t fall asleep! Okay, I am going to make you some coffee. (Monica doesn’t move as he gets out of bed and as he’s heading for the door.) And I probably won’t spill coffee grounds all over the kitchen floor.ScenesMonica: Okay, I’m up! I’m up!

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s outer office, she’s returning with two coffee cups in hand to find Tag sitting there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi! I got you some coffee. To, uh… (She looks for a place to set it on his messy desk and he clears a spot for her to set it down.) …fair enough. So! Do you got anything for me?ScenesTag: Still no luck.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Did you check your entire desk! Did you check all the drawers!ScenesTag: Do you want me to check again?ScenesRachel: Well yeah, I wish that you would. (He opens the top drawer.) Well, no it’s not in there! (Closes it.) How about that drawer? (She points to the bottom one and he opens it. She doesn’t see the folder she planted and bends over to check.)ScenesTag: Well, it’s not out here. Is there any chance it could be in your office?ScenesRachel: (thinks) Y’know, I don’t-I don’t know. Let me, let me check. (As she heads for her office, she stops glances over her should at Tag, looks into her office, and finds the folder on her desk.)ScenesTag: (smirking) Any luck?ScenesRachel: Can I see you in my office for a minute?ScenesTag: (entering) Yeah? (She holds up the folder) You found them!! (Rachel is not amused, because she’s still going to try to blame him for her mistake like every ‘good’ boss.) Y’know what? I’m not even going to gloat. I’m just really relived this whole thing is over.ScenesRachel: You put these on my desk!ScenesTag: I did not!ScenesRachel: Oh really? So you’re saying they just slid out of your bottom drawer, crawled across the floor, then jumped on to my desk?! (I think Dogbert should have a line here.)ScenesTag: How did you know they were in my bottom drawer?ScenesRachel: (pause as she realizes her lame attempt to shift the blame has failed) I am so hot for you right now.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe's apartment, there is someone pounding on the door and Phoebe sleepily walks over and answers it. As she nears the door, the pounding stops and she can hear the smoke detector’s wail.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh my God! How did you get back here?!ScenesA Disembodied Voice: (yelling through the door) Phoebe Buffay?!ScenesPhoebe: (scared) Fire alarm? (She opens the door to reveal a fireman holding the blanket with the smoke detector.) Oh! Hi, officer—fireman, can-can I help you?ScenesThe Fireman: We found your fire alarm in the trash chute.ScenesPhoebe: That’s not mine.ScenesThe Fireman: Yes it is.ScenesPhoebe: How do you know?ScenesThe Fireman: The next time you want to dump a fire alarm in a trash chute, don’t wrap it in a blanket that says, "Property of Phoebe Buffay not Monica.ScenesPhoebe: Okay do you—Okay, do you have a search warrant? Because the last time I checked this was still America!ScenesThe Fireman: Please reattach this, it’s against the law to disconnect them.ScenesPhoebe: Fine! (She takes the blanket.) But please God; tell me how to stop them from going off!ScenesThe Fireman: There’s a reset button under the plastic cover.ScenesPhoebe: There’s a reset button?! Ugh, thank you! Thank you! (He exits and she goes to shut it off.) There’s a reset button! My God! Why didn’t I see that! (She takes off the plastic cover and looks for the button.) Reset button, reset button, where is there a reset button? (Finds it.) Oh here it is! (Picks it up off of the floor.) Oh! (She presses it hard, but of course it would help if the button was still attached to the detector. In frustration she presses it so hard it causes pain in her thumb.) Ohh, God!

rows.Scenes: The fire escape, Joey is now hanging off of the bottom rung of the ladder that won’t move and Ross is watching from above.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, do-do you have a good grip?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Okay, I’m going to start climb down you now.ScenesJoey: All right! Just hurry up!ScenesRoss: Okay. Now-now-now should I climb down your front so we’re face to face or-or should I climb down your back so we’re-we’re butt to face.ScenesJoey: I think face to face.ScenesRoss: I would say that.ScenesJoey: Face to face, yeah!ScenesRoss: Okay, here I go.ScenesJoey: All right.Scenes(Ross steps onto the bottom rung of the ladder and then steps on Joey’s chest.)ScenesJoey: (grunting) Oh my… How much do you weigh Ross?!ScenesRoss: I prefer not to answer that right now, I’m still carrying a little holiday weight.Scenes(Ross continues to climb down. He puts his other foot further down on Joey’s torso, but that doesn’t work very well and he’s forced to wrap his legs around Joey. Which then forces Joey to get a nice and close view of Ross’s crotch.)ScenesJoey: Y’know, when we talked about face to face, I don’t think we thought it all the way through.ScenesRoss: So what do you want me to do?ScenesJoey: Well, just shimmy down me and drop!Scenes(Ross continues his trek south, and when they get face to face.)ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesJoey: Hi.ScenesRoss: (looking down) M-maybe I should hang and you can climb down me.ScenesJoey: (angrily) Yeah? Maybe we should talk about that for a little while!ScenesRoss: It’s still looks pretty far!ScenesJoey: It’s not that far! Just drop!ScenesRoss: Do not rush me!!Scenes(Ross continues south and his now wrapped around Joey’s legs.)ScenesJoey: Ross, you should know that my pants are startin’ to come down and I’m not wearing any underwear!Scenes(Ross panics and falls off, dropping to the ground with a huge crash.)ScenesRoss: Oww!! My ankle! I really hurt my ankle! I think I twisted it when I—Ooh, a quarter!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's bedroom, they’re cuddling.]
rows.Content: Monica: That really was some of your best work.ScenesChandler: Hm-hmm, I told you! (Looks at the clock) I can’t believe that I’ve only got two hours before I call in sick for work.ScenesMonica: I have to be up in seven minutes.ScenesChandler: Well, you’re not gonna believe this, but if you have seven minutes…ScenesMonica: Really?!ScenesChandler: Do you wanna?ScenesMonica: Okay! You get the vacuum cleaner and I’ll get the furniture polish!Scenes(She runs off leaving a stunned Chandler behind.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Rosita DiesScenesTeleplay by: Brian Buckner & Sebastian JonesScenesStory by: Sherry Bilsing & Ellen PlummerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to move Joey’s chair and not having much luck at it as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesJoey: What are you doing?ScenesRachel: Well, y’know I was thinking of moving the couch over here.ScenesJoey: (laughs) Why would you want to do that?ScenesRachel: So that there will be a decent place for me to sit.ScenesJoey: Rach, there is a decent place to…ScenesRachel: And your lap does not count! Okay? Come on help me move this.ScenesJoey: No. No. No.ScenesRachel: No?ScenesJoey: No. Rosita does not move.ScenesRachel: I’m sorry, Rosita? As in…ScenesJoey: As in Rosita does not move.ScenesRachel: Joey, it’s just a chair! What’s the big deal?ScenesJoey: The big deal is that it is the exact equal distance from the bathroom to the kitchen and it’s at the perfect angle so you don’t get any glare coming of off Stevie.ScenesRachel: Stevie the TV?ScenesJoey: (glaring at her) Is there a problem?ScenesRachel: No! (Joey sets his beer and bag of chips down and heads into his room.) Oh what does he know! Come on Rosita, us chichas got to stick together! (She tries pulling on the back of the chair, until the hinge breaks and the back falls off.) You bitch!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are on the couch talking. Phoebe is getting coffee.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, y’know what’s weird? After you guys get married, when you introduce me to people you’re gonna have to say, "This is my brother-in-law Ross." Not, "My friend Ross," "brother-in-law Ross." That’s weird isn’t it?ScenesChandler: Couldn’t I just say, "This is Ross?ScenesRoss: (disappointed) Sure, do whatever you want.Scenes(Phoebe sits down between Chandler and Ross.)ScenesMonica: (entering, carrying a newspaper) Hey Ross! So, I was checking out the uh, real estate section…ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesMonica: Look at this. (Hands him the newspaper.)ScenesRoss: Oh, it looks like mom and dad’s house. Oh, it even has a tree with a broken limb out front and the uh, the window in the attic is…Oh my God!!ScenesPhoebe: What? What happened to the window in the attic?!ScenesMonica: I can’t believe mom and dad are selling the house!ScenesRoss: I can’t believe they-they didn’t even tell us!ScenesPhoebe: I can’t believe I still don’t know what happened to the window in the attic!Scenes(Ross calls his parents on his cell phone.)ScenesRoss: (on phone) Uh, hello dad! Monica and I just saw the house in the paper! (Listens) Yes we’re surprised! (Listens) Who did you leave a message with?ScenesChandler: (knocking on the window while outside) Sorry! (Runs off.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is examining the injury to Rosita while Rachel is apologizing to him.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Joey, Joey I am so sorry.ScenesJoey: I told you not to move it! Rach, how would you feel if say, I wanted to move you mom, and you said don’t, and I did it anyway and her head fell off?ScenesRachel: Okay, come on—Joey, I’ll buy you a new one! All right? We’ll go down to the store right now and we’ll-we’ll get you a new chair.ScenesJoey: (slowly turning and glaring at her) She’s not even cold yet!ScenesRachel: But don’t you think Rosita would’ve wanted you to move on? I mean y’know, she did always put…your comfort first.ScenesJoey: That’s true.Scenes(Rachel turns for the door and makes the "Wow!" face.)ScenesRachel: (grabbing her coat) Okay? You ready?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I… (Shuts off the TV.) I don’t want Stevie to see her like this.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Ross and Monica are still going on about the house.]
rows.Content: Ross: I can’t believe we have to say goodbye to the house we grew up in. Man, some-some stranger’s gonna be living in my room.ScenesMonica: Well, after 15 years of mom and dad keeping it as a shrine to you, it’s time the velvet ropes came down.ScenesRoss: They kept your room for a while.ScenesMonica: Oh please! Dad turned my room into a gym 20 minutes after I moved out! I gotta say, a tanning bed and a stack of Victoria’s Secret catalogues, not a gym!ScenesRoss: Come on, you know they love you.ScenesMonica: As much as they love you?ScenesRoss: I was their first born! They thought she was barren! It’s not my fault.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Ugh, I hate this year!ScenesRoss: What’s wrong with this year?ScenesPhoebe: Well okay, it’s already February and I’ve only given two massages and they were both the worst tippers in the world!ScenesMonica: That was me and Ross.ScenesPhoebe: Oh that’s right!ScenesRoss: Hey, y’know if you want to pick up some extra cash? Some friends of mine made good money doing telemarketing.ScenesMonica: Oh that’s a great idea. You’re really good on the phone.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah and yeah, and it would probably be better than the last telephone job I had. Y’know, I probably wouldn’t have to say spank as much. (Monica and Ross are shocked.)ScenesRoss: What?ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, like you never called!

rows.Scenes: The telemarketing office, Phoebe is getting shown to her desk by the supervisor.]
rows.Content: Supervisor: So basically this is very easy. You read from the script and try to sell as much toner as you possibly can.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I can do that! Oh, by the way, I love my office.ScenesSupervisor: (laughs) Why don’t we do a trial run.ScenesPhoebe: Oh okay. Umm, all right. (Picks up the phone and starts reading from the script.) Hi, this is Phoebe from Empire Office Supplies, can I speak to your supply manager please?ScenesSupervisor: I’m the supply manager.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, okay I would like to talk to you about your toner needs.ScenesSupervisor: We don’t need any toner.ScenesPhoebe: Oh okay, well I’m sorry to bother you. Bye-bye. (Hangs up the phone.) Yeah you’re right, this is easy.ScenesSupervisor: Okay, what was wrong with that call?ScenesPhoebe: Oh well, all right…um, no offense, but you were kind of rude.ScenesSupervisor: They’re always going to tell you they don’t need toner, but that’s okay because whatever they say, you can find the answer to it here in this script.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesSupervisor: So, I think you’re ready to sell toner, do you have any last questions?ScenesPhoebe: No. (Pause) Oh wait yes! I do, I do have one question. What is toner?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Chandler is entering.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Joey! Joe! (Sees that he’s not here and starts investigating. He picks up the bag of chips.) Full bag. (He picks up the beer.) Beer’s still cold. Something terrible must’ve happened here! (He decides it’s not that important; sits down on Rosita, and the back falls off causing him to flip over.) Oh no-no-no-no-no-no! (Runs over to Stevie.) Stevie, I was never here! (Runs out.)

rows.Scenes: Ross and Monica’s parent’s garage, Ross and Monica are arriving to go through their things. Mr. Geller is in the garage.]
rows.Content: Ross: Dad?ScenesMr. Geller: I’m here!ScenesRoss: (entering with Monica) Hey!ScenesMr. Geller: Hi. God, it seems like just yesterday you guys used to come out to watch me work.ScenesRoss: Dad, we-we can’t believe you’re selling the house.ScenesMr. Geller: Well, it’s time for a new family to start their memories here and hopefully their check will clear before they find the crack in the foundation and the asbestos in the ceiling.ScenesRoss: (To Monica) Let’s grab our stuff and get the hell out of here.ScenesMr. Geller: I’m sorry we can’t store your childhood things anymore.ScenesMonica: Oh, that’s okay, I can’t wait to see everything again! All of the memories…ScenesMr. Geller: Well, I don’t know what’s in the boxes down here, but I do know there are six or seven Easy Bake Ovens in the attic.ScenesMonica: I used to love to play restaurant.ScenesRoss: Yeah, not as much as you used to love to play uncooked batter eater.ScenesMonica: Hey, it is unreasonable to expect a child to wait for a light bulb to cook brownies! (She goes to the attic.)ScenesMr. Geller: So, I think you’re boxes are over here. (They walk over to them.)ScenesRoss: Wow! Great! (Finds a pack of cigarettes.) Wait, dad who-who’s cigarettes are these?ScenesMr. Geller: I don’t know. They-they must be your mother’s, but please, please don’t ask her. I’ll throw these away. (He puts them in his pocket as Ross finds something of interest in one of his boxes.)ScenesRoss: Cool! Dad! My report cards! Hey, check this out dad, (reading his grades) Math, A. Science, A. History, A. Gym…(He puts it away and finds something else.) Oooh, my rock polisher!ScenesMr. Geller: Oh look, look there’s your old makeup kit!ScenesRoss: It’s a clown kit! Clown kit!ScenesMr. Geller: Well, the white seems to be untouched. (He throws it back into the box as Mr. Geller moves a tarp and makes a discovery.) Uh-oh.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMr. Geller: Y’know how the garage floods every Spring?ScenesRoss: How are you ever going to sell this place?ScenesMr. Geller: I think I accidentally used Monica’s boxes to keep the water away from the Porsche.ScenesRoss: Oh no. Dad! Dad! What…(He goes to open one of her boxes and it rips apart.) Oh God…everything’s ruined! Dad, she’s gonna be crushed!ScenesMr. Geller: You don’t secretly smoke do you?ScenesRoss: No!ScenesMr. Geller: So it’s just your mother then.

rows.Scenes: The telemarketing office, Phoebe is hard at work.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (on phone) Hi, this Phoebe from Empire Office Supplies, can I speak to your supply manager please? (Listens) Earl, thanks. (Listens) Hi Earl, this is Phoebe from Empire Office Supplies I’d like to talk to you about your toner needs. (She’s reading from the script.)Scenes[Cut to Earl’s office, who is played by Jason Alexander, George from Seinfeld. They cut back and forth between Phoebe’s and Earl’s offices with each of their lines.]ScenesEarl: I don’t need any toner.ScenesPhoebe: I’m hearing what you’re saying, but at our prices everyone needs toner.ScenesEarl: Not me.ScenesPhoebe: May I ask why?ScenesEarl: You wanna know why. You wanna know why?ScenesPhoebe: I surely do!ScenesEarl: Okay, I don’t need any toner because I’m going to kill myself.Scenes(Phoebe desperately tries to find the scripted response to that line.)ScenesPhoebe: (doesn’t have any luck) Umm, is-is that because you’re out of toner?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The telemarketing office, Phoebe is still talking to Earl.]
rows.Content: Earl: Okay, so…no toner today. Thanks anyway, bye-bye.ScenesPhoebe: No-no wait-wait! I can’t just let you hang up! Just please talk to me.ScenesEarl: Well…I only have one thing to do today. (He looks at his board in his office that reads, "Today’s Tasks: KILL SELF.") I guess I could push it back.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Now, why do you want to kill yourself?ScenesEarl: It’s just that I uh, have been working for ten years now at this meaningless, dead-end job and nobody here even knows I exist!ScenesPhoebe: Chandler?ScenesEarl: I-I’m sorry?ScenesPhoebe: No look, I-I’m sure that people know you exist!ScenesEarl: Oh yeah? I work in a cubicle surrounded by people. I’ve been talking to you for five minutes now about killing myself and no one’s even looked up from their desk. Hang-hang on. (To the people standing around his cubicle.) Hey everybody! Uh, I’m gonna kill myself! (There’s no response; no one even looks up.) I’ll get back to ya. (To Phoebe) I got nothing. Wait. (He sets the phone down.) Uh, hey Marge! (Mimes putting a gun to his head, pulling the trigger, and splattering his brain on the wall behind him. Then points to himself. Marge watches this, then goes back to work.) (To Phoebe) Ehh, nothing. Nothing.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Chandler has replaced Rosita with his chair.]
rows.Content: Chandler: My chair. Now, if anybody asks, your name is Rosita! (He runs out the door, grabs the back of Rosita, and we can hear Joey and Rachel talking as they are coming up the stairs. Neither of them have reached the landing yet.)ScenesRachel: You will like it!ScenesJoey: No I won’t.Scenes(Chandler runs to check on them coming up the stairs.)ScenesRachel: You don’t even know!ScenesJoey: Because, I know what I like and what I don’t like! It’s not the same thing!Scenes(Chandler throws the back of Rosita into his apartment and quickly starts pushing the base into his apartment.)ScenesRachel: Well look, if you don’t like this…(The audience’s laughter at Chandler’s progress cuts out the rest of Rachel’s line.)ScenesJoey: I don’t know why you say that so soon.Scenes(Joey and Rachel reach the landing just as Chandler closes the door.)ScenesRachel: Come on Joey, I just bought you a new chair! The most expensive one in the store! Hey, y’know what I was thinking? We could name her Francette.ScenesJoey: Francette? What is she? A couch?Scenes(They enter their apartment.)ScenesJoey: Poor thing. Cut down in her prime.ScenesRachel: Joey, the new chair will be here in an hour. Maybe we should actually move Rosita out of here. Y’know, start the heeling process?ScenesJoey: Well, I guess you’re right. Maybe, maybe I’ll take her down to the incinerator. It’s gonna be so said, and kinda cool. (He goes to remove the back, but it doesn’t come off. So he sits down in it, puts his feet up, stands up, and looks back at it.) She’s heeled!ScenesRachel: That’s weird.ScenesJoey: No it’s not weird, it’s a miracle!ScenesRachel: It’s not a miracle Joey! I’m sure there’s some explanation.ScenesJoey: Oh there is! If you want something enough and your heart is pure, wondrous things can happen!ScenesRachel: Joey, I really don’t…ScenesJoey: (interrupting her) Can you tell me how this happened?ScenesRachel: Well no.ScenesJoey: Miracle!ScenesRachel: No, y’know what? Maybe somebody came in here and fixed it! Or something!ScenesJoey: Someone like an…angel?ScenesRachel: That’s right Joey, the chair angel came in and heeled your chair. (She sits down in the chair.)ScenesJoey: (angrily) Get your non-believer ass outta my chair! (She gets up and heads for her room.)

rows.Scenes: The Geller’s Garage, continued from earlier. Ross and Mr. Geller are still deciding what to do.]
rows.Content: Mr. Geller: Well, she’ll understand right? It’s not like I did it on purpose.ScenesRoss: Dad that won’t matter to her. Look, all my stuff is safe and dry and all her is-is, is growing new stuff! See, this is exactly the kind of thing that makes her think you guys love me more than you love her.ScenesMr. Geller: Oh my God, does she really thinks that?ScenesRoss: Well, can you blame her?ScenesMr. Geller: Well I don’t know, I-I suppose we may have favored you unconsciously, you were a medical marvel! The doctor said your mother could…ScenesRoss: Dad, dad I don’t want to hear about it.ScenesMr. Geller: Really?ScenesRoss: Well, not right now. Okay look, Monica came here for some memories and damnit, we’re gonna give her some! Okay, grab…grab some empty boxes. Okay? We’ll-we’ll take stuff from mine and whatever we can pass off as hers we’ll-we’ll put ‘em in their.ScenesMr. Geller: Great!ScenesRoss: Like uh y’know like this! This! (He picks up one of those art projects that kids make in kindergarten and first grade.) She-she could’ve made this!ScenesMr. Geller: Sure!ScenesRoss: Right? And this! (He picks up a trophy) She-she could’ve won this!ScenesMr. Geller: (grabbing a glove) This could’ve been hers!ScenesRoss: Sure! Ooh-ooh, what about this?ScenesMr. Geller: Your make-up kit? I’d feel better.Scenes(Ross angrily throws the kit into one of Monica’s new boxes.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is sitting the now heeled Rosita as Rachel is sitting in the newly arrived Francette. Francette is one of those new chairs from La-Z-Boy that has and does everything except cook and go to the bathroom for you. It’s got a small refrigerator under one armrest it has phone jacks for the Internet and regular phone, and so much more.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (grabbing a beer out of the chair’s fridge) I am so psyched I kept this chair for myself!ScenesJoey: Yeah, me too. (He flips up his armrest in disgust.)ScenesRachel: Hey, how’s…how’s the uh, miracle chair?ScenesJoey: Fine.ScenesRachel: Yeah? Wow! Y’know, that this thing has speakers in the headrest!ScenesJoey: No. Really?ScenesRachel: Yeah! You can hook it up to your TV and you get radio!ScenesJoey: (quietly) My chair heels itself.

rows.Scenes: The telemarketing office, Phoebe is still trying to talk Earl out of suicide.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Earl, you’re not hearing me! All I’m saying is that you’re not alone all right? Everybody hates the people they work with! (One of her coworkers overhears that, and she mimes that she didn’t mean him.)ScenesGuy: (walking past Earl’s desk) Hey guy!ScenesPhoebe: Wait, what was that? That sounded like someone being nice to you.ScenesEarl: No! That’s just the "Hey Guy" guy. He says that to everybody! He’s the worst! I’d like to take him with me!ScenesPhoebe: All right so Earl, let’s just forget about the people at the office, okay? There-there’s gotta be someone else in your life worth sticking around for! What about-what about your family, your friends, or maybe your girlfriend?ScenesEarl: (laughs) Yeah! Right!ScenesPhoebe: Oh sorry, boyfriend!ScenesEarl: Oh no.ScenesPhoebe: No, whatever! Anything!ScenesThe "Hey Guy" Guy: Hey guy!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, he’s gotta go.ScenesEarl: Okay, I should, I should probably be getting back to my thing now. See ya. (Hangs up.)ScenesPhoebe: No! I’m not finished yet! Don’t! Don’t you dare hang up on me!!!ScenesSupervisor: (walking by and overhearing that) (to the rest of the staff) The new girl’s good.

rows.Scenes: The Geller’s Garage, Mr. Geller and Ross are finishing up recreating Monica’s memories as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey guys! Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey, I just whipped us up some Easy Bake treats, they should be ready in about three days.ScenesMr. Geller: (overacting) That’s a good one! Do you hear that Ross? Three days!ScenesRoss: (overacting as well) Yeah! Yeah! (Laughs.) Oh, this will make a great memory.ScenesMonica: (wary) Okay. So, which boxes are mine?ScenesRoss: Well, these. These are yours right here. (Pointing to the boxes they just created for her.)ScenesMonica: Okay. (Starting to go through them) Oh! A coloring book! (Holding it up.)ScenesRoss: Yeah. Yeah, oh you loved that thing. You always had it with you. You never went anywhere without-without that coloring book.ScenesMonica: (looking through it) Really? Wow! It looks like I had some trouble staying inside the lines.ScenesRoss: Nu-uh! (Grabs it and examines it.)ScenesMonica: (holding up a glove) Oh, an old glove?ScenesMr. Geller: Oh, yeah you loved that glove! You took it every place you went. You never went any place without that glove.ScenesMonica: Wow! Look at this! (Picking up a shirt.) I can’t believe I even fit into this shirt! (She holds it up and it reads: Tyrannosaurus Ross.) (She turns it around and looks at it.) Oh, this is yours. (Hands it to Ross.)ScenesRoss: Oh, I don’t know how that got in there.ScenesMonica: (holding up a small cowboy hat) This isn’t mine. (Sets it down and looks at the rest of the boxes.) Hey, this isn’t, this isn’t my stuff! Ugh, Ross! (Grabs and holds up a doll.) These are your boxes! Where are my boxes?ScenesRoss: Umm, your boxes are umm…ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRoss: Dad?ScenesMr. Geller: Well, the garage flooded sweetie and it ruined everything in your boxes. I’m sorry.ScenesMonica: Just mine?ScenesMr. Geller: I’m afraid so.ScenesMonica: So why-why wasn’t Ross’s stuff ruined? (Pause) And if you say the words medical marvel I’m going to Easy Bake your head!ScenesMr. Geller: Well, I used your boxes to divert water away from the Porsche.ScenesMonica: So wait, Ross’s stuff is fine, but I have no memories because you wanted to keep the bottom two inches of your car away from water!!!ScenesMr. Geller: There was also leaves and guk and stuff.ScenesMonica: I can’t believe this! (Storms out.)ScenesMr. Geller: (To Ross) Screw it! I’m having one. (Takes out and lights a cigarette.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is writing a letter by the bay window as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey Chandler!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRachel: How would you like to sit in a chair that fully reclines, has a rolling massage, and speakers in the head rest?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’d love to but I’ve tried that so many times they won’t even let me in the store anymore.ScenesRachel: Well what if I told you, you can do it in my apartment?ScenesChandler: (excitedly) Are you telling me that you bought the chair that is making all other lounge systems obsolete? The chair that Sit magazine called the Chair of the Year?ScenesRachel: I just purchased the La-Z-Boy E-cliner 3000. (Which is an actual product by the way, I’m not sure about the 3000 part.)ScenesChandler: That’s awesome! That’s great! What made you do it?!ScenesRachel: Well, it’s a long story, but umm I broke Joey’s chair…ScenesChandler: Whoa-whoa-whoa! You broke Joey’s chair?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesChandler: I thought I broke Joey’s chair! That’s why I replaced it with mine!ScenesRachel: Ohhhhh. That’s how it got fixed!ScenesChandler: Well, what did you think, that-that elves came in and fixed it?ScenesRachel: Noo! (Laughs) Angels.ScenesChandler: I’m gettin’ my chair back! (Heads for Joey and Rachel’s.)ScenesRachel: What? Wh-hey!Scenes(They enter Joey and Rachel’s to find that Joey has broken Chandler’s chair.)ScenesJoey: Well, it looks like it wasn’t heeled after all! Yeah! So, I guess this chair is mine now! (Sits down in it and groans.)ScenesChandler: Joey you broke my chair!!ScenesJoey: Your chair?!ScenesRachel: Yeah, he thought he broke your chair so he switched the chairs!ScenesJoey: So, there was no miracle?!ScenesRachel: No Joe, no miracle.ScenesJoey: (sarcastic) Oh no this is devastating! My faith is shaken. I’m so glad I have the new chair to get my through this difficult time in my life.ScenesRachel: Uh-huh! Nice try, but you don’t get that chair anymore! All right? That is my chair now! You can sit on my lap! (Joey starts to get up.) No I take that back!ScenesChandler: I think I should get the chair!Scenes(Rachel and Joey both laugh at that suggestion.)ScenesJoey: How do you figure?ScenesChandler: Because you (Points to Joey) broke a chair and you (Points to Rachel) broke a chair! The only one around here that hasn’t broke a chair, is me!ScenesRachel: No-no-no! This chair’s not going anywhere.ScenesChandler: Well, where’s the logic in that?!ScenesRachel: The logic is, that there are two of us and we are both strong enough to break a chair in half!ScenesChandler: So Joey breaks my chair and I get nothing!Scenes(Joey whispers in Rachel’s ear to confirm his response.)ScenesJoey: That’s right!ScenesChandler: What are you guys? Like a gang or something?!Scenes(They confer again.)ScenesJoey: Yeah! We are!Scenes(Rachel whispers in Joey’s ear.)ScenesRachel: We’re the Cobras!

rows.Scenes: Earl’s Office, Earl has his head in his hands as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to Marge) Excuse me! Can you tell me where I can find Earl? He’s the supply manager around here.ScenesMarge: Sorry, I don’t know any Earl.ScenesEarl: (screaming) I’m right here!!!!ScenesPhoebe: (goes over to his desk) Earl! I’m Phoebe.ScenesEarl: Phoebe? The lady who sells toner?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, look it, you-you can’t kill yourself.ScenesEarl: (exhales) Look, um I really appreciate your coming down…ScenesPhoebe: No-no I can’t! I can’t let you do it!ScenesEarl: Why?!ScenesPhoebe: Because it was fate that made me call you today!ScenesEarl: I thought it was toner.ScenesPhoebe: No! Think about it okay? This isn’t even my regular job! Okay? And my first day on the job, you’re my first call! And-and somebody else might’ve hung up on you, but I wouldn’t do that because I know about this stuff. My mom killed herself.ScenesEarl: Really?!ScenesPhoebe: Yes.ScenesEarl: How?ScenesPhoebe: I’m not gonna give you tips! Look don’t you see that this-this…this all came together so that I could stop you from doing this.ScenesEarl: Couldn’t it just be a coincidence?ScenesPhoebe: No, it’s fate!ScenesEarl: It doesn’t really seem like enough to be fate.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. Well umm, okay here’s a weird thing. My mother was also a supply manager.ScenesEarl: I’m actually the office manager.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! So was she! And! Get this, okay? Your-your name is Earl, right? Her name was Pearl, P-Earl.ScenesEarl: Well, was there anything else?!ScenesPhoebe: Sure! (Thinks.) Umm, where are you from?ScenesEarl: Philadelphia.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! So was she! Oh, I’ve got-I’ve got goose bumps. (She holds out her arm.)ScenesEarl: (inspecting it) Really?ScenesPhoebe: Well, y’know I’m wearing layers and it’s warm.ScenesEarl: Yeah-yeah.ScenesPhoebe: But if—no look, okay. These jerks might not care about you, but the universe does! And that says a lot!ScenesEarl: (To All) Did you hear that?! I don’t need you guys to care about me! Because the universe cares! The whole universe! (Laughs as everyone ignores him.) (To Phoebe) I really wished they’d care just a little bit though.ScenesPhoebe: Y’know, I don’t-I don’t think it’s you. This is a freaky place. (To All) Hey! Guys! (Everyone looks up.) (To Earl) Oh no, it’s you.ScenesEarl: Yeah.

rows.Scenes: The Geller’s Garage, Monica is picking through her ruined childhood heirlooms with Ross.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh, this terrible! Everything is destroyed! Look at this. (She picks up some kind of furry thing.) It obviously meant enough for me to save it, and I don’t even know what it is! Ohh, it’s still soft. (She rubs it against her cheek.) What do you think this is?ScenesRoss: All right. I think it was a mouse.Scenes(Monica screams, throws the mouse down, and rubs her hands on Ross’s sweater to clean them.)ScenesMr. Geller: (entering) How are you honey?ScenesMonica: How do you think I am?! You’ve wrecked all my childhood memories. You love Ross more than me. And I just rubbed a dead mouse on my face!Scenes(Ross gets up to let his dad sit next to Monica.)ScenesMr. Geller: Sweetheart, we love you just as much as Ross! Now, I’m sorry about everything that happened and I’d probably never be able to make it up to you, but here’s a start. (He hands her a small box.)ScenesMonica: (opening it) What’s this?ScenesMr. Geller: It’s the key to my Porsche. Well, the key to your Porsche.ScenesMonica: (shocked) What?!ScenesRoss: (even more shocked) What?!!!ScenesMr. Geller: I’ve been thinking about getting rid of it. I was driving it the other day and saw my reflection in a store window. Your mother’s right, I do look like an ass.ScenesMonica: Wait, you’re giving me your Porsche, you’re kidding me right?!ScenesRoss: Well w-w-w-w-wait, w-wait, wait, wait a minute! I mean a couple of stupid boxes get wet and she gets a Porsche?!ScenesMr. Geller: (To Monica) Why don’t we take it for a spin?ScenesMonica: All right!ScenesRoss: Well, what about me?! I’m a medical marvel!!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is sitting in Joey’s lap on Francette, and they’re both groaning.]
rows.Content: Joey: Oh yeah.ScenesRachel: Ahhhh….ScenesJoey: Ahhh…… (To Rachel) Eh?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey guys!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesMonica: Do you guys know what happened to Chandler’s barca lounger?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, Joey broke it. Had to get rid of it.ScenesMonica: Are you kidding?! I get a Porsche and the barca lounger’s gone?! This is the best day ever! (Runs out.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where They All Turn ThirtyScenesTeleplay by: Sherry Bilsing & Ellen PlummerScenesStory by: Vanessa McCarthy ScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is knocking on Rachel’s door, whose door frame is decorated with balloons. The rest of the gang is there as well. Rachel opens the door and the gang blow on noisemakers.]
rows.Content: Ross: Happy birthday!!!ScenesMonica: Happy birthday!!!Scenes(Rachel glares at them and goes back into her room, closing her door.)ScenesAll: Rach! Come on! Rach!ScenesMonica: It’s your birthday!ScenesTag: (entering from her room) Hey.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) She’s not as pretty as she was when she was 29.ScenesTag: Ms. Green would like to establish some ground rules before she comes out. She would appreciate it if you don’t use the words old or downhill or (To Joey) they still look pretty damn good. (Joey smiles and everyone glares at him.)ScenesJoey: They do!ScenesPhoebe: Rachel! Come on out! Monica made breakfast!ScenesMonica: Chocolate-chip pancakes!Scenes(There is no response from Rachel.)ScenesRoss: We’ve got presents!Scenes(She opens the door.)ScenesRachel: Good ones?ScenesMonica: They all came from the list you handed out to us two weeks ago.ScenesRachel: Well, can I keep the presents and still be 29?ScenesJoey: Come on Rach! Look, turning thirty is not that big a deal.ScenesRoss: Oh really. Is that how you felt when you turned thirty?Scenes[Flashback to Joey’s thirtieth birthday party. It is being held in Monica and Chandler’s apartment.]ScenesJoey: (screaming) Why God?!! Why?!! We had a deal!! Let the others grow old! Not me!! (He buries his head in Phoebe’s lap for comfort.)Scenes[Cut back to Rachel’s party, everyone is now eating breakfast, except Rachel.]ScenesRachel: Y’know, I’m still 29 in Guam.ScenesRoss: Hey, 30 is not that old! Do you know how old the Earth is?ScenesRachel: Late thirties? Oh come on you guys! Is it just me? Am I overreacting to this?ScenesChandler: No Rach, it’s not just you. My thirtieth birthday certainly wasn’t that much fun.Scenes[Flashback to Chandler’s thirtieth birthday party. It is also being held in Monica and his apartment. He is about to blow out the candles on his birthday cake.]ScenesJoey: (screaming) And now Chandler! We’re all gettin’ so old! (Looking up) Why are you doing this to us?! (Turns away crying.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, breakfast is finished but Rachel’s still down.]
rows.Content: Monica: Rach, you’re in a great place in your life. Come on, you’ve got a great job! Good friends…ScenesJoey: Yeah, you’re roommate is a soap opera star.ScenesRachel: Look, y’know I know my life’s going pretty well, but I look around and I just see so many people who’ve accomplished so many other goals by the time they’re thirty.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but you shouldn’t compare yourself to me.Scenes[Flashback to: The Street in front of Central Perk, Ross and Joey are holding a yellow tape across the road and everyone is cheering Phoebe as she bounces around the corner on a hippity-hop.]ScenesAll: Come on Phoebe! You can do it Phoebe! Come on!ScenesRachel: There you go!Scenes(She crosses the line and they all cheer again.)ScenesPhoebe: I did it! One mile on a hippity-hop! That’s it!! That’s everything I wanted to do before I was thirty. Oh, except I wanted to patch things up with my sister. But oh well. Yay!! (They all cheer again.) And-and girls this thing is a Godsend if you know what I mean. (Rachel and Monica look intrigued and as they all head into Central Perk, Rachel picks up the hippity-hop that Phoebe left behind.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Thirty. Ugh, I mean thirty! Monica, do you remember mean, old Mrs. Kreeger in the fifth grade? She was thirty!ScenesTag: Come on, let’s have some fun. Huh? (To Rachel) What do you want to do today?ScenesRachel: Nothing. I don’t want to do anything.ScenesMonica: Well, doing nothing on your thirtieth is better than doing something stupid, like Ross.ScenesRoss: Hey! That was a practical purchase! I needed that car for transportation! Okay? I-I have a child!Scenes[Flashback to: A street, Ross is sitting in his newly purchased MGB. Which is one of the better British sports cars ever made. Of course, ‘better’ is a relative term. Which reminds me of a joke. Why don’t the British make computers? Because they couldn’t figure out how to make them leak oil. Anyway, the gang is all staring at his new purchase.]ScenesRoss: How hot do I look in this, huh?!ScenesChandler: Ross, a sports car? Wouldn’t it have been cheaper to just stuff a sock down there?ScenesRoss: That’s not what this is about okay? I-I am a sports car enthusiast. I have always been into cars.ScenesJoey: Hey, what’s the horsepower on this thing?ScenesRoss: (giddy) I don’t know, but-but look how shiny!ScenesMonica: I can’t believe you bought this.ScenesRachel: Really! God Ross, what were you thinking? (To Phoebe, quietly) I know it’s really shallow, but a part of me wants him again.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, well get in line missy. (To Ross) So, can I have a ride stud?ScenesRoss: Hop in. (Phoebe hops in.) Get ready for the smoothest ride of your life.Scenes(He starts the car and surprisingly in fires right up and comes to a nice idle. (Both can be rarities with British sports cars with their lovely Lucas ignition systems, which tend not to work especially in the rain.) Anyway, this being New York he is parallel parked on a street with the car in front of him only inches ahead of his bumper, likewise with the car behind him. He’s completely boxed in and can’t move more than two inches. He tries to get out several times by bumping the bumpers of both cars to no avail.)ScenesRoss: Damnit! (Shuts the car off.)ScenesPhoebe: (getting out) Okay, who’s next?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Phoebe is pouring Rachel some coffee.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Y’know what? I am going to do something today. I’m not just gonna sit around like some old lady. I’m gonna get something pierced. Like my uh, like my nose or my tongue or something.ScenesPhoebe: Really?! ‘Cause y’know that hurts.ScenesRachel: So what?! Y’know what? The way I see it—(Phoebe pulls out a hair from the back of her head)—Ow! Son of a bitch!!ScenesTag: Look Rachel, I know what you’re going through. I’m totally freaked about turning 25.ScenesRachel: (glares at him) Get out, get out of my apartment.ScenesMonica: All right Rach, for what it’s worth, I think that you’re doing great. I mean y’know let’s face it, no one handles this well.ScenesPhoebe: Least of all you.ScenesTag: Why? What you’d do?ScenesMonica: Weren’t you asked to leave sonny?Scenes[Flashback to Monica and Chandler’s apartment. Chandler has a bunch of people over in formal wear to give Monica a surprise birthday party. Joey is coming out of the bathroom and removing his tie.]ScenesChandler: (To Joey) Would you put that back on?! Monica’s gonna be here any minute!ScenesJoey: But it hurt’s my Joey’s Apple.ScenesChandler: (frustrated) Okay, for the last time. It’s not named for each individual man.Scenes(Joey walks away and Mr. and Mrs. Geller walk up. Mr. Geller is wearing this ancient velvet tuxedo.)ScenesMrs. Geller: (To Chandler) You’ve done a wonderful job with this party Chandler. Everything looks so lovely.ScenesChandler: Oh well, not as lovely as you. I mean, I can’t believe that you would have a thirty-year-old daughter! (To Mr. Geller) And you! I can’t believe that you would have a tux that’s thirty years old! (Puts his hand on Mr. Geller’s shoulder.)ScenesMr. Geller: It’s older than that. Ross was actually conceived right near this tuxedo.ScenesChandler: Ohh! (He quickly removes his hand and looks at it.)ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey! Everybody hide! Hide! I saw her! She’s coming!ScenesChandler: Okay! Okay! Everybody down! Everybody down! (Rachel turns off the lights and everyone crouches. As everyone crouches, a ripping noise erupts from the assemblage.)ScenesMr. Geller: Crap.Scenes(We hear some fumbling at the door, then silence.)ScenesChandler: (getting up to investigate) Okay, everybody stay here. I will find out what’s going on.Scenes(He goes out into the hall and finds a very drunk Monica lying up against Joey and Rachel’s door.)ScenesMonica: Heyyy!! You got the door open!! (Giggles.)ScenesChandler: Hey-hey are you drunk?ScenesMonica: Nooo! (Giggles) Okay. (She tries to pull herself up by Rachel and Joey’s doorknob, but the door opens and she almost falls into the their apartment. She manages to catch herself.) Whoa! (Stands up, unsteadily) Okay. See I was, I was a little nervous about turning (whispering) thirty. (Giggles.) So the bus boys took me out for some drinks. (Pause) I wanna puke on you later!ScenesChandler: Okay, here is the thing. We have thrown a very formal surprise party for you in there! All of your friends are in there and your parents!ScenesMonica: Noo!!!ScenesChandler: Yes!ScenesMonica: Noo!!ScenesChandler: Yes!!ScenesMonica: Oh no! My parents have never seen me drunk! (Pause) That they know of.ScenesChandler: Okay, here’s the thing. We’re gonna get you some coffee and they will never know that you’re drunk.ScenesMonica: Really?! You promise?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’ll take care of it.ScenesMonica: Okay. I love you so much. (Kisses him.)ScenesChandler: (laughing) Okay we have to do something about your breath.ScenesMonica: What about your breath?! (Breathes on him.)ScenesChandler: That’s still yours. Okay, now remember it’s a surprise party. So, when you go in, act surprised.ScenesMonica: Okay. I can do that.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(Chandler opens the door and Monica sneaks up on it. They go inside.)ScenesAll: Surprise!!!Scenes(Monica screams and they all stare at her.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Ross’s birthday, Joey is now trying to get his car out while Ross is directing him.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, forward. Forward—Stop! (The car moves an inch and Ross runs to the back of the car.) Okay, back—Stop! (The car barely moves and Ross runs back to the front.) Okay, forward—Stop! Stop! Stop!ScenesMonica: Ross, just forget about it. This guy’s got you totally wedged in.Scenes(A beautiful woman approaches.)ScenesWoman: (To Joey) Is this yours?ScenesJoey: Well actually…ScenesRoss: No-no-no! It’s mine! It’s-it’s mine. (The woman walks away.)ScenesJoey: Dude, you soooo need this car.ScenesPhoebe: (running up) Okay. Okay, here’s what we’re gonna do. Okay, I’m gonna break into this mini-van and put it in neutral. You guys push it forward so Ross can drive out of his spot. Okay? All right, here we go. (She opens her coat and reveals that thing car thieves use to break into cars as Ross jumps in behind the wheel. She inserts the device, unlocks the door, opens it, and the alarm goes off.) Haul ass!!!! (Runs off.)Scenes(The rest of the gang runs away, except for Ross who’s tramped inside his car. To hide he puts the top up as Monica, Rachel, and Joey come running past.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s birthday, she’s taking the hippity-hop to Ursula’s apartment as a gift. She knocks on the door and Ursula answers it.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Happy thirtieth birthday! Here! (Hands her the hippity-hop.) It’s for the child in you, and the woman. Happy thirtieth!ScenesUrsula: Right, why do you keep saying that?ScenesPhoebe: Because it’s our thirtieth birthday.ScenesUrsula: Yeah, no we’re not thirty. We’re 31. Okay. (She closes the door.)ScenesPhoebe: Wait! (Knocks on the door and Ursula opens it.)ScenesUrsula: Oh, it’s you.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. What?!ScenesUrsula: Yeah, we’re not thirty, we’re 31.ScenesPhoebe: Nu-uh!ScenesUrsula: Yea-huh! That’s what is says on my birth certificate.ScenesPhoebe: You have your birth certificate?ScenesUrsula: Yeah, I got a big box of family stuff when my mom died.ScenesPhoebe: Our mom.ScenesUrsula: (sarcastic) Right! Okay. (Hands Phoebe her births certificate.)ScenesPhoebe: Do you have my birth certificate?ScenesUrsula: No, I sold it to a Swedish runaway.ScenesPhoebe: (reading the certificate) Oh my God! Oh my God, we are 31.ScenesUrsula: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: I just lost a whole year of my life.ScenesUrsula: (sarcastic) Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Your middle name is Pamela?ScenesUrsula: Yes.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I never knew mine. Do you remember what it is?ScenesUrsula: Yes! Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: That’s my first name.ScenesUrsula: Right, okay, then no.

rows.Scenes: Monica’s birthday, it’s just after the surprise.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay before we start the celebration, Monica has to go put on her party dress.ScenesMonica: Yay!ScenesChandler: See? (Does his laugh.) Here we go. (Starts walking her to their room, and has to pass in front of Mr. Geller who’s sitting at the table and Mrs. Geller who’s standing next to him.)ScenesMr. Geller: Happy birthday, sweetie! Give us a hug! (Starts to get up.)ScenesMrs. Geller: (stopping him) Don’t get up Jack! The safety pins are about to blow.Scenes(They continue their trek.)ScenesMonica: (sees someone) Paul!ScenesChandler: (correcting her) Phil.ScenesMonica: Phil!ScenesChandler: Now, there is a dress laid out on your bed. (Monica stumbles on the steps.) Okay, (catches her) you’re doing great. You’re doing great. You’re doing fine.Scenes(Phoebe approaches as they almost get to their room.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, what’s going on?ScenesChandler: Monica’s a little drunk.ScenesPhoebe: Yay! I love drunk Monica!ScenesMonica: Awwwww… (Giggles.)ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Go change! (To Phoebe) She doesn’t want her parents to know she’s drunk.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! All right! All right. Here’s what we’ll do, I’ll get twice as drunk as Monica and then no one’s will even notice her.Scenes(Chandler walks over to where the rest of the gang is.)ScenesRachel: What’s-what’s going on? Phil’s really pissed!ScenesChandler: Monica’s wasted.ScenesRoss: Maybe that will liven up this party.ScenesChandler: (To Rachel) Okay, will you just go help her change please!ScenesRachel: Okay, but taking care of a drunk, naked woman seems like a job for Joey.ScenesJoey: Yep. (Starts for Monica’s room, but Chandler stops him.)

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s birthday, everyone is presenting their presents to Rachel.]
rows.Content: Tag: (handing his to her) This one’s from me.ScenesRachel: Ahh!ScenesTag: It wasn’t on your list, but hopefully you’ll think it’s really fun.ScenesRachel: (opening it) A scooter! (She’s not happy.)ScenesRoss: (to Tag) Stick to the list. Always stick to the list.ScenesRachel: No! No-no, I love it. Thank you. (Kisses him.)ScenesChandler: Okay, open ours next. Open ours next!ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesJoey: Now that you’re a couple, we don’t get two presents from you guys?ScenesChandler: For my last birthday you gave me a hug! (To Rachel) Okay, read the card! Read the card!ScenesRachel: Okay. (Opens the card and reads it.) Happy birthday Grandma! It’s better to be over the hill (starting to cry) then buried under it. (Breaks down as everyone glares at them.) All our love Monica and Chandler. (Crying) That’s funny, yeah!ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no! That was the joke!ScenesRachel: (crying) No, I know! I get it! It’s funny!ScenesChandler: No, because you’re not a grandmother!ScenesRachel: No I know, because to be a grandmother you have to be married and have children and I don’t have any of those things. That’s why it’s so funny. (Runs into her room crying.)ScenesMonica: All you had to do was buy the card!

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s birthday, a time lapse has occurred. Rachel is coming back into the living room carrying a notepad.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey! Look who’s back! It’s the birthday girl! How’s the birthday girl feeling?ScenesRachel: Well, I feel fine, but I think you’re bumming out the rest of the kids.ScenesRoss: What? (Glances over and sees the faces of the rest of the group, then goes and sits down.)ScenesRachel: Okay! Y’know what? I realized it was stupid to get upset about not having a husband and kids. All I really needed was a plan. See I wanna have three kids…ScenesPhoebe: Oh let me guess, and you wanna have them all at the same time and you wanna have them for your brother.ScenesRachel: As I was saying… I should probably have the first of the three kids by the time I’m 35 which gives me five years. I love this plan! I wanna marry this plan!ScenesPhoebe: If you could do that, I’d marry the hippity-hop.ScenesRachel: So, if I wanna have my kid when I’m 35, I don’t have to get pregnant until I’m 34. Which gives Prada four years to start making maternity clothes! Oh wait, but I do want to be married for a year before I get pregnant…ScenesMonica: Really! That long?! (Chandler slowly turns and looks at her.) (To Chandler) Look all you want, it’s happening!ScenesRachel: No, so I don’t have to get married until I’m 33! That’s three years, that’s three whole years—Oh, wait a minute though. I’ll need a year and a half to plan the wedding, and I’d like to know the guy for a year, year and a half before we get engaged… Which means I need to meet the guy by the time I’m thirty.ScenesRoss: Which is fine! Because you just turned—(Removes two candles from the cake)—twenty-eight!ScenesRachel: No! Ross, no! It is not fine! Eh-eh-according to my plan I should already be with the guy I wanna marry!Scenes(We hear Tag scream out in the hallway and jump into view of the open door on the scooter. He gives a hearty thumbs up to the group and rides off, with Joey following breathlessly behind.)ScenesJoey: Will you quit hoggin’ it!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica’s birthday, Monica is now dressed and is being helped out by Chandler and Rachel.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (To Chandler) I’m telling you it’s like watching Bambi learn how to walk.ScenesRoss: (To Monica) You’re drunk! Mom and dad are gonna be maaaaadd! Maybe I’m a little drunk.Scenes(Monica sits down on the barca lounger.)ScenesChandler: (to a waiter) Oh that’s great! Right there! Can we get some of that over here please? (The waiter comes over) There we go.ScenesJoey: (to the waiter) Hey! Are those crab cakes? (The waiter nods) Did I not tell ya to come straight to me when more crab cakes were ready?ScenesChandler: (To Monica) How are you feeling?ScenesMonica: You are so handsome! I wanna make love to you right here, right now! (Growls and pulls him into a kiss.)ScenesRoss: I really wish that you wouldn’t.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Now all you have to do is just get through a little bit more, okay? Then we can put you in bed, okay? Just smile and don’t talk to anyone.ScenesPhoebe: (clinking two glasses together) Speech! Speech! Let’s hear from the birthday girl! Huh?ScenesChandler: Pheebs!!ScenesPhoebe: Don’t you see? Everyone’s looking at me! The plan’s working! I didn’t even have to take off my top yet!ScenesMrs. Geller: Speech! Come on Monica!ScenesRoss: Come on!ScenesAll: Come on! Speech!Scenes(Monica stands up and wobbles slightly and Chandler runs over to catch her.)ScenesMr. Geller: (filming this) Hey Chandler, you can’t keep your hands off her for one second!ScenesMrs. Geller: Oh-ho, I think it’s nice.ScenesChandler: I think it’s necessary. (Backs away anyhow.)ScenesMonica: I-I-I wanna thank you all for coming. My family and my friends…ScenesPhoebe: (screaming) Wooo!! Hoo!!ScenesMonica: I really like to say that I’m-um… (Pause) Y’know what I’d really like to say? I’m drunk!! (Mrs. Geller pulls the camera down.) That’s right mom and dad your little Harmonica is hammered!! (Ross grabs the camera out of his dad’s hands.) And guess what! I’ve been drunk before! And I’ve smoked a cigarette! And I got a box of Ding-Dongs hidden in my underwear drawer! It’s all okay. It’s okay because I turned thirty today. And, and I can do anything I want! Because I am a grown up. (Falls over sideways with Ross filming the fall.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Joey) Okay quick, help me get this off! (Motions to her top.)ScenesJoey: Yeah!!Scenes(Ross pans the camera over to Phoebe.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s birthday, she’s telling everyone what she found out at Ursula’s while sitting in Central Perk.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: I lost a whole year! I can’t believe it! This is so unfair!ScenesJoey: Oh, I don’t know Pheebs. It’ll be okay.ScenesPhoebe: Will it? Will it?! I mean, how would you feel if you found out you were 31?ScenesJoey: That’s not gonna happen. No. (Looks up) Because we have a new deal!ScenesPhoebe: Plus, it totally ruined my schedule! I…I haven’t done any of the things I wanted to do by the time I was 31!ScenesJoey: Like what?ScenesPhoebe: Like okay I-I-I, I haven’t met any Portuguese people! I, I haven’t had the perfect kiss! And I haven’t been to sniper’s school!ScenesMonica: Phoebe, y’know why don’t we just go upstairs and have some birthday cake?ScenesPhoebe: No, I just feel like being by myself for a while. All right? I’ll see you guys later. Thanks. (Gets up and exits.)ScenesRachel: Hey. (After she leaves.) Oh, poor Pheebs.ScenesJoey: Hey, y’know what you guys? I think I’m gonna go walk her home. (Gets up and runs out.)ScenesMonica: Oh man!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: He’s gonna eat the cake!Scenes[Cut outside, Joey is catching up with Phoebe.]ScenesJoey: Pheebs! Wait up! (She stops.) Listen uh, close your eyes. (She does so and Joey passionately kisses her.) Maybe that’s one thing you can cross off your list.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah.Scenes(Joey starts to walk away, but stops.)ScenesJoey: Oh, and plus I’m 1/16th Portuguese.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! (Phoebe walks away smiling.)

rows.Scenes: Ross’s birthday, his car is still trapped in it’s spot. Now Joey, Phoebe, and Ross are at the front of the car with Monica, Rachel, and Chandler at the rear of the car.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, is everybody clear? We’re gonna pick it up…and move it. Now all we need is teamwork, okay? We’re gonna lift the car…and slide it out. Lift and slide!ScenesRachel: Ross, I really don’t think…ScenesRoss: (interrupting her) Lift!! And slide!ScenesChandler: Okay, here we go.ScenesRoss: All right everyone, lift! (They and try to lift the car, of course it doesn’t raise up) And slide!! (Everyone leans over, but the car still does not move.)

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s birthday, she is coming into the hallway where Joey and Tag are playing with the scooter.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey Joey, can I…ScenesJoey: Oh, come on Rach! My turn just started!ScenesRachel: Actually, I just wanna talk to Tag.ScenesJoey: Oh. Okay. Hey, can I ride this outside?ScenesRachel: Whatever! Okay, I’m not your mother.ScenesJoey: Okay! (Runs off downstairs.)ScenesRachel: Not in the street!!ScenesJoey: Yes!ScenesRachel: (to Tag) Hi.ScenesTag: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesTag: How are you doing? Are you feeling any better?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I’m doing okay. I’m um…let’s talk.ScenesTag: Okay. (They sit on the step.)ScenesRachel: Umm…ScenesTag: What’s up?ScenesRachel: Ohh Tag, umm…you’re such a great guy and we have sooo much fun together but I don’t-I don’t…ScenesTag: Wait! I think I see where you’re going, but before you say anything else, can I just say one more thing? (Kisses her.)ScenesRachel: Well said. And a uh good example of the fun I was referring to uhh, but I just think I’m past the point where I think I can y’know, just have fun.ScenesTag: Rachel, don’t do this. This is just because you’re turning thirty.ScenesRachel: Yeah, it is! But you’re just a kid! I mean you’re 25!ScenesTag: Twenty-four actually.ScenesRachel: Oh God! Y’know what I wish? I wish you were six years older. Well actually, if I’m wishin’ for stuff, I actually wish I was six years younger.ScenesTag: Me too.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I’m sorry. (They hug.)Scenes[Time lapse, Rachel is entering her apartment after breaking up with Tag.]ScenesChandler: Hey! How’d it go?ScenesRachel: Oh, if I only want two kids, can I keep him for another year?ScenesPhoebe: You did the right thing.ScenesJoey: (entering, limping, and holding his arm) I don’t like this anymore. (He sits down with them in pain.)ScenesChandler: Well, here we are, just a bunch of thirty year olds.ScenesRoss: God, do you realize in ten years we’re gonna be 40?ScenesJoey: (crying) Why God?! Why are you doing this to us?! (He buries his head in Ross’s shoulder.)

rows.Scenes: Ross’s birthday, night has fallen and Joey and Ross are walking by where his car is parked to find that both cars blocking him in have left.]
rows.Content: Ross: Yes! My baby’s finally free!ScenesJoey: All-all right! (They run and jump in the car.) Start it up! Let’s go!ScenesRoss: (starting it) Woohoo!Scenes(Just as they are about to pull away, a big, fat, bald guy pulls up in the exact same car as Ross and stops next to him.)ScenesThe Man In The Sportscar: How hot are we? (He drives off.)ScenesRoss: You wanna buy a car?ScenesJoey: No.Scenes(Ross shuts it off and they get out.)ScenesEnding CreditsScenes{Transcriber’s Note: There was no credits scene with this episode.}ScenesEndScenesThe One With Joey’s New BrainScenesTeleplay by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesStory by: Sherry Bilsing & Ellen PlummerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica, Chandler, Ross, and Rachel are sitting around the table.]
rows.Content: Monica: I’m glad you’re here, we have a couple of things to ask you about the wedding ceremony.ScenesRachel: (starting to cry) Ohh…ScenesRoss: What’s the matter? You okay?ScenesRachel: Yeah, it’s just y’know…ScenesChandler: (To Ross) Monica said wedding.ScenesMonica: Uh, so anyway, we thought one of you could read something during the ceremony.ScenesRachel: Oh! I would love to read a poem.ScenesChandler: Do you think you could get through a poem?ScenesRachel: (crying) It’ll be a short one.ScenesMonica: Okay, so Ross will be doing the reading.ScenesRachel: Ohhh…ScenesRoss: Okay. Yeah, I guess, I guess I could do that too.ScenesChandler: Too?ScenesRoss: Yeah, I kind of uh, have something else planned for you guys.ScenesMonica: Do you mind telling us what it is?ScenesRoss: Sorry, I’m kinda keeping this one on the Q.T.ScenesChandler: Well, whatever it is, I hope it involves winking. (Winks in a spy-type manner.)ScenesJoey: (entering, excited) Hey!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesJoey: So I just talked to one of the DOOL writers today, and…ScenesMonica: What is DOOL?ScenesJoey: Days Of Our Lives. Anyway, you’re not gonna believe it! My character is coming out of his coma!!ScenesAll: Oh!!ScenesChandler: That’s great!ScenesJoey: And-and-and not only that, I’m gettin’ a new brain!!ScenesChandler: So great things are happening at work and in your personal life!ScenesRachel: Wait, what do you mean you’re getting a new brain?ScenesJoey: Oh well, they’re killing off one of the characters on the show, and when she dies her brain is being transplanted into my body.ScenesRoss: What? A brain transplant?!ScenesJoey: (seriously) Yes, it’s a highly controversial procedure.ScenesRoss: It’s ridiculous!ScenesJoey: Well, I think it’s ridiculous that you haven’t had sex in three and a half months.ScenesRoss: (to Monica and Rachel) It’s winter, they are fewer people on the street. (Rachel and Monica smile and nod, knowingly.)ScenesMonica: Who are they killing off?ScenesJoey: Uh Cecilia Monroe, she plays Jessica Lockhart.ScenesRachel and Monica: Noo!!ScenesMonica: She’s my favorite character on DOOL.ScenesJoey: Nice.ScenesRachel: She is so good at throwing drinks in people’s faces, I mean I don’t think I’ve ever seen her finish a beverage.ScenesMonica: And the way she slaps all the time!ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesMonica: Wouldn’t you love to do it just once?! (Raises her hand towards Chandler.)ScenesChandler: Don’t do it.ScenesRachel: Cecilia Monroe man, what a great actress.ScenesJoey: Oh, tell me about it. And she’s been on the show forever, it’s gonna be really hard to fill her shoes.ScenesRoss: Yeah-yeah, help me out here, when you come out of the "brain transplant," you are going to be her?ScenesJoey: Yes, but in Drake Remoray’s body. (Ross laughs unbelievably.) Why is this so hard for you to get? I thought you were a scientist!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel sitting on the couch in Central Perk]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (Clears Throat) Rach, so, that guy there. Straight or gay?ScenesRachel: (They both look behind them.) Well, I'd have to say gay.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah? Why?ScenesRachel: Well mainly because he's kissing that other guy.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no not that guy there. That guy right there. (Pointing to an attractive man sitting at a table behind them.)ScenesRachel: Oh yeah he's too cute to be straight.ScenesPhoebe: (A woman with large breasts walks in the door) Ohh knockers will help us figure it out. (She walks by and he checks her out.)ScenesRachel: All right, straight, and not subtle. (The man gets up and leaves.)ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, he left his cell phone.ScenesRachel: Oh, well, we can hand it to Gunther and he'll put it in lost and found.ScenesPhoebe: Or we could use it to call China. See how those guys are doing.ScenesRachel: What if, um, if he calls his own cell phone to find out who found it and I answer and we start talking and we fell in love. I mean wouldn't that be a great story? Kind of like a fairy tale for the digital age.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah… That does sound great. I'm going to get the phone. (They both get up.)ScenesRachel: What? Wait! Why…why do you get the story?ScenesPhoebe: I don't know. I haven't been out on a date in so long.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, you had a date three days ago.ScenesPhoebe: That wasn’t a date! That was, that was just friends getting together…(quietly) having sex.ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay, see? I get the phone.ScenesPhoebe: No way! No way! You just broke with Tag a week ago.ScenesRachel: Yeah! (Breaking up) And until now, I didn’t think I’d love again.ScenesPhoebe: Nice try.ScenesRachel: Oh hey-hey wait! How do we fairly decide who gets the phone?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know.Scenes(They edge closer to the phone on the table.)ScenesRachel: Well umm, maybe we could uhh… (Grabs the phone) Ah-ha! Too slow!!Scenes(She holds the phone out and starts taunting Phoebe. Phoebe calming knocks the phone out of Rachel’s hand and catches it.)ScenesPhoebe: Ah-ha! Too cocky!

rows.Scenes: Silvercup Studios, Joey is watching Jessica Lockhart perform a scene.]
rows.Content: Dina: I’m going to keep dating him Mother, and there’s nothing you can do about it!ScenesJessica Lockhart: Oh yes there is!ScenesDina: What are you going to do? Kill him? Like you did with Charles?!ScenesJessica Lockhart: (gasps) That was an accident! And so were you.ScenesDina: Well, at least I’m not a murderer! (Jessica slaps her.)ScenesJessica Lockhart: (crying) Oh, my baby! (Hugs Dina, but moves Dina’s head to her other shoulder so that she’s the only one in the picture.)ScenesThe Director: Cut!Scenes(Joey walks up to Cecilia Monroe who plays Jessica.)ScenesJoey: That was a great scene! And-and-and that slap looks so real! How do you do that?ScenesCecilia: Oh, just years of experience.ScenesDina: (crying) Can I get some ice here?!ScenesJoey: Oh anyway, I just wanted to say how wonderful I think you are.ScenesCecilia: You’re not the fan who’s dying are you?ScenesJoey: Say what?ScenesCecilia: I’m supposed to meet and hug a fan whose dying, but that’s not supposed to be until (to no one in particular) later!ScenesJoey: No. No, I’m Joey Tribbiani; we did a scene together yesterday. I-I’m the guy in the coma!ScenesCecilia: Oh that was a real person?!ScenesJoey: An-an-anyway I-I just wanted to say that since I’m getting your brain when you leave the show, I was wondering if there was any tips you can give me…ScenesCecilia: I-I-I’m leaving the show?ScenesJoey: (quickly) I don’t know. Why? Did you hear something?ScenesCecilia: Who told you that?ScenesJoey: Oh uh, one of the writers.ScenesCecilia: Which one? Was it bald or was it tall?ScenesJoey: Umm…ScenesCecilia: Y’know what? It doesn’t matter!
