(To Monica) Which we are not!ScenesMonica: Well, we’re still talking about it, aren’t we?ScenesPhoebe: Well yeah, that and Chandler’s problem.ScenesJoey: Monica-Monica-Monica-Monica, listen-listen, listen, listen, would-would it make you feel better if we all stop talking about Ross and Rachel.ScenesMonica: Yes that would be lovely.ScenesJoey: You got it. Okay. Now, I can pass for 19 right?!ScenesChandler: Yes, you can pass for 19.ScenesJoey: Really?ScenesChandler: Yes!ScenesJoey: Seriously?ScenesChandler: Seriously? Seriously, no! You can play your own age which is 31!ScenesJoey: (gasps) I’m 30!ScenesRachel: Joey, you are not! You’re 31.ScenesJoey: (realizes) Aww crap!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so The Plaza! Okay, we’ll get us some Mai Thai’s, (To Chandler) maybe no more for you though.ScenesMonica: Y’know what? I-I think that umm, I don’t feel like going to The Plaza.ScenesPhoebe: Why?!ScenesRachel: Honey, Monica, this is ridiculous! Look…ScenesMonica: No-no, I-I really don’t want to talk about it! I don’t! (To Rachel) Especially with you. (Goes into her room.)ScenesJoey: Psss, that is whack!Scenes[Time lapse, Phoebe is playing the guitar for Joey.]ScenesPhoebe: (she’s strumming something) Yeah? (Joey nods yes.) Okay, I think I’ll play it at the wedding.ScenesJoey: Yeah! Well, I think we’ll see if they actually let you play. Huh? I mean they tell you anything you want to hear like-like, "You look 19," and then they just take it away like-like, "No you don’t.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I don’t think Monica is gonna take this away.ScenesJoey: Wouldn’t she?ScenesPhoebe: Would she?ScenesJoey: Would she? (He smells something and gasps as he realizes what it is.) You ate my candy bar!

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s bedroom, she’s pacing as Ross knocks on her door and opens it a little to stick his hands in.]
rows.Content: Ross: Guess who? (Enters fully.)ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey, I just realized we kinda let some stuff up in the air…ScenesRachel: What do you think Monica mean when she said she didn’t want to talk, especially with me? I mean, why not especially you and me? We were both out there kissing.ScenesRoss: Still thinking about it huh?ScenesRachel: Come on! Serious-ser-ser-seriously, what did she mean by that? (Mimicking Monica.) Especially you!ScenesRoss: (loosening his tie) Oh, who cares?ScenesRachel: I care!ScenesRoss: (tightening his tie) And so do I.ScenesRachel: Y’know what, I-I have to go talk to her, would you let me just get changed?ScenesRoss: Okay. Sure. (Sits down on her bed.)ScenesRachel: Am I going to let you watch me undress?ScenesRoss: (sitting up) No! (Exits.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, they are both getting undressed.]
rows.Content: Monica: I can’t believe her, y’know it’s just—it’s so typical.ScenesChandler: Now Monica, I know you’re upset, but don’t forget. There is going to be a wedding, you are going to throw the bouquet, and then there’s going to be a honeymoon, maybe in Paris.ScenesMonica: Paris?ScenesChandler: We will take a moonlit walk on the Rue de la (mumbles something).ScenesMonica: Keep talking.ScenesChandler: Then we will sprinkle rose pedals on the bed and make love. Not just because it’s romantic, but because I can!ScenesMonica: I love you!Scenes(They start making out and both start to feel something growing below the belt line.)ScenesMonica: (in a French accent) Bonjour, monsieur.ScenesChandler: Okay, don’t say anything, you might scare it away.Scenes(There is a knock on the door.)ScenesChandler: It’s Paris, who knows we’re here!ScenesMonica: (opening the door) Hi Pheebs, what’s up? (She enters.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, you said I could sing at your wedding so, I’m just gonna need a small deposit.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Y’know, just some good faith money to hold the date.ScenesChandler: Pheebs, we’re not giving you a deposit for our wedding!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I see. (Exits angrily.)Scenes[Cut to the living room, Joey is eating a sandwich.)ScenesJoey: They break your heart, don’t they?ScenesPhoebe: Y’know, I don’t really their permission.ScenesJoey: Yeah! If you wanna sing at their wedding, well you sing at their wedding!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! And if you wanna look 19, then you… You gotta do something about your eyes.ScenesJoey: What?! What’s wrong with my eyes.ScenesPhoebe: They give you away! There’s just-there’s just too much wisdom in there. (Joey nods in agreement.) Just put some tea bags on there for like 15 minutes.ScenesJoey: And that’ll get rid of my wisdom?ScenesPhoebe: Maybe just 10 minutes for you.Scenes[Cut back to Monica and Chandler’s room, they are making out again as there’s another knock on the door.]ScenesChandler: Oh, give her the deposit! Give her the ring! I don’t care!Scenes(Monica opens the door to Ross and Rachel.)ScenesMonica: Yes.ScenesRachel: Monica, what did you mean before when you said you didn’t want to talk to anyone, especially me?ScenesChandler: What a great apology! (To Monica) And you accept! Okay, bye-bye!ScenesRachel: No-no, seriously-seriously, what was the especially me part about?ScenesMonica: Well, let’s just say it’s not the first time you’ve stolen my thunder.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) Hey, here’s a thought.Scenes(Rachel ignores him and follows Monica into the kitchen.)ScenesRachel: Monica, what are you talking about?ScenesMonica: My Sweet Sixteen! Remember, you went to third base with my cousin Charlie.ScenesChandler: (entering) Ahh, third base.ScenesMonica: It’s all everybody at the party could talk about!ScenesRachel: Monica, y’know what? The only reason I did that was because your party was so boring!ScenesMonica: (gasps) We had a characturist!ScenesRachel: Oh!!ScenesPhoebe: (singing, angrily)ScenesWhenever I get married, guess who won’t get to sing?ScenesSomebody named Geller! And somebody else named Bing!Scenes(Exits.)ScenesRachel: Monica, your Sweet Sixteen was like a million years ago.ScenesMonica: And yet, here we are doing it again.ScenesRachel: Ugh, Monica I don’t want to steal your stupid thunder!ScenesMonica: Oh please! Why else would you have made out with Ross?!ScenesRoss: Got me. (He shows of his hands.)ScenesRachel: All right, easy mimey, the moment has passed, it ain’t gonna happen!ScenesMonica: I just thought it would be nice if I could have just this one night!ScenesRachel: I swear, I never wanted any part of your night!ScenesMonica: Oh, is that why you did it the secret hallway where nobody ever goes?!ScenesRoss: Uh, Rachel, I’ve been thinking. I don’t think us getting together tonight is such a good idea. I’m calling it off.ScenesChandler: (To Ross) Why to save your dignity my man.ScenesRachel: (ignoring them) Monica, why? Why would I ever want to take away from your night?ScenesMonica: I don’t know! I don’t—maybe you’re feeling a little resentful. Maybe ah, maybe you thought you’d get married first! Maybe you can’t stand the fact that your formally fat friend is getting married before you!ScenesRachel: Oh wow. That—y’know what? That is so unfair. Y’know what? Now I want to steal your thunder! Come on Ross, let’s go have sex!Scenes(Ross tries to dismiss it by making that sound, but decides to go for it and follows Rachel.)ScenesMonica: (yelling after them) I can’t believe you’re gonna have sex on my engagement night!!ScenesChandler: Well, somebody should. (Monica glares at him.)Scenes[Cut to Rachel’s bedroom.]ScenesRoss: Look uh, if we’re gonna do this…ScenesRachel: We’re not gonna do this, all right? She’s just gonna think that we’re doin’ it.ScenesRoss: Oh, I see, so everybody wins.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesRachel: Who is it?ScenesMonica: (outside the door) It’s Monica, open up!ScenesRachel: Okay well Ross! Stop it please! Wait a minute! (Motions for him to follow her lead, but he angrily shakes his head no. So she pokes him.)ScenesRoss: Oww!ScenesRachel: Yeah, you like that baby? (Monica bursts in followed by Chandler.) May we help you?ScenesMonica: I just wanted to say that I hope you do have sex tonight and I hope that you guys get back together, but I must warn you, the night that you announce your engagement I’m going to announce that I’m pregnant!ScenesChandler: How is that ever going to happen?!ScenesRachel: All right Monica, do you want to know why I was with Ross tonight?!ScenesMonica: I know why!ScenesRachel: No you don’t know why!ScenesMonica: Okay! Why?!ScenesRachel: Because! Because I was sad.ScenesMonica: What do you mean?ScenesRachel: Look, I am so…so happy for you guys, but you getting married just reminds me of the fact that I’m not. I’m not even close. And I don’t know, maybe I just wanted to make myself feel better. And I know that that’s dumb, but oh my God you were so depressed when Ross got married that you slept with Chandler!Scenes(Ross looks at Chandler.)ScenesChandler: (To Ross) I don’t care, she slept with me.ScenesRachel: Anyway sweetie, I am, I’m so sorry I ruined your night.ScenesMonica: (starting to cry) I’m sorry I almost made you sleep with Ross. (They hug.)ScenesRoss: (deadpan) Well, I’m going to take off. (To Chandler) Congratulations man.ScenesChandler: Thanks.ScenesRoss: (at the door) And uh, Rachel.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: What can I say, you missed your chance. From now on the only person who’s going to enjoy these bad boys (holds up his hands) is me. (Quickly realizes what he said and exits disgustedly.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Phoebe is singing outside Monica and Chandler’s door.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing)ScenesWe thought Phoebe would leave, but she just stayed and stayed.ScenesThat’s right, I’m here all night, and Chandler will never get l…ScenesChandler: (interrupting her just in time) Hey! Here’s a dollar, consider it a deposit. Please sing at our wedding.ScenesPhoebe: Oh thank you.ScenesChandler: Okay. (Goes back to bed.)ScenesPhoebe: Now… (Starts singing again) "Who will perform the ceremony! Who will perform the cer—(Chandler enters and grabs her guitar and closes the door behind him)—Oh—oh! All right, I’ll pound on him in the morning.ScenesEndScenesThe One With Rachel’s BookScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, everyone is there having breakfast and Joey enters carrying a loaf of bread.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesJoey: Who wants French toast?ScenesRoss: Oh, I’ll have some!ScenesJoey: Good, me too. (Tosses him the loaf.) Eggs and milk are in the fridge. Thanks.ScenesMonica: (entering from her room) Oww!ScenesChandler: What’s the matter honey?ScenesMonica: I don’t know, my hand feels weird. I guess it’s because, I’m engaged! (Shows off the ring.) How long before it starts getting annoying?ScenesPhoebe: It starts?ScenesRachel: Yeah, so let’s get started on the wedding plans!ScenesMonica: Okay! (Runs off.)ScenesChandler: (incredulous) Already?!ScenesRachel: Yeah, we got a lot to do! We gotta think about the flowers, the caterers, the music…ScenesChandler: Oh, I got some thoughts on that.ScenesRachel: Oh wait Chandler, too many cooks…ScenesRoss: Take from me, as the groom all you have to do is show up and try to say the right name.ScenesMonica: (returning) Okay! (Sets down a huge 3" 3-ring binder on the table.)ScenesChandler: What in God’s name is that?!ScenesRoss: Oh my God, the wedding book?! I haven’t seen that since the forth grade!ScenesMonica: This baby has got everything. Take y’know, locations for instance. (She opens up the binder to the locations chapter.) First, organized alphabetically, then geographically, then by square footage.ScenesPhoebe: That is so smart! (To Chandler, under her breath) Break it off. Break it off now.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: A Classroom, Ross is giving a lecture.]
rows.Content: Ross: And that should conclusively prove that I had the idea for Jurassic Park first! Now let’s take a look at… (Phoebe rushes in.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Ross!ScenesRoss: Phoebe, oh my God! Wh-wh-what are you doing here?ScenesPhoebe: I need to talk to you, it’s pretty urgent. It’s about Monica and Chandler.ScenesRoss: Oh my God! Of course, of course. (To the class.) Umm, would you please excuse me for a moment? Umm, do you know each other’s hometowns? Why don’t you… (Motions that they should learn everyone’s hometown.) (To Phoebe) Wh-what’s going on?ScenesPhoebe: Well, umm, not much. But, I was just thinking that since those guys just got engaged that maybe it would be nice if they had some privacy, y’know? So, could I just move in with you for a couple days?ScenesRoss: Umm, okay, yeah, sure. But wh-what’s wrong with Monica and Chandler?ScenesPhoebe: Nothing—Why?!ScenesRoss: Phoebe, you said it was urgent!ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah it is! I’m going to the movies and it starts in like five minutes.ScenesRoss: Do you realize I have a classroom full of students?ScenesPhoebe: (to the students) Oh, I’m sorry. I’m so rude. Does anyone want to come to the movies?

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Rachel and Monica are pretty much telling Chandler what the wedding plans are.]
rows.Content: Monica: All right, so I haven’t cleared the budget with my parents yet, but tell me how this is for music.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: All right umm, a string quartet for the procession.ScenesRachel: Aw.ScenesMonica: A jazz trio for cocktails. The Bay City Rollers for dancing. Wait, that was from my sixth grade wedding.ScenesChandler: Well, you couldn’t get them anyway. Ian doesn’t plan anymore and Derrick… (Off of Rachel and Monica’s looks) And Derrick is a name I shouldn’t know.ScenesJoey: (sitting up from the couch) Hey Mon, do you have another pillow? (Holds up one.) Y’know, something a little snugglyer?ScenesChandler: Why are you napping over here instead of over at your place?ScenesJoey: Well, the duck…ScenesRachel: What?! The duck?! What the hell did the damn duck do now?!ScenesJoey: Uh, well he did not get sick somewhere in there and it was immediately found and properly cleaned up!ScenesChandler: Now, do I get to look at this book or is it just for people who are actually involved in the wedding?ScenesMonica: Of course you can look at it! Yeah, I want your opinion too!ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: Here you go! What do you think about centerpieces?ScenesChandler: Centerpieces!ScenesMonica: Yeah! Roses or Lilies? (Holds up a picture of each.)ScenesChandler: Definitely roses. (Monica and Rachel exchange a look.) Well, I just think they’re a little more weddingy. (Monica holds the Lily picture closer to him.) But Lilies are the clear choice.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! It’s like one mind.ScenesChandler: Uh-huh!ScenesJoey: (sitting up again) Guys! Guys!! You gotta let me nap! Ugh, I’m gonna get cranky!ScenesRachel: Joey, there is a perfectly good couch across the hall!ScenesJoey: Yes it is perfectly good, and it is not one of the places the duck got sick!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesJoey: All right, I’m gonna go! (Gets up and heads for the door.)ScenesRachel: Now Joey, what did the duck do?!ScenesJoey: I don’t know! But he did not eat your face cream!Scenes[Cut to Joey and Rachel’s, Joey enters and heads for his bedroom. He pushes open the door to find the duck.]ScenesJoey: Hey little buddy, how are you feeling? (The duck does not get sick and Joey recoils in horror and heads for the couch.) What the hell is in that face cream? (He’s about to try out the couch but notices the bed in Rachel’s room. He walks into her room and feels the bed.) That’s so soft. (He pulls back the comforter.) Pillowcases! (He climbs in and groans in delight. Suddenly, he feels something under him and pulls out a little beat up paperback book. He opens it and starts to read from it.) (In his head.) Zelda looked at the chimney sweep. Her father, the vicar…(Stops reading and thinks.) The vicar? (Continues reading) …wouldn’t be home for hours. Her loins were burning. She threw caution to the wind and reached out and grabbed his…(Out loud.) Whoa! (Reads on in silence.) Whoa-ho-ho-ho! This is a dirty book! (Continues to read.)

rows.Scenes: Ross’s apartment, Phoebe has moved in and has a massage client on her table she’s set up in the living room. Ross enters and is shocked to see a naked man lying on the table.]
rows.Content: Ross: Uh, Phoebe…ScenesPhoebe: Oh Ross, hi.ScenesRoss: Phoebe, what are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry, I’m with a client right now.ScenesRoss: Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, let’s talk outside.Scenes(They go into the hall.)ScenesRoss: Phoebe, you can’t massage people in my apartment!ScenesPhoebe: What’s the big deal? I did it at Monica and Chandler’s!ScenesRoss: And they knew about it?ScenesPhoebe: (pause as she considers it) Okay, well Ross, what is this really about?ScenesRoss: Look, this is my home and I want to be able to come and go whenever I want!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I will find someplace else to do the rest of my appointments. I just don’t know what the big deal is!ScenesRoss: The big deal is I don’t want naked, greasy strangers in my apartment when I want to kick back with a puzzle—beer! Cold beer.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is sweeping up as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey Joey, what ‘cha doing?ScenesJoey: Sweepin’. Why? Turn you on?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesJoey: Huh. What if I was sweeping a chimney?ScenesRachel: Joey, did you my face cream?Scenes(She walks into her bedroom.)ScenesJoey: Where are you going? The vicar won’t be home for hours.Scenes(She comes back out.)ScenesRachel: Joey, (nervously) where did you learn that word?ScenesJoey: Where do you think, (pause) Zelda?ScenesRachel: (gasps) You found my book?!ScenesJoey: Yeah I did!ScenesRachel: Joey, what-what are you doing going into my bedroom?!ScenesJoey: Okay, look I’m sorry, I went in there to take a nap and I know I shouldn’t have, but you got porn!ScenesRachel: Hey-hey, y’know what? I don’t care! I’m not ashamed of my book. There’s nothing with a woman enjoying a little…erotica. It’s just a healthy expression of female sexuality, which by the way, you will never understand. (She goes into her room.)ScenesJoey: You got porn!

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross is coming out of the living room carrying his salad and a puzzle—beer! Cold beer. And he decides to fold up Phoebe’s massage table, but being Ross has trouble with it as there is a knock on the door. He sets the table back up and opens the door to reveal a beautiful woman.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hello.ScenesWoman: Hi, is uh Phoebe here?ScenesRoss: Uh no-no, she-she’s out for the night.ScenesWoman: Ohh great.ScenesRoss: Can I, can I help you with something?ScenesWoman: Well, I don’t know. Are you a masseur?ScenesRoss: (deadpan) Yes I am.ScenesWoman: Great! (Calls down the hall) Dad! (Her old father walks in.) Thank you so much, I’ll be back to pick him up in an hour. (She walks away.)Scenes(Ross isn’t happy and closes the door slowly.)

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, Monica and Chandler are having dinner with her parents.]
rows.Content: Mrs. Geller: So Chandler, you’re parents must’ve been thrilled when you told them you were engaged.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, I should probably call them.ScenesMr. Geller: I remember when we first got engaged.ScenesChandler: Oh, I don’t think I ever heard that story.ScenesMonica: Oh dad, really you don’t need to…ScenesMr. Geller: (ignoring her) Well, I’d gotten Judy pregnant. I still don’t know that happened.ScenesMrs. Geller: (incredulous) You don’t know how that happened?! Your dog thought my diaphragm was a chew toy!ScenesChandler: What a sweet story.ScenesMonica: Well, at least you’re not hearing it for the first time at your fifth grade Halloween party.ScenesMr. Geller: What?! They wanted a scary story!ScenesMonica: Anyway, we’re really excited about our wedding plans, and well I guess pretty soon we’ll be making a big withdrawal from the Monica wedding fund. (Chandler and her laugh, but her parents don’t.) What?ScenesMrs. Geller: You tell her Jack, I can’t do it.ScenesMonica: What happened? You still have the Monica wedding fund don’t you?ScenesMr. Geller: We have it. Only now, we call it the beach house.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, scene continued from before the break.]
rows.Content: Monica: I don’t believe you spent my wedding fund on the beach house!ScenesMrs. Geller: We’re sorry honey, but we just assumed if you got married after you turned 30 you’d pay for it yourself.ScenesMonica: You bought the beach house when I was 23!ScenesMr. Geller: Which means you had seven years of beach fun and you can’t put a price on that sweetie.ScenesMrs. Geller: We really do feel bad about this though.ScenesMr. Geller: We started saving again when you were dating Richard and then that went to hell, so we redid the kitchen.ScenesMonica: What about when I started dating Chandler?ScenesMrs. Geller: Well it was Chandler! We didn’t think he’d ever propose!ScenesChandler: Clearly I did not start drinking enough at the start of the meal. (Starts to make up for lost time and takes a big swig of his drink.)ScenesMonica: I can’t believe it! That there is no money for my wedding?!ScenesMrs. Geller: We might still have some money, if your father didn’t think it was a good idea to sell ice over the Internet.ScenesMr. Geller: It seemed like such a simple idea.ScenesMrs. Geller: Stupid Jack, the word is stupid.ScenesMr. Geller: All right, enough! I don’t want to hear about it anymore! (Under his breath) Good luck, Chandler. (Chandler takes another drink.)

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, his massage client is on the table and Ross is reluctantly starting his massage. He spreads some lotion in his hands, and doesn’t like it.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay! Now, I’m going to touch you. (He does so, very gingerly.) Ohh, that’s soft. (He starts poking him and notices his salad spoons and starts to massage him with those.)

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica and Chandler are returning from dinner, Rachel is already there.]
rows.Content: Monica: I can’t believe this. Do you think that your parents could help pay for it?ScenesChandler: I don’t know, my mother spent most of her money on her fourth wedding. She’s saving the rest for her divorce. And any extra cash my father has he saves for his yearly trips to (Pause) Dollywood.ScenesRachel: Well what happened at dinner?ScenesMonica: My parents spent the money for our wedding!ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) My God! What did you order?!ScenesRachel: Wait, but there’s no money! Well this is terrible! You guys are gonna have to get married in like a, rec. center!ScenesChandler: Honey, it’s gonna be okay.ScenesMonica: No! No it’s not! It’s not gonna be okay! It sucks! No swing band! No lilies!ScenesRachel: No, y’know what? It’s gonna be okay. I mean you don’t have to have this rustic Italian feast. Y’know? And-and you don’t need, you don’t need this custom-made, empire waisted, duchess, satin gown; you can wear off the rack. (She starts to cry, as does Monica.)ScenesChandler: Look, it really is gonna be okay. The important thing is that we love each other and that we’re gonna get married.ScenesRachel: Do you even understand what off the rack means?!ScenesPhoebe: Look, why don’t you just pay for it yourself?ScenesMonica: How? I don’t have any money.ScenesChandler: Well, I have some.ScenesMonica: How much?ScenesChandler: Well, close to… (Notices Rachel leaning in to hear and decides to write it on a piece of paper and hand it to Monica as Phoebe averts her eyes.)ScenesMonica: Whoa!!! Are you kidding me?!ScenesRachel: Well what?! How-how much is it?!ScenesMonica: It’s enough for wedding scenario eight.ScenesRachel: Ohh! (Whispers.) Really?!ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) How great are you, you little saver?! I mean, the-the amount you have is exactly the budget of my dream wedding!ScenesRachel: (starting to cry) Ohh, you guys are so made for each other.ScenesChandler: Well, you’re not suggesting that we spend all of the money on the wedding?ScenesRachel and Monica: Ah, yeah!ScenesChandler: Well, come on, I’ve been saving this money for six years and I kinda had some of it earmarked for the future, not just for a party.ScenesPhoebe: (reading the slip of paper) Wow! (In a sultry voice) Hello, Mr. Chandler.ScenesMonica: This is the most special day of our lives.ScenesChandler: No, I realize that honey, but I’m not gonna spend all of the money on one party.ScenesMonica: Honey, umm I-I love you, (laughs) but umm, if you call our wedding a party one more time, you may not get invited. Okay? (Laughs) Listen, we could always earn more money, okay? But uh, we’re only gonna get married once.ScenesChandler: Look, I understand, but I have to put my foot down. Okay? The answer is no.ScenesMonica: You-you’re gonna have to put your foot down?ScenesChandler: Yes, I am!ScenesPhoebe: Wow, money and a firm hand. Finally a Chandler I can get on board with.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Ross are there as Rachel enters and sees Joey sitting there.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Rach.ScenesRachel: (quietly) Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey Rach, do you smell smoke?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh, I get it, smoke, chimney, chimney sweep, very funny, ha-ha.ScenesJoey: No-no-no, I’m serious. You don’t smell it? Something’s on fire.ScenesRachel: Well no, I don’t smell anything.ScenesJoey: Oh, y’know what? It’s probably just your burnin’ loins.ScenesRoss: (sitting down) Hey, what are you guys, what are you guys talking about?ScenesRachel: Nothing!ScenesRoss: (takes a drink) Damn, this coffee’s cold! Hey Rach, do you mind if I heat this up on your loins? (Joey and he both laugh.)ScenesRachel: Y’know, I can not believe you told him, Joey!ScenesRoss: So I guess you bought that book after we broke up huh?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh, yeah I did, because I wore out my first copy when I was with you. (Exits.)ScenesRoss: (chases her) Oh yeah, yeah? Well uh, when we were going out, I read tons of porno magazines! (Realizes a table of women overheard him.) (To that table.) ‘Sup?ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Ross! How could you do that to an old man?!ScenesRoss: (looking at the table) Excuse me ladies. (To Phoebe) I’m sorry?ScenesPhoebe: My massage client, Arthur? His daughter called and said that some guy that worked for me gave him a really weird massage this afternoon.ScenesRoss: (incredulous) I gave him an extremely professional massage!ScenesPhoebe: He said you poked at him with wooden spoons.ScenesRoss: Okay, so it wasn’t uh, a traditional massage. But I did give him accu-pressure with a pair of chopsticks. And, and I gently exfoliated him with, with a mop.ScenesPhoebe: Well, he’s never coming back! Okay? You just cost me eight dollars a week!ScenesRoss: Hey, y’know what? This is your fault! You’re the one that didn’t move his-his appointment.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it’s my fault?! You didn’t have to massage him! You could’ve sent him away! You could’ve not rolled Tonka trucks up and down his back!ScenesRoss: He said he liked that!! Oh you’re right, you’re right. I’m sorry.ScenesJoey: Dude, what are you massaging an old man for?ScenesRoss: His daughter was hot.ScenesJoey: Gotcha.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is looking at the wedding book as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: Listen umm, I’ve been thinking, it’s not fair for me to ask you to spend all of your money on our wedding. I mean, you work, you work really hard for that.ScenesChandler: Ehh.ScenesMonica: Eh, you work for that.ScenesChandler: Look, I thought about it too, and I’m sorry. I think we should spend all of the money on the wedding.ScenesMonica: You do?!ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’m putting my foot down. Yeah look, when I proposed I told you that I would do anything to make you happy, and if having the perfect wedding makes you happy then, then that’s what we’re gonna do.ScenesMonica: Oh, you’re so sweet. (They hug and kiss.) Oh, but wait, what about our, what about the future and stuff?ScenesChandler: Eh, forget about the future and stuff! So we only have two kids, y’know? We’ll pick our favorite and that one will get to go to college.ScenesMonica: You thought about that?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesMonica: How many kids were we gonna have?ScenesChandler: Uh, four, a boy, twin girls and another boy.ScenesMonica: What else did you think about?ScenesChandler: Well, stuff like where’d we live, y’know? Like a small place outside the city, where our kids could learn to ride their bikes and stuff. Y’know, we could have a cat that had a bell on it’s collar and we could hear it every time it ran through the little kitty door. Of course, we’d have an apartment over the garage where Joey could grow old.ScenesMonica: (laughs) Y’know what? I-I don’t want a big, fancy wedding.ScenesChandler: Sure you do.ScenesMonica: No, I want everything you just said. I want a marriage.ScenesChandler: You sure?ScenesMonica: Uh-hmm.ScenesChandler: I love you so much.ScenesMonica: I love you. (They kiss.) Hey listen umm, when, when you were talkin’ about our future you said cat, but you meant dog right.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, totally!ScenesMonica: Oh good.ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is balancing her checkbook as Joey enters from his room wearing a hockey helmet, gloves, and shin guards.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hello, Zelda.ScenesRachel: Who are you supposed to be?ScenesJoey: The vicar!ScenesRachel: Do you even know what a vicar is?ScenesJoey: Like a goalie, right?ScenesRachel: (sarcastically) Yeah. Look Joey, it’s enough all right?! You keep making these stupid jokes and this sleazy innuendoes and it’s—I’m not—it’s just not funny anymore!ScenesJoey: All right, I’m sorry. Rach I—Rach I’m sorry. Okay? I’m sorry! Maybe I can make up for it by, taking you roughly in the barn. (Giggles.)ScenesRachel: All right! Y’know what? That’s it! You wanna do it?! Let’s do it!ScenesJoey: Huh?ScenesRachel: (starting to move closer to him) That’s right, I wanna do it with you! I’ve been trying to fight it, but you just said all the right things.ScenesJoey: (nervously backing away) I-I-I-I did? (He puts a stool in front of her.)ScenesRachel: (moves the stool out of the way) Yeah! Ohh, I’ve been waitin’ so long to get on that body!ScenesJoey: This body? (He backs into the kitchen.)ScenesRachel: Yeah that’s right! Come on Joey; sex me up!ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, you’re startin’ to sound like the butcher’s wife there in-in chapter seven.ScenesRachel: Oh, come on now, don’t keep me waiting. Get those clothes off! But, I would keep that helmet on because you’re in for a rough ride! (He backs into the door.)ScenesJoey: I don’t want to, I’m scared.Scenes(Rachel walks away, pleased with her self.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With Phoebe’s CookiesScenesWritten by: Sherry Bilsing & Ellen PlummerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel, Phoebe, Joey, Ross, and Monica are all there as Chandler enters wearing glasses.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey, you guys!ScenesRoss and Rachel: Hey!ScenesChandler: So, what do you think?ScenesRoss: About what?ScenesRachel: Yeah, what?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesChandler: Are you kidding? Okay, I’ll give you a hint; I’ll give you a hint. (Points to his glasses.)ScenesJoey: Eyes! No, no. Your eyes! No. Chandler’s eyes!ScenesChandler: I got glasses!ScenesRoss: Well, you-you’ve always had glasses.ScenesChandler: No I didn’t!ScenesRoss: Are you sure?ScenesRachel: Yeah-yeah, did-didn’t you use to have a pair? They were really round, burgundy, and they made you look kind of umm…ScenesJoey: Feminine.ScenesRachel: Yes!ScenesChandler: No!ScenesMonica: Sweetie, I think the glasses look great. They make you look really sexy.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesChandler: (sitting down on the arm of her chair) You didn’t think I used to wear glasses, right?ScenesMonica: Of course! (She mouths, "I have no idea," to the rest of the gang.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Monica are making some sandwiches.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: So what do you guys want for an engagement present?ScenesChandler: That’s okay Pheebs, we’re not having a party or anything, so you don’t have to get us…ScenesMonica: (interrupts him) If someone wants to give us a present, we don’t want to deprive them of that joy.ScenesRachel: Oh, y’know what you should get ‘em? One of those little uh, portable CD players.ScenesMonica: Oh, I already have one.ScenesPhoebe: Not unless someone borrowed it and left it at the gynecologist.ScenesRachel: Yeah, and-and-and by someone, she means Joey.ScenesMonica: Hey, I know I what I want!ScenesChandler: What we want honey.ScenesMonica: No, you don’t want this. I want to have your grandmother’s cookie recipe.ScenesPhoebe: You mean the chocolate chip cookie recipe?ScenesMonica: Uh-huh, yeah.ScenesPhoebe: You mean the one that my grandmother made me swear on her deathbed that I would never let out of our family?ScenesChandler: Dying people say the craziest things.ScenesMonica: I wanted it for years! I was gonna make cookies for my children.ScenesPhoebe: Break my heart—Oh, all right.ScenesMonica: Okay. I’m gonna be the mom that makes the world’s best chocolate chip cookies.ScenesChandler: Our kids are gonna be fat aren’t they.ScenesJoey: (entering) Ahoy!ScenesChandler: Hey! How’s the boat?!ScenesJoey: Great! I’m finally getting into this sailing stuff.ScenesMonica: Oh, so you finally took it out of the marina huh?ScenesJoey: Why would I do that? It took three guys to get the thing in there!ScenesPhoebe: If you don’t sail your boat, what do you do on it?ScenesJoey: Oh, it’s great! It’s a great place to just kinda, sit, hang around, drink a few beers, eat some chips. (He says that as he sits, hangs around, drinks a beer, and eats a chip.)ScenesChandler: Well, it’s good that you finally have a place to do that.ScenesRachel: Y’know Joey, I could teach you to sail if you want.ScenesJoey: You could?ScenesRachel: Yeah! I’ve been sailing my whole life. When I was fifteen my dad bought me my own boat.ScenesPhoebe: Your own boat?ScenesRachel: What?! What?! He was trying to cheer me up! My pony was sick.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are there. He takes off his glasses and starts chewing on the ear piece.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Do you know what I was thinkin’?ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: Nothing, I just like to go like this. (Does it again.)ScenesRoss: (entering from the bathrooms) Hey Chandler, what are you doing tonight?ScenesChandler: Uh why, do you have a lecture?ScenesRoss: No, why?ScenesChandler: Then free as a bird. What’s up?ScenesRoss: My dad wanted to know if you wanted to play racquetball with us.ScenesMonica: Wow! That’s great! Dad must really like you, he doesn’t ask just anyone to play.ScenesRoss: Yeah and he didn’t really ask for you, he asked for Chancy, I assumed he meant you.ScenesChandler: Well, did-did you correct him?ScenesRoss: No, I-I thought it would be more fun this way.ScenesMonica: This is so cool, maybe this is something you can do every week.ScenesRoss: Or you can sit with him on the front porch and make sure no one steals the trash cans. He does that every week too.ScenesMonica: Oh, just so you know, you-you have to let him win.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesMonica: He hates to lose.ScenesChandler: Oh no problem, maybe I’ll play with my left hand.ScenesRoss: You’re not a lefty?ScenesChandler: Does anybody know me?!Scenes(Phoebe enters, walks up to Monica, and exhales exasperatedly.)ScenesMonica: What’s wrong Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: I just went to my old apartment to get you the-the cookie recipe and the stupid fire burned it up!ScenesMonica: No!! Why didn’t you make a copy and-and keep it in a fireproof box and keep it at least a hundred yards from the original?!!ScenesPhoebe: (pauses as he figures out how to answer that) Because I’m normal! That was the one legacy my grandmother left me, and I know you wanted it as an engagement present.ScenesRoss: Oh, we have to get you an engagement present?ScenesChandler: Don’t worry about it Pheebs.ScenesRoss: No one got me an engagement present.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, here I wish you health and happiness. (She hands Monica a cookie in a plastic baggie.)ScenesChandler: An old cookie?ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) This is what happens when you don’t register for gifts!ScenesPhoebe: See no-no, I made a batch and I froze it, and this is the only one left.ScenesChandler: We can’t accept this.ScenesPhoebe: Why not?ScenesChandler: ‘Cause it’s gross.ScenesMonica: No! Wait! I think I can figure out the recipe from this cookie! I do stuff like this at work all the time.ScenesPhoebe: Really?!ScenesMonica: Yeah! I bet I can do it.Scenes(Chandler looks over and sees Ross glaring at them.)ScenesChandler: Okay, we owe you a present.ScenesRoss: Two! I’ve been engaged twice!

rows.Scenes: The Mr. Bowmont (Joey’s boat), she’s shown to be in one of the waterways around New York, but in reality she’s in a sound stage on the Warner Bros. lot and we see New York from the water in some rather poor green screen shots. Rachel and Joey are on board.]
rows.Content: Joey: (drinking a beer) Look at this clown! Just because he’s got a bigger boat he thinks he can take up the whole river. (Yelling) Get out of the way jackass! (To Rachel) Who names his boat Coast Guard anyway?ScenesRachel: That is the Coast Guard.ScenesJoey: What are they doing out here? The coast’s all the way over there. (Points to the coast, meanwhile there is coast behind him.)ScenesRachel: Joey, just ignore the boats all right? We’re not finished with the lesson yet.ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesRachel: Okay, I’m just gonna go over the basic points just one more time, are you ready?ScenesJoey: Come on Rach, not again. I got it! Okay? Let’s start sailing, and I want to go over there (Points) where that boatload of girls is! (Yelling to them) Yo-ho-ho!ScenesRachel: Oh, okay. Is that what you want to do? You wanna go over and give a little shout out to the old, hot chickas? Okay, let’s do that Sailor Joe. Quick question though, (grabs some of the rigging) what’s this called?ScenesJoey: Uh, boat rope.ScenesRachel: Wrong! How do you get the mainsail up?ScenesJoey: Uhh, rub it?ScenesRachel: No. What do you do if I say we are coming about?ScenesJoey: I’d say, come again. No-no, wait I-I-I know this one, I know this one, uh…Scenes(Rachel blasts an air horn in his ear.)ScenesRachel: Time’s up, now your dead.ScenesJoey: And deaf!ScenesRachel: Okay, you just go on and make your little jokey-jokes, but if you do not know what you are doing out at sea you will die at sea. Am I getting through to you sailor?! (She punctuates each word by slapping him on the forehead.)ScenesJoey: Yes.ScenesRachel: Don’t just say yes! This isn’t a game, Joey you can really get hurt out here. Okay, so do you want to pay attention or do you want to die?!ScenesJoey: I want to make a ship to shore call to Chandler.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica and Phoebe are trying to determine the cookie recipe by eating small pieces.]
rows.Content: Monica: All right, I definitely taste nutmeg.ScenesPhoebe: You do?ScenesMonica: You don’t? (Laughs) Well, that’s the difference between a professional and a layman.ScenesPhoebe: That and arrogance.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey! How was sailing?ScenesJoey: I don’t want to talk about it. Y’know, you could’ve at least saved me a whole cookie. (He grabs what’s left of the cookie and pops in his mouth.)ScenesMonica and Phoebe: No-wait-no-no!!!!!!!ScenesJoey: (recoils in horror) Women are mean!!! (Storms out.)ScenesPhoebe: I can’t believe that! Now the only thing left of my grandmother’s legacy is this crumb. (She picks it up with her finger and holds it out to Monica.) I wish you a long and happy marriage.ScenesRoss: (entering with Chandler) Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey! How was it?ScenesRoss: Well I had a great time! Umm, Chancy on the other hand…ScenesChandler: I will tell the story! It was going great. I let him win. We were bonding. He even said I could call him dad.ScenesRoss: And what did he ask you not to call him?ScenesChandler: Daddy. All right look, here’s the story. (Flashback to Chandler about to enter the steam room as he does the voice-over.) Well, we had just finished playing racquetball and we were gonna take a steam. I walk into the steam room and it was really steamy. (The flashback shows his glasses fog up and him trying to find his way around the steam filled room. He takes off his glasses.) So I take off my glasses and that’s when in happened.Scenes[Cut to the flashback, Chandler’s no longer doing the voice-over.]ScenesChandler: Guys?ScenesRoss: Over here. (You can see Ross sitting at the far wall.)ScenesMr. Geller: Have a seat son. (You can see Mr. Geller sitting closer to the door as Chandler walks over and sits in his lap.) Hey!! (Chandler quickly jumps off and sits next to him with a shocked expression on his face.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is finished telling everyone what happened.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh my God Chandler! I can’t believe it!ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesMonica: You gave my father a lap dance!ScenesChandler: Why do they put so much steam in there?!ScenesRoss: ‘Cause otherwise they’d have to call it the room room.ScenesChandler: Why? Okay? Why? Wh-wh-why did that have to happen?ScenesPhoebe: Come on, it’s not that big a deal!ScenesChandler: Not that big a deal? There…there was touching of things.ScenesRoss: Now, I know you wanted to bond with my dad, but did you really have to bond to that part?ScenesMonica: Listen, I’m sure that dad doesn’t care. He probably thought this was funny; he’ll be telling this story for years!ScenesChandler: I don’t want him to tell this story for years.ScenesRoss: Oh, but he will. He still tells the story how Monica tried to escape from fat camp.ScenesMonica: I wasn’t escaping.ScenesRoss: Then how did you get caught in the barbed wire?ScenesMonica: I was trying to help out a squirrel.ScenesRoss: You were trying to eat it!Scenes(The phone rings.)ScenesChandler: If that is your father calling to tell this story then the marriage is off!ScenesMonica: (takes the phone from Ross) Come on. (Answering phone) Hello? (Listens) I’m sorry you have the wrong number. (Listens) (Whispering) Okay, I’ll call you later dad. I love you. (Hangs up.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (getting up) All right, I’m off to see your dad.ScenesRoss: Whoa-whoa, aren’t you a little over dressed?ScenesRachel: (laughing) Yeah, and-and you better make sure he tips you this time.ScenesChandler: Look, I figured I would try to convince him not to tell the story anymore, and I figure the best way to do that is face to face—And by face I don’t mean his lap. And by face, I don’t mean my ass. (Exits.)ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) Hey are you getting Monica and Chandler an engagement present?ScenesRachel: I don’t know. Y’know, they didn’t get us anything.ScenesRoss: Thank you!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesRachel: Well hello! So, when are we gettin’ back out on the water matey?ScenesJoey: Oh uh, I don’t know the boat way to say this, but uh never!ScenesRachel: Why not?ScenesJoey: Because! You’re mean on the boat!ScenesRachel: What? I was just trying to teach you.ScenesJoey: Well, lesson learned! Rachel is mean!ScenesRoss: Yeeeeeep… Yep-yep-yep-yep-yep. I remember when she took out on her dad’s boat she wouldn’t let me help at all.ScenesRachel: Excuse me, I wanted you to help, but you couldn’t move your arms because you were wearing three life jackets.ScenesRoss: You have to respect the sea! (Storms off.)ScenesRachel: Look Joey, I’m sorry if-if you thought that was mean, but I gotta tell ya something. That was not mean. Okay, my father is mean. He used to yell at me all the time on the boat, I mean it was horrible. I was just being a good teacher.ScenesJoey: Does a good teacher say, "Put down the beer pinhead!?ScenesRachel: Well, does a good student drink seven beers during his first lesson?ScenesJoey: Six and a half! You knocked that last one out of my hand! Remember?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I didn’t want you to get hit by the boom!ScenesJoey: Well it hit me anyway! And it would’ve hurt a lot less if I had finished that last beer.ScenesRachel: All right, y’know what? I-I’m sorry. I will try to tone it down and uh stop yelling.ScenesJoey: You won’t boss me around anymore?ScenesRachel: I won’t boss you around.ScenesJoey: And you’ll be nice?ScenesRachel: And, I’ll be nice.ScenesJoey: And you’ll be topless?ScenesRachel: And—Joey!ScenesJoey: Do you want me to learn?!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is trying out different cookie recipes. Ross and Phoebe are the tasting group.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, here’s batch 22. Ohh, maybe these’ll taste a little like your grandmother’s. This has a little bit of orange peel, but no nutmeg.ScenesRoss: Let’s give it a shot.ScenesMonica: Okay. Man, I have not made this many cookies since I was in the ninth grade.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, what was that for? Like a bake sale?ScenesMonica: No, just a Friday night.Scenes(They all take a bite.)ScenesRoss: Ohh, these are pretty good.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but not as good as batch 17.ScenesRoss: Which one was that?ScenesMonica: The ones we had right after you almost threw up.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah! Batch 17 was good. I did not like batch 16. (Burps a little bit.) I’m okay.ScenesPhoebe: Are there anymore from the good batch? ‘Cause we could just work off of those.ScenesRoss: Yeah, ooh yeah, I think there is one from batch 17 left, uh… (Grabs a cookie and takes a big bite out of it and doesn’t like it.) It’s batch 16! 16 people! Get out of the way! (Gets up and runs for the bathroom.)

rows.Scenes: The Mr. Bowmont, its Joey’s second lesson with Rachel as the resident sailing expert.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay Joey honey, you’re doing really good! All right, now I’m just gonna need you to step to the port side. (Joey pauses as he tries to remember which side is the port side.) Remember? Remember how we talked about the port side?ScenesJoey: Ohh yeah.ScenesRachel: Right?ScenesJoey: Nope.ScenesRachel: It’s left sweetie, but that’s okay sweetie, that’s a tough one.ScenesJoey: I don’t know why you just don’t say left.ScenesRachel: Okay, go to the left. (Joey goes starboard or sits on the right side of the boat.) The left!ScenesJoey: Huh?ScenesRachel: (yelling) Just sit over there!! (Points to the port side.)ScenesJoey: (hurrying over) Okay! Okay, you’re yelling again! See that?ScenesRachel: No! No-no, no-no-no, very quiet, said with love, no yelling.ScenesJoey: Oh, y’know what? Since I’m here, I think I’m gonna have me a little beer on the port side. (Grabs and opens one.)ScenesRachel: Okay Joey, we’re luffing a little bit, so could you tighten up the cunningham? (The mainsail has started to flap in the wind and has stopped working efficiently; she wants him to tighten it so that it starts working again.)ScenesJoey: Uh, wow, you just said a bunch of stuff I didn’t know there.ScenesRachel: Joey, come on! We just went over this! (She does it instead.)ScenesJoey: Oh, y’know, when we did that was when that bird was flying overhead with the fish in his mouth. Did you see it? It was gross!ScenesRachel: (angrily) No! All right?! I did not see the bird! I did not see the fish! I did not see the piece of Styrofoam that was shaped like Mike Tyson! I did not, because I was trying to teach you how to sail a boat! Which obviously is an impossible thing to do!ScenesJoey: All right that’s it! You’re yelling and I don’t see you taking your top off! I quit!ScenesRachel: What do you mean you quit?! You can’t quit!ScenesJoey: Why not?!ScenesRachel: Because you’re not finished yet and I won’t have it! Greens do not quit!ScenesJoey: Greens? I’m a Tribbiani! And Tribbianis quit!ScenesRachel: Oh my God, wait did I—I just said Greens don’t quit didn’t I? (Pause) (Angrily) Did I just say Greens don’t quit?!ScenesJoey: Yes! Yes! You did and you’re still yelling at me!ScenesRachel: No! No! No! I’m not yelling at you, I’m just yelling near you. Oh God Joey, ohh I’m my father. Oh my God, this is horrible! I’ve been trying so hard not to be my mother I did not see this comin’. Oh, Joey, I’m sorry. I’m so sorry. I just wanted you to learn.ScenesJoey: Well, hey I did learn.ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Come on.ScenesRachel: Awww…ScenesJoey: Yeah, it’s okay. I know what a mainsail is. (Points to it. It’s the larger sail.) I know, I know to duck when the boom comes across. I-I know port is right.ScenesRachel: Left.ScenesJoey: Damnit!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, the cookie trying period has pasted. Monica, Phoebe, and Ross are reflecting on the day’s events.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Y’know, I bet it would actually make my grandmother very happy to know that we’re trying to figure out her recipe. I bet she’s l-l-lookin’ up at us and smiling right now.ScenesRoss: Looking up?ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah—No, she was really nice to me, but she’s in hell for sure.ScenesMonica: Well, I’ve tried everything. I give up. I guess I’m not gonna be the mom who makes the world’s best chocolate cookies. I do make the best duck confit with broccoli rabe.  Kids love that right.ScenesRoss: Aww, Pheeb, come on isn’t there any relative that would have the recipe? What about, what about your sister?ScenesPhoebe: Oh no-no, no, I made a promise to myself that the next time I would talk to Ursula would be over my dead body. And that’s not happening ‘til October 15th, 2032.ScenesRoss: That’s the day you’re gonna die? See—darnit, I’ve got shuffleboard that day.ScenesPhoebe: That’s what you think.ScenesMonica: Well, I mean what about friends of your grandmother’s? Wouldn’t they have the recipe?ScenesPhoebe: Well, y’know I may have relatives in France who would know. My grandmother said she got the recipe from her grandmother, Nesele Tolouse.ScenesMonica: What was her name?ScenesPhoebe: Nesele Toulouse.ScenesMonica: Nestle Tollhouse?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you Americans always butcher the French language.ScenesMonica: (grabbing a bag of Nestle Tollhouse chocolate chips) Phoebe, is this the recipe? (Tosses her the bag.)ScenesPhoebe: (reading the recipe on the back of the bag) Yes!! (Realizes.) Ohh.ScenesMonica: I cannot believe that I just spent the last two days trying to figure out the recipe and it was in my cupboard the whole time!ScenesPhoebe: I know! You see it is stuff like this which is why (Looking down) you’re burning in hell!!

rows.Scenes: The Gym, Chandler and Mr. Geller are heading for the whirlpool room.]
rows.Content: Chandler: So you understand, I’d feel a lot more comfortable if you didn’t tell people what happened. Y’know, I’m a little…I’m a little embarrassed about it.ScenesMr. Geller: I understand completely, there’s nothing more horrifying than embarrassing yourself in front of your in-laws. As a matter of fact, when I started dating Judy I was unemployed, and her father asked me what I did for a living and I told him I was a lawyer.ScenesChandler: What did you do when they found out?ScenesMr. Geller: They never did, so if ever see me giving them legal advice just nod along. Shall we?Scenes(Chandler nods along and they enter the whirlpool room and remove their robes. Only Chandler is lacking a certain item of clothing. You see this is a coed whirlpool, which means swimsuits, and in fact there are two women already there and Chandler didn’t seem to wear his. Needless to say, everyone is shocked, including Chandler.)ScenesChandler: So I guess we wear swimsuits in here!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: The Mr. Bowmont, is tied up alongside the pier; Joey and Rachel are relaxing.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Well Joey, I hate to admit it, your way of sailing is a lot more fun.ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah. Hey, why don’t you give a pull on that rope? (Points.)ScenesRachel: Ohh we’re not sailing.ScenesJoey: Just pull on it.ScenesRachel: All right. (She does so and it brings the cooler closer together.) Hey-hey-hey!! (Sees what’s in the cooler.) Sandwiches!ScenesJoey: What else?ScenesRachel: (hands him one) Here you go.ScenesJoey: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Oh wow! (She takes a bite, but holds the sandwich vertically so that the stuff falls out.)ScenesJoey: What are you doing?ScenesRachel: Ohh, sorry.ScenesJoey: What you—don’t hold it like that! You’re lettin’ all the good stuff fall out.Scenes(More falls out.)ScenesRachel: Ohh whoops.ScenesJoey: Careful! You’re wasting good pastrami! (Gasps.) Oh my God! I’m my dad!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Rachel’s AssistantScenesWritten by: Brian BoyleScenesDirected by: David SchwimmerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, everyone is there and they are finishing watching the first episode of Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. Joey is of course Mac.]
rows.Content: Mac: (on TV) Well, if we learned one thing today C.H.E.E.S.E. is that cheerleaders and high explosives don’t mix. (Cut to Joey laughing while Rachel, Chandler, and Monica aren’t amused.)ScenesC.H.E.E.S.E: You can say that again Mac.ScenesMac: Well, I couldn’t have done it without you buddy. You’re a genius.ScenesC.H.E.E.S.E: Oh yeah? Well then how come I can’t get my VCR to stop blinking 12:00?Scenes(They both break into a huge laugh and do that stop motion thing they had at the end of ChiPs.)ScenesJoey: (laughing and turning off the TV) So, what did you guys think?Scenes(They all make happy faces as they are unable to express their feelings verbally. Finally, the phone rings and the race to answer it is won by Monica.)ScenesMonica: (on phone) Hello? (Listens) Hold on please. Joey, it’s your mom. (Hands him the phone.)ScenesChandler: It’s your mommy. It’s your mommy.ScenesRoss: Ohhhh…ScenesRachel: That’s nice.ScenesJoey: (on phone) Mom, so what did you think? (He walks away allowing the gang a chance to figure out what they’re gonna say.)ScenesRachel: Well that was umm…Okay.ScenesRoss: It wasn’t the best.ScenesChandler: That was one of the worse things ever. And not just on TV.ScenesMonica: Wh-what are we gonna tell him?ScenesRoss: Well, the lighting was okay.ScenesRachel: Ohh no you don’t! You got lighting last time, lighting is mine!ScenesMonica: And I have costumes.ScenesRoss: Oh great! That means I’m stuck with, "So, we were watching you in there (Points to the TV) and you were sittin’ right here! Whoa!Scenes(Phoebe gets up.)ScenesRachel: What are you gonna do Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know. I don’t know. I can’t lie to him again. Oh no I—no! I’m just gonna press my breasts up against him.ScenesChandler: And say nothing?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, yeah that’s right.ScenesJoey: (hangs up the phone) Wow! Well, my folks really liked it! So what-what did you guys think? (Phoebe smiles, walks up to him, and presses her breasts against him.) It wasn’t that good.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Monica are reading on the couch.]
rows.Content: Monica: Phoebe, do you think that your favorite animal says much about you?ScenesPhoebe: What? You mean behind my back?ScenesRachel: (entering, excitedly) Oh! Hi you guys, oh my God! You’ll never gonna believe happened to me today! I am sitting in my office and…ScenesJoey: (entering from bathrooms excitedly) You guys! You guys! You’re not gonna believe what my agent just told me!ScenesRachel: Joey! Kinda in the middle of a story here!ScenesJoey: Ooh, sorry. Sorry. You finish, go.ScenesRachel: Okay, so anyway I’m sittin’ in my office and guess who walks in.ScenesJoey: I’m gonna be on two TV shows!ScenesMonica and Phoebe: Oh, that’s great!!ScenesRachel: Joey!ScenesJoey: Oh, you weren’t finished?ScenesRachel: Yeah! Guess who walks into my office is the end of my story. (To Monica and Phoebe) It was Ralph Lauren! (Monica and Phoebe gasp) Ralph Lauren walked into my office!ScenesJoey: Uh Rach, if you’re gonna start another story, at least let me finish mine.ScenesRachel: It’s the same story.ScenesJoey: (groans in disgust) Wow, it’s really long.ScenesRachel: (ignoring him) Anyway, Ralph just came in to tell me that he’s so happy with my work that he wants me to be the new merchandising manager for polo retail.ScenesMonica: Still get a discount on wedding dresses?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesMonica: I’m so happy for you!ScenesJoey: Well, these really are the days of our lives.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesJoey: Well, since you ask. They want me back on Days of Our Lives!ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) Oh God!ScenesRachel: I got—I get a big pay raise!ScenesPhoebe: Oh hey!ScenesJoey: I’ll be playing Drake Remoray’s twin brother, Stryker!ScenesMonica: Oooh!ScenesRachel: I get to hire my own assistant!ScenesMonica and Phoebe: Ahhh!!ScenesJoey: (jumps up) Well—I got a head rush from standing up to fast right there.

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s New Office, she’s interviewing a potential new assistant, Hilda.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (reading the resume) And you were at this job for four years?ScenesHilda: That’s right.ScenesRachel: Okay, well this is all very impressive Hilda, um I just have one last question for you. Uh, how did I do? Was this okay?ScenesHilda: What?ScenesRachel: I’ve never interviewed anyone before. I’ve actually never had anyone work for me before. Although when I was a kid, we did have a maid, but this is-this isn’t the same thing.ScenesHilda: No dear. It’s not.ScenesRachel: No. Yeah, and I know that. All right, well thank you so much for coming in it was nice to meet you.ScenesHilda: Thank you! Good meeting you.ScenesRachel: All right. (Hilda exits) I’m a total pro!Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and a handsome man enters.)ScenesMan: Hello?ScenesRachel: (seeing him) Wow! H-umm! Hi! Yes, uh I’m sorry the models are actually down the hall.ScenesMan: Actually, I’m here about the assistant job.ScenesRachel: Really?! (Taking his resume) Okay well then, all right, well just have a seat there. Umm, so what’s—what is—what’s your name?ScenesMan: Tag Jones.ScenesRachel: Uh-huh, go on.ScenesTag: That’s it. That’s my whole name.ScenesRachel: That’s your whole name, okay of course it is! Okay, well let’s-let’s just have a look-see here. (Looking at his resume)ScenesTag: I know I haven’t worked in an office before, and I really don’t have a lot of experience, but uh…ScenesRachel: Oh come on, what are you talking about? You’ve got three years painting houses. Two whole summers at T.G.I. Friday’s, come on!ScenesTag: It’s lame, I know. But I’m a goal-oriented person, very eager to learn…ScenesRachel: Okay, hold on just a second. (She grabs a camera out of the desk and takes his picture.) I’m sorry, it’s for human resources, everybody has to do it. Could you just stand up please?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is sitting on the couch when some unknown guy comes in and sits in their easy chair.]
rows.Content: Chandler: No-no-no-no. (Waves him away as Monica and Phoebe enter whispering to each other.) Hey! (Monica shushes him.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Monica) Anyway, I should go. Okay, bye.ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) Hey sweetie.ScenesChandler: Hi sweetie. So, what was with all the whispering?ScenesMonica: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.ScenesChandler: Secret? Married people aren’t supposed to have secrets between one another. We have too much love and respect for one another.ScenesMonica: Awww. (Kisses him.) But still no.ScenesChandler: No I’m serious, we should tell each other everything. I do not have any secrets from you.ScenesMonica: Really? Okay, so why don’t you tell me what happened to Ross Junior year at Disneyland?ScenesChandler: Oh no-no, I can’t do that.ScenesMonica: If you tell me, I’ll tell you what Phoebe said.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesChandler: So, Ross and I are going to Disneyland and we stop at this restaurant for tacos. And when I say restaurant, I mean a guy, a hibachi, and the trunk of his car. So Ross has about 10 tacos. And anyway, we’re on Space Mountain and Ross starts to feel a little iffy.ScenesMonica: Oh my God. He threw up?ScenesChandler: No, he visited a little town south of throw up. (Monica laughs hysterically.) So what was Phoebe’s secret?ScenesMonica: Oh, Nancy Thompson from Phoebe’s old massage place is getting fired.ScenesChandler: That’s it?! I gave up my Disneyland story for that?ScenesMonica: That’s right! You lose sucker!! (Pause) Please still marry me.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Chandler, you have an assistant right?ScenesChandler: (angrily) Did she call? You-you told her I was sick right? Always tell her I am sick!ScenesRachel: No, I-I just don’t know how you decide who to hire. I mean I’ve got it narrowed down to two people. One of them has great references and a lot of experience and then there’s this guy…ScenesChandler: What about him?ScenesRachel: I love him. He’s so pretty I wanna cry! I don’t know what to do. Tell me what to do.ScenesPhoebe: Come on you know what to do! You hire the first one! You don’t hire an assistant because they’re cute, you hire them because they’re qualified.ScenesRachel: Uh-huh. No, I hear what you’re saying and-and-and that makes a lot of sense but can I just say one more thing? (Takes out his picture.) Look how pretty!ScenesPhoebe: Let’s see. (Looking at the picture) Oh my God! Oh… But no! No! You can’t-you can’t hire him, because that—it’s not professional. Umm, this is for me (The picture) yes? Thanks. (Puts it in her pocket.)ScenesRachel: Okay you’re right. I’ll hire Hilda tomorrow. Dumb old perfect for the job Hilda!ScenesChandler: Let me see this guy. (Phoebe hands him the picture.) W-H-Wow! Don’t show this to Monica! And don’t tell her about the W-H-Wow!

rows.Scenes: The Days of Our Lives producer’s office, Joey is entering to find Terry there.]
rows.Content: Terry: Hey-hey-hey Joey!ScenesJoey: Hey Terry!ScenesTerry: Good to see you again!ScenesJoey: It’s been a while, huh? Wow, it’s funny these halls look smaller then they used to.ScenesTerry: It’s a different building.ScenesJoey: So! Stryker Remoray huh? When do you want me to start?ScenesTerry: Why don’t we start right now!ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesTerry: Here are the audition scenes. (Holds out the script.)ScenesJoey: (looking between the pages and him) Audition? I thought you were gonna offer me the part.ScenesTerry: Why would you think that?ScenesJoey: Well, I was Dr. Drake Remoray, Stryker’s twin brother. I mean, who looks more me than me right?ScenesTerry: Everybody has to audition.ScenesJoey: Y’know Terry, I-I don’t really need to do this. I got my own cable TV series, (Pause) with a robot.ScenesTerry: I’m sorry Joey that’s…that’s the way it is.ScenesJoey: Well. I guess you think you’re pretty special huh? Sittin’ up here in your fancy small hall building. Makin’ stars jump through hoops for ya, huh? Well y’know what? (Throws the script away) This is one star who’s hoop… This is a star that the hoop—this hoop—I was Dr. Drake Remoray!

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s office, she’s there as Tag knocks on the door and enters carrying a plant.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi! Tag. What are you doing here?ScenesTag: I just wanted to come by and thank you for not laughing in my face yesterday. And I noticed there aren’t any plants in your office so I wanted to bring you your first… (Notices her plant) There is a plant in your office.ScenesRachel: Kinda.ScenesTag: Right. So I guess I shouldn’t put good at noticing stuff on my resume. (Sets the plant down on her desk.)ScenesRachel: Oh-ohh, thank you.ScenesTag: Anyway, I’m guessing you hired somebody.ScenesRachel: Well…ScenesTag: Gotcha. Thanks again for meeting with me. (Starts to leave.)ScenesRachel: But I hired you!ScenesTag: What?ScenesRachel: Yeah! You-you got the job! You’re my new assistant!ScenesTag: I am?!ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesTag: I can’t believe it!ScenesRachel: Me either. Umm, all right, first thing I need you to do is go downstairs and find a women named Hilda and tell her to go home.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is setting the table for dinner as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey! Good, you’re home!ScenesChandler: Oh it’s always nicer to here than, "Aw crap! You again!ScenesMonica: Hey baby. (Kisses him.)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: I made you a surprise.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah?ScenesMonica: Yeah, tacos! Ever since you told me that story I’ve had such a craving for them.ScenesChandler: Did you not understand the story?ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! What’s up?ScenesMonica: Ross!ScenesRoss: Oh, nothin’ much. Just trying to figure out what I’m gonna do for dinner.ScenesChandler: Huh.ScenesRoss: (notices the table) Hey—Ooh! What’s-what’s that, dinner stuff? You making dinner?ScenesChandler: No! (The oven dings.) Shhh!ScenesRoss: What you got over there? Tacos?ScenesMonica: No! No. They’re umm… They’re just uh…ground beef smileys. (Holding up one of the shells.)ScenesRoss: Uhh, those are tacos.ScenesMonica: Excuse me Mr. Mexico.ScenesRoss: Eh, either way I’ll pass. (Quietly to Chandler) I still can’t eat those. (Monica is getting something out of the fridge and starts laughing.) What’s so funny?!ScenesMonica: (trying not to laugh) I’m not laughing.Scenes(Ross and Chandler move closer to her and she starts laughing again.)ScenesRoss: (To Chandler) You told her!ScenesChandler: Nancy Thompson’s getting fired! (Monica slaps him on the shoulder.)ScenesRoss: (To Monica) Look, okay-okay I had food poisoning! It’s not like I choose to do it! It’s not like—It’s not like I said, "Umm, what would make this ride more fun?!ScenesMonica: You’re right. I mean I’m sorry. Yeah, I shouldn’t be laughing. I should be laying down papers for you! (Runs off laughing which gets Chandler laughing.)ScenesRoss: (To Chandler) How could you tell her?!ScenesChandler: I had too okay?! We’re getting married! Married couples can’t keep secrets from one another!ScenesRoss: Oh really? Well I-I guess Monica should know about Atlantic City.ScenesChandler: Du-ude!ScenesMonica: (running up to Ross) What happened in Atlantic City?!ScenesRoss: Well, Chandler and I are in a bar…ScenesChandler: Did you not hear me say, "Du-ude?!ScenesRoss: And this girl is making eyes at Chandler, okay? So after awhile he-he goes over to her and uh, after a minute or two, I see them kissing. Now, I know what you’re thinking, Chandler’s not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with girls, and you’re right, Chandler’s not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with…girls.ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) You kissed a guy?!! Oh my God.ScenesChandler: In my defense, it was dark and he was a very pretty guy.ScenesRoss: Oh Mon, I laughed so hard…ScenesChandler: Ho-ho, so hard we had to throw out your underwear again?ScenesRoss: Whatever dude, you kissed a guy.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Phoebe is giving Joey a massage as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey—Ooh, how’s Hilda? Is she working out?ScenesRachel: Ohh, my new assistant is working out, yes.ScenesJoey: Was she happy you gave her the job?ScenesRachel: Oh, my-my new assistant has very happy that I hired my new assistant.Scenes(The phone rings and Joey answers it.)ScenesJoey: (on phone) Hello? (Listens) Oh hey! Can you, can you hang on a second? (To Phoebe and Rachel) It’s the producers over at Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. can you excuse me for a minute? (On phone) Hey, funny you should call. I was just looking over next week’s script. (Listens) Canceled?! (Listens) Like they’re taking it off the air? (Listens) Ohh. (Listens) All right, see you Monday. (Listens) We’re not even shootin’ them anymore?!! (Listens) All right, bye! (Hangs up) They canceled Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E!ScenesPhoebe: Sorry.ScenesRachel: I’m sorry Joey.ScenesJoey: Why would they do that?! It was a good show right?!Scenes(Phoebe and Rachel both pause, look at each other, and go press their breasts against him. Which Joey doesn’t mind, of course.)

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler, Monica, and Ross are still giving away all of their secrets.]
rows.Content: Chandler: You wanna tell secrets?! Okay! Okay! In college, Ross used to wear leg warmers!ScenesRoss: All right! All right! Chandler entered a Vanilla Ice look-a-like contest and won!ScenesChandler: Ross came in forth and cried!ScenesMonica: Oh my God! (Laughing)ScenesRoss: Oh, is that funny?! Oh, you-you find that funny?! Well maybe Chandler should know some of your secrets too!ScenesMonica: I-I already told him everything! (Threateningly) You shush!!ScenesRoss: Once Monica was sent to her room without dinner, so she ate the macaroni off a jewelry box she’d made.ScenesMonica: Ross used to stay up every Saturday night to watch Golden Girls!ScenesRoss: Monica couldn’t tell time ‘til she was 13!ScenesMonica: It’s hard for some people!ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Of course it is. (Mouths to Ross) Wow—whoa!ScenesMonica: Chandler one time wore my underwear to work!ScenesChandler: Hey!!!ScenesMonica: Ohh, I’m sorry I couldn’t think of anymore for Ross!ScenesRoss: Ohh! Ohh! In college, Chandler got drunk and slept with the lady who cleaned our dorm!ScenesChandler: That was you!ScenesRoss: Whatever dude, you kissed a guy.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is still bumming about cancellation of Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.]
rows.Content: Joey: How could this happen to me?! Yesterday I had two TV shows! Today, I got nothin’!ScenesRachel: Well wait a minute, what happened to Days of Our Lives?ScenesJoey: Uh, well they might be a little mad at me over there.ScenesPhoebe: What happened?ScenesJoey: Well maybe I got a little upset and maybe I told them where they could go.ScenesRachel: Joey, why would you do that?ScenesJoey: Because they wanted me to audition!ScenesPhoebe: You! An actor?! That’s madness!

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Outer Office, Tag is sitting at his desk as Rachel walks up. She stops and watches him pick up the phone.]
rows.Content: Tag: Rachel Green’s office. (Hangs up.)ScenesRachel: Tag? (He turns and looks at her.) Hi, who was that?ScenesTag: (shyly) Nobody. I was just practicing.ScenesRachel: Really? (Giggles.)Scenes(Phoebe rounds the corner.)ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesTag: Hi! Rachel Green’s office.ScenesPhoebe: You must be Hilda.ScenesRachel: Yeah, this is Tag. Tag, this is Phoebe. Phoebe, can I see you for a second? (Goes into office.)ScenesTag: Phoebe! That’s a great name.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you like that? You should hear my phone number.ScenesRachel: (grabbing Phoebe) Okay. We’ll be right back. (They go into her office and she closes the door.)ScenesPhoebe: So you hired yourself a little treat did ya?ScenesRachel: All right I know, I know how it looks Pheebs, but I’m telling you…ScenesPhoebe: But-but you know you cannot get involved with your assistant.ScenesRachel: Yes, I know that. I know that. And I know that hiring him was probably not the smartest thing that I’ve ever done. But I’m telling you, from this moment on I swear this is strictly professional. (There’s a knock on the door.) Yes?Scenes(Kathy enters (Because she’s listed in the credits).)ScenesKathy: Hey Rachel!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesKathy: Cute assistant! What’s his story? Is he…ScenesRachel: Gay? Yeah. (Kathy leaves dejectedly.)

rows.Scenes: Terry’s office, Joey has come to beg for a second chance.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! Terry.ScenesTerry: Joey Tribbiani! I’m surprised your big head could fit through our small halls! (Gets up) I gotta go Joey.ScenesJoey: Wait! Terry! Wait—Look—Wait I-I… Look, I’m really sorry about before. I was an idiot thinking I’m too big to audition for you. You gotta give me another chance.ScenesTerry: I can’t help you Joey.ScenesJoey: Wait! Terry! Please! Look, I just lost my other job. Okay? You have no idea how much I need this. Please, help me out, for old times sake.Scenes[Cut to a hospital room set on the Days of Our Lives stage. Two nurses are standing next to a bed with a man whose face is completely covered in bandages and reading his chart.]ScenesNurse #1: This poor guy’s been in a coma for five years. It’s hopeless.ScenesNurse #2: It’s not hopeless! Dr. Stryker Remoray’s a miracle worker. Look, here he comes.Scenes(Stryker enters, only it’s not Joey playing him.)ScenesDr. Stryker Remoray: Good morning. (He walks over to the bed, leans down, and whispers to him.) Drake, it’s your brother Stryker. Can you hear me?ScenesThe Director: And cut!ScenesJoey: (jumping up and removing the bandages) I’m back baby! Ha-ha-ha!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Ross are sitting there and not talking to each other.]
rows.Content: Monica: Y’know, in my defense, umm there was no glitter on the macaroni and very little glue.ScenesRoss: And in my defense, the cleaning lady came on to me!ScenesChandler: (To Monica) You have no trouble telling time now right?ScenesMonica: No!ScenesChandler: Quick! What time is it?! (Holds his watch in front of her face.)ScenesMonica: I don’t know! Time to kiss a guy maybe?! (Ross laughs.) What are you laughing at Pampers? (He stops laughing and glares at her.)ScenesChandler: Y’know when I said that because we’re getting married that we should share everything and not have any secrets?ScenesMonica: Yeah?ScenesChandler: Yeah that was stupid. Let’s not do that.ScenesMonica: Ohh, absolutely.ScenesRoss: And! We should keep all the stuff uh, we told each other secret from everybody else.ScenesMonica: Yeah, definitely!ScenesRoss: Okay, (gets up) if you’ll excuse me, I-I’m gonna go hang out with some people who don’t know the Space Mountain story.ScenesMonica: Then, I’d steer clear of Phoebe.ScenesRoss: Man! (Monica mouths, "I’m sorry.")ScenesChandler: Yeah, and not that you would, but I wouldn’t hang out with…all the guys in my office.Scenes(Ross storms out.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s office, she’s looking at a picture of Tag when he knocks and enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (noticing him) Hi! (Puts the pictures away.)ScenesTag: Do you have a minute?ScenesRachel: Well yeah, sure, what’s up?ScenesTag: I got asked out twice today when I was at lunch…by guys.ScenesRachel: Oh really?!ScenesTag: Yeah. Did you tell someone that I was gay?ScenesRachel: Oh, did you not want people to know that?ScenesTag: But I’m not gay. And I especially wouldn’t want you to think I was gay.ScenesRachel: Why’s that?ScenesTag: I don’t think I should say.ScenesRachel: Ohh, you can say. Come on, I don’t want you to feel like you can’t tell me things. (Motions for him to sit down.)ScenesTag: Okay.ScenesRachel: ‘Kay.ScenesTag: Well…ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesTag: I’d love to ask out your friend Phoebe.ScenesRachel: (Pause) Yeah, she’s gay.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Engagement PictureScenesTeleplay by: Patty LinScenesStory by: Earl DavisScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica and Phoebe are going through a bunch of pictures as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: What’s the matter?ScenesChandler: Someone on the subway licked my neck! Licked my neck!!ScenesPhoebe: Oh Willie’s still alive!ScenesChandler: What are you guys doing?ScenesMonica: Oh, my mom called, they’re gonna run our engagement announcement in the local paper, so we’re looking for a good picture of us.ScenesChandler: Oooh, I’m afraid that does not exist.ScenesMonica: That’s not true, there are great pictures of us!ScenesChandler: No, there are great pictures of you standing next to a guy who’s going like this… (Makes what can only be described as a toothy frown. Henceforth, this shall be known as The Face.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! That’s the creep that you’re with at the Statue of Liberty.ScenesChandler: I don’t know what it is, I just can’t take a good picture.ScenesMonica: (looking at one) Oh, here’s a great one.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’m not in that.ScenesMonica: I know, but look at me all tan.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, why don’t you guys go, get portraits done by a professional photographer.ScenesMonica: That’s a good idea! I bet they have one of those wind machines! Y’know… (Does the whole hair blowing in the wind model type poses.)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah that’s great! Next to that, Chandler won’t look so stupid.ScenesMonica: Chandler what do you say?ScenesChandler: All right, but I should warn you, I’m not going. I’m going. (Does The Face while saying that last part.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is siting on the couch as Ross and Chandler enter after playing basketball.]
rows.Content: Ross: (To Chandler) Dude, that reverse lay-up! Oh…ScenesChandler: How about those three pointers?ScenesRoss: Amazing!ScenesChandler: And those guys were this (Doing the standard "This Close" gesture) close to lettin’ us play this time too.Scenes(They both get dejected and go sit down.)ScenesRachel: Hey look-look, Phoebe’s talking to uh, Cute Coffeehouse Guy.ScenesRoss: Oh, you guys call him Cute Coffeehouse Guy, we call him Hums While He Pees.ScenesChandler: Yes, and we call Ross Lingers In The Bathroom.ScenesPhoebe: (returning) Hey you guys, Hums While He Pees just asked me out!ScenesRachel: Hey, I thought that guy was married.ScenesPhoebe: He is! But he’s getting divorced—Ross! Maybe you know him.ScenesRoss: It’s not a club.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, if this guy’s going through a divorce, is it such a good idea to start going out with him?ScenesRoss: Hey, divorced men are not bad men!ScenesChandler: They have that on the napkins at the club.ScenesRachel: Oh, I gotta get back to work.ScenesPhoebe: You don’t have to be back for a half-hour!ScenesRachel: Yeah but, my assistant Tag does sit-ups in the office during lunch. Ohh! I could just spread him on a cracker.ScenesChandler: Rach, if you have a crush on this guy, why would you hire him? I mean y’know you can’t date him right?ScenesRachel: Oh no, I know that. I know that. Although, we made a joke that we spend so much time together he should call me his work wife.ScenesRoss: Soon he’ll be able to call you, that lady he knew who got fired.ScenesRachel: I am not gonna get fired, because I’m not gonna act on it.ScenesPhoebe: So you wouldn’t mind if he was dating someone else?ScenesRachel: Why? Is he? He is! Isn’t he? He’s dating that slut in marketing!ScenesRoss: Maybe I should open a divorced men’s club.ScenesChandler: Dude that is so sad.ScenesRoss: I could put uh-uh a basketball court in the back.ScenesChandler: Could I play?

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Outer Office, she’s returning from lunch to see Tag not doing his sit-ups.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, no sit-ups today Tag?ScenesTag: I just did them.ScenesRachel: Oh, well drop and give me ten more!ScenesTag: What?ScenesRachel: Uh, I-I had a drink with lunch. Did those cost reports come in?ScenesTag: Yeah, I filled them out last night?ScenesRachel: Oh, great could you make me four copies of those?Scenes(He gets up to make the copies leaving Rachel alone with his stuff. She notices his sweater in his backpack and holds it up to her nose as Melissa, a coworker, walks up.)ScenesMelissa: Hey Rachel!ScenesRachel: (startled) Ahh, hi! Hi! Melissa, what’s up? I’m just uh, about to umm, go out to the store to get some stuff to put in my backpack. Y’know, like dried fruit and granola and stuff. What’s up? (She has put on the backpack.)ScenesMelissa: Umm, is Tag here?ScenesRachel: No. Why?ScenesMelissa: Oh, I was gonna talk to him about doing something tonight.ScenesRachel: Really?! Got a little crush on Tag there do ya?ScenesMelissa: Well, we’ve been flirting back and forth, but I was hoping that tonight it would turn into something a little more than that.ScenesRachel: Okay, whoa-whoa easy there Melissa! This ain’t a locker room, okay? But, y’know I remember him saying that-that he had plans tonight.ScenesMelissa: Oh no!ScenesRachel: Oh yeah. All right, back to work.ScenesMelissa: Hey!
