Isn’t that Tag’s backpack.ScenesRachel: Yeah Melissa, I don’t want to be known as the uh, office bitch, but I will call your supervisor.Scenes(Melissa beats a hasty retreat.)

rows.Scenes: A Portrait Studio, Chandler and Monica are trying to take their engagement picture. Monica has a beautiful smile, while Chandler isn’t.]
rows.Content: The Photographer: (taking pictures) Great! That’s great Monica! Great! Now, Chandler, you want to give us a smile?ScenesChandler: Okay. (Does The Face.)ScenesThe Photographer: I’m sorry, is the seat uncomfortable?ScenesChandler: No, I am.ScenesMonica: Chandler, listen to me sweetie, I know you can do this. Okay? You have a beautiful smile.ScenesChandler: I do? (He smiles, beautifully.)ScenesMonica: Yeah! (They turn to the camera, and Chandler does The Face again.) All right, maybe you don’t have to smile. Let’s try something else. Let’s try umm, try looking sexy.ScenesChandler: Okay. (You’ll have to see it, I can’t describe the face he makes, but it isn’t good.)ScenesMonica: Or not.

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Office, Joey is knocking on the door holding a hand over a spot on his shirt.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi Joey! What are you doing here?ScenesJoey: Uhh, well I’ve got an audition down the street and I spilled sauce all over the front of my shirt. (Removes his hand to reveal a huge sauce stain.) You got an extra one?ScenesRachel: Yeah, sure. Umm…here. (Hands him one.)ScenesJoey: Great. (He doesn’t like it.) You got anything that’s not Ralph Lauren?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I don’t think so Joe.ScenesJoey: All right, I guess this will be fine.ScenesRachel: Hey, listen umm, what-what are you doing tonight?ScenesJoey: Nothing, why?ScenesRachel: How would you feel about taking out my assistant Tag? I’ll pay.ScenesJoey: Huh, Rach I got to say it’s gonna take a lot of money for me to go out on a date with a dude.ScenesRachel: I’m not asking you to go on a date with him!ScenesJoey: Really? ‘Cause I could kinda use the money.ScenesRachel: Joey, just-just he-he’s new in town and I know he doesn’t have any guy friends. Just take him to like a ball game or something. I’ll really appreciate it.ScenesJoey: Yeah, okay.ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesJoey: Sure, no problem. (Sees something.) Ooh—Hey, donuts!ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesJoey: Okay. (He grabs a jelly donut, takes a bite, and guess what he spills all over himself. He tries to clean it up and smears it all over the shirt.)

rows.Scenes: A Portrait Studio, Chandler and Monica are still trying to get the picture taken.]
rows.Content: Monica: I know. Let’s try a look…of far off…wonderment. Okay, we’ll-we’ll gaze into our future and we’ll think about our marriage and the days to come. (Chandler is still not getting it.) Chandler! What is the matter with your face?! I mean this picture is supposed to say "Geller and Bing to be married," not "Local woman saves drowning moron!" (The photographer laughs.) Hey! Don’t laugh at him! He’s my drowning moron!ScenesChandler: Aww! (Smiles.)ScenesMonica: That’s it! Take it! Take it! Take it!Scenes(Chandler turns to the camera and does The Face.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Ross are going over the picture proofs.]
rows.Content: Ross: I like this one. (Points to it.) It seems to say, "I love you and that’s why I have to kill you.ScenesMonica: They can’t all be bad. (To Chandler) Find the one where you make your bedroom eyes. Ohh, there it is.ScenesChandler: Oh my God! Those are my bedroom eyes?! Why did you ever sleep with me?ScenesMonica: Do you really want to pull at that thread?Scenes(Phoebe enters with Hums While He Pees also known as Kyle.)ScenesPhoebe: I’m having a really good time!ScenesHums While He Pees: Me too! I’m sorry that guy in the subway licked your neck.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh. No that’s okay, he’s a friend.ScenesHums While He Pees: Hey uh, I don’t mean to be presumptuous but I have these two tickets to the ballroom dancing finals tomorrow night if you want to go?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I… Well y’know I-I mean I missed the-the semi-finals, so I’d just be lost.ScenesHums While He Pees: I know it’s really lame, but I got these tickets from my boss and—Oh no! No! No! My God!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, don’t freak out. I’ll go.ScenesHums While He Pees: No it’s… Uh, my ex-wife Whitney is out there. I cannot deal with her right now. That woman is crazy!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I know. Hold on. (She walks over to the couch.) Hey Ross?ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, umm that’s Whitney (Points), Kyle’s ex-wife out there, now do you think that you can y’know divert her so that we can slip out?ScenesRoss: What?! No!ScenesPhoebe: Well okay but I have two tickets to the ballroom dance finals. (She holds up the tickets that Kyle gave her.)ScenesRoss: Look, I don’t think so Pheebs. (Pause) All right, I’ll do it. But just because you’re a friend. (Grabs the tickets and heads to divert Whitney.)

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross is dancing around his living room as Phoebe enters, catching and startling him.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hi Ginger.ScenesRoss: All right! I want my key back!ScenesPhoebe: I don’t have it!ScenesRoss: It’s right there! (Points to her hand.)ScenesPhoebe: Ugh, okay Sherlock! (Hands over the key.)ScenesRoss: Look, I’m sorry but you-you-you better go Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: All right, well I just wanted to say thank you though for diverting Kyle’s ex.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah—No—You’re welcome. We’ll talk about it later.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.Scenes(Ross opens the door to reveal Whitney standing there.)ScenesRoss: Hi Whitney.ScenesWhitney: Hi Ross! You ready for breakfast?ScenesRoss: Yep. (Phoebe slams the door shut.) Okay.ScenesPhoebe: (To Ross) Kyle’s ex-wife? You were supposed to divert her not date her!ScenesRoss: (opens the door and to Whitney) Hi! I’m sorry, but can you give me a second while I talk to this woman, who by the way did not spend the night.ScenesWhitney: Sure.ScenesRoss: Okay. (Closes the door.) (To Phoebe) I did divert her and we ended up having a great time! Okay?ScenesPhoebe: Watching ballroom dancing?ScenesRoss: Yes! That’s where we realized we were both super cool people!ScenesPhoebe: Well look-look, okay Ross, Kyle just told me some really bad stuff about her.ScenesRoss: Like what?ScenesPhoebe: Like she’s really mean, and she’s over critical, and-and—No! She will paint a room a really bright color without even checking with you!ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: And! She uses sex as a weapon!ScenesRoss: Fine! Thank you for warning me. At breakfast I’ll be on full alert for room painting and sex weapons.ScenesPhoebe: You’re still gonna go out with her?!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Well, didn’t you just hear what I said?!ScenesRoss: Pheebs come on! I mean, consider the source! Of course her ex-husband’s gonna say that stuff. Now, if you’ll excuse me…ScenesPhoebe: (interrupting him) No listen to me! She is crazy!ScenesWhitney: (outside the door) Uh, your door isn’t sound proof.ScenesPhoebe: You see? Nothing is good enough for her!

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Office, Tag is arriving as Rachel is standing there.]
rows.Content: Tag: Good morning.ScenesRachel: Hi Tag! Hey, so did you have fun with uh, with Joey last night?ScenesTag: Oh yeah! We went to the Knicks game.ScenesRachel: Ohh that’s nice.ScenesTag: Then we went to this bar and he hooked us up with all these women!ScenesRachel: Wo-women? You mean like old women?ScenesTag: Well kinda old, like 30.ScenesRachel: (Pause) Oh.ScenesTag: And I never used to be able to just talk to girls in bars, but I got like 20 phone numbers last night.ScenesRachel: That’s great! Wow man, so Joey must’ve really taught you some stuff huh?ScenesTag: A little.ScenesRachel: Yeah?Scenes(A beautiful women walks up.)ScenesTag: (To her, in the Joey voice) How you doin’?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is teaching Chandler how to smile. Chandler is smiling.]
rows.Content: Joey: See? That’s a great smile! Easy. Natural. Now, pretend I have a camera. (Chandler immediately does The Face.) You’re changing it!ScenesChandler: I can’t help it!ScenesJoey: All right, all right, all right, all right, you wanna know what I do when I take resume shots?ScenesChandler: Borrow money from me?ScenesJoey: Okay, first—first of all, you want to make it look spontaneous. I look down (Looks down), look down, keep looking down; then I look up. (Looks up and smiles.) See? All right, now you try. Look down (Chandler looks down), you’re looking down, keep looking down…ScenesChandler: Why is there jelly on your shoe?ScenesJoey: I had a donut. (Chandler nods.)ScenesRachel: (entering) Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRachel: So uh, heard you had some fun with Tag last night.ScenesJoey: Yeah! That guy’s all right!ScenesRachel: Yeah and you had fun teaching him how to be all Joey.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRachel: Y’know, all the women.ScenesJoey: Hey well, you can’t teach someone to be good with women. Y’know, that’s why I never had any luck with Chandler.ScenesChandler: (Pause) I’m right here!ScenesRachel: All right, would-would you mind just not going out with him again? Okay, just the idea of you and he and all these women, it’s just—And I know he’s my assistant and I can’t date him—but it just bothers me, all right?!ScenesJoey: Hey! No-no-no-no, you can’t take him away from me! I got a great partner to pick up girls with! Finally!!ScenesChandler: I’m still right here!ScenesRachel: All right, will you, will you at least tell him how hollow and unsatisfying this, dating tons of women thing is!ScenesJoey: (shocked) What?!ScenesRachel: I just don’t want him to meet anybody until I am over my crush—And I will get over it. It’s-it’s not like I love him, it’s just physical! But—I mean I get crushes like this all the time! I mean hell, I had a crush on you when I first met ya!ScenesJoey: I know, Monica told me.ScenesChandler: Did you have a crush on me, when you first met me?ScenesRachel: Yeah. Sure. (Joey nods his head questioningly and Rachel nods no.)ScenesChandler: Can you people not see me?! (He waves his arms around to get their attention.)ScenesRachel: (To Joey) So, will you talk to him?ScenesJoey: I don’t know Rach.ScenesRachel: Oh, come on! I’ll give you ten free Ralph Lauren shirts.ScenesJoey: One! (Pause.) No ten! You said ten! You can’t take that back!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is there as Tag enters carrying a bag.]
rows.Content: Tag: Hey Joey, you wanted to talk to me?ScenesJoey: I don’t know. You uh, you got something for me?ScenesTag: Oh, yeah, this is from Rachel.Scenes(He hands Joey the bag and he quickly counts its contents.)ScenesJoey: Ten. Okay. Now Tag there’s such a thing as to many women.ScenesTag: Really?ScenesJoey: Yeah, for you!

rows.Scenes: The Portrait Studio, Monica is waiting for Chandler to make another attempt at taking a good picture.]
rows.Content: Monica: (seeing him approach) Hey! There you are!ScenesChandler: There I am!ScenesMonica: Are you okay?ScenesChandler: Yeah, Joey said I uh, I needed to relax so he gave me an antihistamine.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesChandler: Yeah, and then I fell asleep on the subway and went all the way to Brooklyn. Brooklyn is f-far!!ScenesMonica: Chandler, what were you thinking?ScenesChandler: I don’t know, but don’t worry, don’t worry, because I know how to take a picture now. (They get ready) Okay, see? Look down (Looks down), look down, look down… (He falls asleep.)ScenesMonica: Chandler?ScenesChandler: (awakens) Yeah! (Looks up and does The Face.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hi.ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesPhoebe: So, how are things going with crazy? Has she cooked your rabbit yet?ScenesRoss: Listen, you are hearing one side of the story, okay—and F.Y.I she must’ve shown Kyle over 30 paint samples before she painted that room! And his response to each one was, "I don’t give a tiny rat’s ass.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah well, maybe she should’ve spent a little less time decorating and a little more time in the bedroom.ScenesRoss: Well, I don’t think we are gonna have that problem, but maybe that’s just because I am not emotionally unavailable!ScenesPhoebe: You think he’s emotionally unavailable?ScenesRoss: I think he can be.ScenesPhoebe: Well, maybe he wouldn’t be she didn’t bring the office home every night!ScenesRoss: Well, excuse her for knowing what she wants to do with her life!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah well, she certainly knew what she was doing New Year’s Eve 1997.ScenesRoss: (angrily) I knew you were gonna throw that in my face!! That was three years ago! She apologized and she apologized! What more do you want?!!ScenesPhoebe: (gets up and starts to leave) We want the last six years back!!ScenesRoss: So do we!! So do we!! (Ross notices a couple has been staring at them.) I’m sorry you had to see that.

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Office, Tag is entering.]
rows.Content: Tag: Good morning Rachel.ScenesRachel: Hi! (He hands her, her mail) Thanks, hey so uh what’d you do last night?ScenesTag: Went out with Joey.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah? Another night of birdogging the chickas?ScenesTag: No. We had a really good talk. I don’t think I’m gonna do that bar scene anymore.ScenesRachel: Wow! I did not see that coming.ScenesTag: It’s just not really who I am. Y'know, I’ve always been happier when…Why am I telling you this? You don’t care about this stuff.ScenesRachel: Oh no, yes I do! I do! I mean, come on go on, you were, you were saying I am happier when uh, y’know?ScenesTag: When I’m in a relationship, I love having a girlfriend.ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesTag: Someone I can spoil, y’know?ScenesRachel: Sp-spoil?ScenesTag: Uh-huh! Let me ask you something?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesTag: Do you believe that there is one perfect person for everyone?ScenesRachel: Well, I-I’m startin’ too.ScenesTag: And if that person is already in your life, you should do something about it right?ScenesRachel: Yes! Hell yes!ScenesTag: All right then, it’s settled.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesTag: I’m gettin’ back together with my ex-girlfriend.ScenesRachel: I’d love to!ScenesTag: What?ScenesRachel: (panics, turns around, picks up the phone, and pretend to talk on it) Hello?! (Listens) Oh, yeah! (To Tag) This is gonna be a while. Excuse me. (Tag leaves and she closes the door behind him, disgustedly.) Yeah!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Phoebe are there again, only now they’re not talking to each other. Phoebe is loudly stirring her coffee.]
rows.Content: Ross: My God!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I’m sorry. Is that annoying? And speaking about being selfish in bed, how’s Whitney?ScenesRoss: Well maybe she wouldn’t have to be selfish in bed if someone else knew where everything was!ScenesPhoebe: Oh he knows! (Quietly) For the most part.Scenes(Kyle and Whitney enter.)ScenesKyle: Oh hey! Good, you’re both here.ScenesWhitney: We kinda need to talk.ScenesPhoebe: Both of you together?ScenesRoss: Wh-what’s up?ScenesWhitney: Well, I went over to Kyle’s last night to pick up a few things and we got to reminiscing…ScenesKyle: …we talked through most of the night and we realized that the reason we were so angry at each other was because there are still feelings there. So… (Pause)ScenesRoss: Oh just say it Kyle!ScenesKyle: We’re gonna give it another try.ScenesPhoebe: What about her whining and her constant need for attention?!ScenesWhitney: I’m gonna work on that.ScenesPhoebe: Oh right, because you’re so capable of change.ScenesRoss: (To Whitney) Y’know, he hums when he pees!ScenesWhitney: I do know.ScenesRoss: It makes him miss the bowl, but whatever.ScenesWhitney: We’re so sorry. (They get up to leave.)ScenesRoss: That’s all right, we-we don’t need you. In fact, hey I’m over it already.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, and y’know what? I don’t give a tiny rat’s ass.ScenesKyle: Yeah, we’re gonna go. (They leave.)ScenesRoss: (To Phoebe) I’m sorry. Ugh, Pheebs, you were, you were right about her. Y’know, she did try to use sex as a weapon! Yeah, I hurt my back a little.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. Y’know, he hums while he does other stuff to.ScenesRoss: Yeah, were better off without them.ScenesPhoebe: And y’know, even if they break up again, you’d better not let him in your sad men’s club!ScenesRoss: Divorced men’s club.ScenesPhoebe: Potato, Potaato. (She’s pronounces potato with the both the short and long As.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey are there as Monica enters with the local paper that has the engagement picture in it.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey guys check it out! My mom sent me the paper!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, let’s see it!ScenesChandler: Ahhh.ScenesMonica: Okay. (She opens it up and shows it to them.)ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, that looks good.ScenesPhoebe: You guys make a very attractive couple. (The camera cuts to a shot of the picture and we see that Monica is posing with Joey instead of Chandler.)ScenesJoey: Yeah, we look great together.ScenesMonica: Yeah, we really do!ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: Wow! Imagine what our kids would look like!ScenesJoey: Y’know, we don’t have to imagine.ScenesChandler: I’m marrying her.ScenesJoey: We’ll just see.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Nap PartnersScenesWritten by: Brian Buckner & Sebastian JonesScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, Phoebe, Rachel, and Monica are having brunch.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, the reason why I asked you guys out to brunch today is because I have been doing some thinking about who should be my maid of honor.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! This is it! (She and Phoebe hold hands.) (To Phoebe) I really hope it’s you!ScenesPhoebe: I hope it’s you.ScenesRachel: Me too!ScenesMonica: First of all um, I love you both so much and you’re both so important to me…ScenesRachel: Okay, bla-bla-bla-bla!! Who is it?!ScenesMonica: Well umm, I was thinking that maybe we could come up with a system where we trade of being maid of honor for each other. Like hypothetically, if Phoebe were mine…ScenesPhoebe: Yes!!! Oh!!ScenesRachel: Hypothetically!ScenesPhoebe: Still.ScenesMonica: If Phoebe were my maid of honor…ScenesRachel: Uh-hmm.ScenesMonica: Rachel would be Phoebe’s, I would be Rachel’s, that way we all get to do it once and no one would get upset.ScenesRachel: Yeah that’s actually a pretty good idea.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I’ll do that. So who gets to be yours?ScenesMonica: (laughs) Well that’s the best part. Umm, you guys get to decide!ScenesPhoebe: Wh-why is that the best part?ScenesMonica: Because then I don’t have to!ScenesRachel: Well of course we will help you decide! We will do anything we can to help you! Now, I would like to make a toast, to the future Mrs. Chandler Bing (A woman at the table behind them overhears Chandler’s name and starts listening closer), my best friend, and truly one of the nicest people that…ScenesMonica: I’m really not deciding!ScenesRachel: Fine!Scenes(The woman gets up and walks over to their table.)ScenesWoman: Excuse me, I-I couldn’t help overhearing, you’re marrying Chandler Bing?ScenesMonica: Yeah that’s right.ScenesWoman: (sarcastically) Huh, good luck!ScenesPhoebe: Aww, and good luck to you too! (To Monica and Rachel) What a nice lady!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are finishing watching Die Hard on video.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Die Hard still great!ScenesJoey: Yep. Hey, what do you say we make it a double feature?ScenesChandler: What’d you rent?ScenesJoey: Die Hard 2.ScenesChandler: (looking at the tape) Joey, this is Die Hard 1 again.ScenesJoey: Oh, well we watch it a second time and its Die Hard 2!ScenesRoss: Joey, we just saw it!ScenesJoey: And?ScenesRoss: And it’ll be cool to see it again! Yeah!ScenesJoey and Ross: Die Hard!!!!!!ScenesRoss: Dude, you didn’t say Die Hard. Is everything okay?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I just got uh, got plans.ScenesRoss: Well, John McLane had plans!ScenesChandler: No, see the thing is I want to get out of here before Joey gets all worked up and starts calling everybody bitch.ScenesJoey: What are you talking about? Bitch.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is bringing Rachel some coffee.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, when I get married will you be my maid of honor?ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesPhoebe: Uh-hmm.ScenesRachel: Oh my God Phoebe! I mean I’m just—Wait a minute. If I’m your maid of honor that means you are Monica’s.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Well, if that’s what you want…ScenesRachel: Ohh! No way Phoebe! I want to be Monica’s!ScenesPhoebe: But why does it even matter?!ScenesRachel: Why does it matter so much to you?!ScenesPhoebe: Because this one is now! And-and it’s two of our best friends! Who knows what you’re gonna marry!ScenesRachel: What-what if I marry Ross—Or Joey?ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) You wouldn’t! Okay look, Rachel I know you really want to do this, but I-I’ve never been maid of honor to anyone before! And I know you’ve done it at least twice!ScenesRachel: Yeah but Phoebe…ScenesPhoebe: And no, oh please, oh please let me finish. (Rachel stops talking.) Oh I guess that was it.ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay. It’s—since you’ve never done it before you can be Monica’s made of honor.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, thank you so much! (They hug.) Okay.ScenesRachel: I’m gonna marry someone good y’know.ScenesPhoebe: Oh I know.ScenesRachel: Better than Chandler. (Phoebe exhales as if to say, "Like what isn’t?")

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Die Hard has ended, only I don’t think Joey and Ross know that yet. As you see, they are both asleep. And they’re on the same couch. Which means they’re sleeping together. Not like Joey is at one end and Ross is on the other, they both happen to be lying down and sleeping together. Well, there hasn’t been any clothes removed so not that kind of sleeping together. Not that there’s anything wrong with that. That is unless you’re a Republican in which that kind of thing will bring about the downfall of Western society, especially if they should happen to want to get married. Anyway, let me recap. No, there is too much, let me sum up. Ross and Joey are taking a nap together on top of each other and both wake-up at the same time, realize what they just did, scream, and jump up.]
rows.Content: Ross: What happened?!!ScenesJoey: Well, I don’t know!!ScenesRoss: We fell asleep! That is all.ScenesJoey: Yeah. Yep. Yeah. All right, well uh, I’d better go.ScenesRoss: I think that would be best.ScenesJoey: Yeah. All right, I’ll talk to you later.ScenesRoss: Okay. But not about this!ScenesJoey: No! Never! Never! (Pause, then Joey wants to shake Ross’s hand.) Bye.ScenesRoss: No touch! No touch!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica has just gotten back from brunch and is telling Chandler about it.]
rows.Content: Monica: Yeah hey, a weird thing happened today whey I was at brunch. This woman overheard that I was marrying you and-and then she…she wished me good luck.ScenesChandler: That’s sweet.ScenesMonica: No, it’s more like a (sarcastically) good luck.ScenesChandler: So uh, what did this woman look like?ScenesMonica: She was like 30, dark hair, attractive.ScenesChandler: Well, is there any chance you were looking into a bright, shiny thing called a mirror?ScenesMonica: Come on, was it somebody maybe you dated in college?ScenesChandler: No, no I only dated two girls in college, both blonde, both not attractive… (Thinks a little while.) Hold on one second; let me check this out. (He gets up and grabs a photo album.ScenesMonica: What are you doing?ScenesChandler: Well, let’s see… (Finding the picture he wants.) Okay uh, is that her? (Pointing to the picture.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God yes! Who is she?ScenesChandler: Julie Grath, my camp girlfriend.ScenesMonica: Did you break up with her?ScenesChandler: (pause) No, we’re still together. Yeah we went out for two summers, and then I broke up with her.ScenesMonica: Why?ScenesChandler: Well, ‘cause she came back the third summer and she’d gotten really fa-aa-aw-ow…ScenesMonica: Fat?!ScenesChandler: I did not say fat! I said, "Fa-aa-aw-ow…ScenesMonica: You broke up with a girl because she was fat?!ScenesChandler: Yeah. Yeah, but it was a really, really long time ago! Does she still feel bad?ScenesMonica: Well, apparently she does.ScenesChandler: Well, you know what they say, elephants never forget. (Monica is not amused by that statement.) Seriously, good luck marrying me.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is entering, Rachel and Phoebe are already there.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! What’s going on?ScenesRachel: Phoebe is gonna be Monica’s maid of honor!ScenesJoey: Hey! Well I hope it goes better than the last time you did it for that girl downstairs, remember? (Phoebe glares at him.)ScenesRachel: (shocked) You have been maid of honor before?!!ScenesPhoebe: See? This is exactly why you shouldn’t lie!ScenesRachel: All right that’s it! I am maid of honor!ScenesPhoebe: Na-uh, I am!ScenesRachel: How come you are?!ScenesPhoebe: Because I cared enough to lie!ScenesJoey: Hey-hey-hey-hey, I can help you decide who should do it! Yeah, we could have like uh, like an audition and see how you’d handle maid of honor type situations.ScenesPhoebe: What are you talking about?ScenesJoey: Like when I want a job, I go to an audition and if I’m the best of the people they see, they give me the part.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so after this audition, who decides who gets it?ScenesJoey: Oh uh, me and Ross can be the judges.ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel) Well, it’s better than us deciding.ScenesRachel: Oh, come on! This is crazy! Can’t we just flip a coin?!ScenesPhoebe: No! Coins hate me!ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay fine, y’know what? We will let Ross and Joey decide. (Ross enters.) (In a sexy voice.) Hiiiii, Ross! Sweetie.ScenesPhoebe: Hey there, you handsome thing. (Rachel and Phoebe exit.)ScenesRoss: Wow, this cologne really is every bit as good as Georgio.ScenesJoey: Hi.ScenesRoss: Just uh, brought back your videos.ScenesJoey: Uh hey look uh Ross, look I think we need to talk about before.ScenesRoss: No! No we don’t!ScenesJoey: Yes we do! Now look, that was the best nap I ever had!!ScenesRoss: I… I don’t know what you are talking about.ScenesJoey: Come on! Admit it! That was the best nap you ever had!ScenesRoss: I’ve had better.ScenesJoey: Okay! When?!ScenesRoss: All right! All right! It was the best nap ever!ScenesJoey: Uh-huh!ScenesRoss: I’ve said it! Okay?! But it’s over Joey!ScenesJoey: I want to do it again.ScenesRoss: We can’t do it again.ScenesJoey: Why not?ScenesRoss: Because it’s weird!ScenesJoey: Fine! Do you want something to drink?ScenesRoss: Sure, what do you got?ScenesJoey: Warm milk and Excedrin P.M. (Ross just leaves.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is approaching the bathroom door behind which Chandler is using the facility.]
rows.Content: Monica: Chandler! (Knocks on the door.) Chandler! I just figured out who you are!ScenesChandler: Can you figure out what I’m doing?ScenesMonica: You’re Lewis Posin.ScenesChandler: Who?ScenesMonica: Lewis Posin! He was my best friend in fifth grade, and-and then one day I asked him to be my boyfriend and he said no. Do you know why?ScenesChandler: Because you kept talking to him while he was trying to go to the bathroom?!ScenesMonica: No! But because he thought I was to faaaaa…. (Chandler emerges, without flushing by the way.) And every time I think about it, it makes me feel as bad as I did in fifth grade! Y’know, I-I really think that you should apologize to Julie.ScenesChandler: What? Are you kidding? That was like 16 years ago.ScenesMonica: No, I know. But y’know what? It would make me feel better if Lewis apologized to me.ScenesChandler: Okay, I will do it. But I have to warn you; this may make me a better person and that is not the man you feel in love with!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Ross are laying out the ground rules for the maid of honor auditions to Rachel and Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, all right, this is how it’s going to work. We’re gonna give you hypothetical maid of honor situations and you will be scored on a scale of 1 to 10, 1 being the highest.ScenesRoss: No, 10 is the highest.ScenesJoey: Why is 10 the highest?ScenesRoss: Because it’s the highest. (Joey shrugs his shoulders) Okay, Rachel you’re up first. (Rachel stands up and gets ready.) Situation No. 1: You’re with Monica, the wedding is about to start when Monica gets cold feet. Go! (Joey is playing the part of Monica.)ScenesJoey: (crying) I don’t want to marry Chandler!ScenesRachel: Okay, uh…ScenesJoey: I’ve got cold feet.ScenesRachel: …it’s gonna be okay!ScenesJoey: No, one man for the rest of my life? I don’t know if I can do it! This means I’ll never get to sleep with Joey!ScenesRachel: Look Monica, getting cold feet is very common. Y’know, it’s-it’s just because of all the anticipation and you just have to remember that you love Chandler. And also, I ran out on a wedding. You don’t get to keep the gifts.ScenesJoey: (out of his Monica character) Very good! Drawing on your own experience, I like that!ScenesRachel: Thanks!ScenesRoss: Yes, very nice Rachel.ScenesRachel: Thank you judges.ScenesPhoebe: Ugh, what a kiss ass.ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesJoey: Okay, Phoebe…ScenesPhoebe: Yes! Your honor?ScenesJoey: We’re now in the ceremony, Monica is about to say, "I do" when her drunk uncle starts yelling. What do you do? Go!ScenesRoss: (playing the drunk uncle) When Monica was a little girl, I remember that—(Phoebe screams and tackles him)—Ooh!! Ow! Very good!ScenesPhoebe: Oh!ScenesJoey: Yes! Excellent! Perfect score!ScenesRachel: Wait a minute! She just made a scene in the middle of the ceremony!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Do you want do you want a little taste of Pheebs?!ScenesRoss: It is time for you to give your maid of honor speech.ScenesRachel: Ohh, wait a minute, we haven’t pre…ScenesRoss: Go!ScenesRachel: Okay! Okay! Umm, Webster’s Dictionary defines marriage as… (Ross and Joey start writing.) Okay!! Forget that! That sucks!! Okay, never mind! Forget it! Umm, umm, okay, uh… I met, I-I met, I met Monica when we were just a couple of six year olds and I became friends with Chandler when he was 25, although he seemed like a six year old.ScenesRoss and Joey: Oh! That’s nice.ScenesRachel: Thank you. Thank you very much. Umm, I’ve known them separately and I’ve known them together and-and to know them as a couple is to know that you are truly in the presence of love. So I would like to raise my glass (Grabs a glass and holds it up) to Monica and Chandler and the beautiful adventure they are about to embark upon together. I can think of no two people better prepared for the journey.ScenesJoey: Wow. (To Ross) Good speech.ScenesRoss: Yeah, it really was!ScenesRachel: Aw, thanks!ScenesRoss: Okay Phoebe, I guess you’re next (To Joey) although I really don’t see the point.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I can’t believe that Monica and Chandler are getting married. I remember talking about this day with Rachel while we were showering together, naked. (Raises her glass and drinks.)Scenes(Joey and Ross pause while they picture the event.)ScenesJoey: And she’s back in the game.

rows.Scenes: A random apartment building, Chandler and Monica are knocking on the door of the woman from the beginning.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (she opens the door) Julie hi! Chandler Bing, I, I guess you remember me.ScenesJulie: Hello Skidmark.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) It’s a nickname, I’ll explain later.ScenesMonica: It’s pretty clear.ScenesChandler: Ah, uh, I owe you a long overdue apology. I never should have broken up with you because you were overweight.ScenesJulie: That’s why you broke up with me?ScenesChandler: You-you-you didn’t know that. (Pause as she nods no.) Well, I guess my work here is done!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Ross are giving Phoebe and Rachel the results of their election. Somewhat faster than Florida I might add.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right, well first of all I would like to say that you both performed very well. Okay? You should be proud of yourselves. And-and I would also like to say that in this competition there are no losers. Well, except for Rachel—Damnit!ScenesPhoebe: Really?! I won!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry Rach, it was, it was really close.ScenesRachel: Well then I demand a recount! (Hmm, I wonder where I’ve heard that before.)ScenesRoss: Actually, it wasn’t that close.ScenesRachel: No! Y’know what? No! No! You thing was so stupid anyway, this was ridiculous—We’re gonna flip a coin! (Phoebe gasps.) All right?! (She flips the coin.) Heads! (Looks at the coin and grunts in disgust.)ScenesPhoebe: The coins have finally forgiven me!ScenesRachel: Well y’know what? I hope Monica forgives you after you throw her, her vegetarian, voodoo, goddess circley shower! (Runs out.)ScenesPhoebe: (running after her) Rach, it’s gonna be okay! (To Ross and Joey) You guys are the best!ScenesJoey: Boy I tell ya, that judging stuff took a lot out of me.ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesJoey: Yeah! I was thinking about maybe going upstairs and taking a little nap on my couch. (Raises his eyebrows, questioning Ross to see if he wants to join him.)ScenesRoss: Why-why would I care about that?ScenesJoey: No reason, I’m just saying that uh… That’s where I’ll be.Scenes(Joey gets up and heads for the door. After a pause Ross decides to join him.)

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler and Monica have returned from Julie’s.]
rows.Content: Chandler: As bad as that went I actually enjoyed myself. I think that I’m going to apologize for all of the stupid things I do.ScenesMonica: Why don’t you just stop doing stupid things? Then you wouldn’t have to apologize.ScenesChandler: I would really love it if could do both.ScenesMonica: All right, I…I have to ask.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: Are you gonna break up with me if I get fat again?ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesMonica: Well, you broke up with Julie Grath! How much weight could she have gained?ScenesChandler: A hundred and forty-five pounds.ScenesMonica: In one year?! My God what did she eat? Her-her family! That’s not the point.ScenesChandler: Look I know it was a stupid reason to break up with somebody, but I was 15!ScenesMonica: Well… That’s not the only time this was an issue. You remember when umm, you spent Thanksgiving with us? You called me fat.ScenesChandler: Okay. Okay, now wait a minute that was totally different.ScenesMonica: How?ScenesChandler: You were not supposed to hear that! I said that behind you back!ScenesMonica: What if I have babies, okay? I mean I’m gonna look different. I’m okay with that, but I’m not sure that you are!ScenesChandler: Look you have to realize I don’t think of you as a thin, beautiful woman. (Monica glares at him.) See this is one of things that I can apologize for later! Look, what I mean is you’re Monica! Okay? And I am in love with Monica.ScenesMonica: Keep going.ScenesChandler: So you can balloon up or you can shrink down and I will still love you.ScenesMonica: Even if I shrink down to two inches tall?ScenesChandler: I’d carry you around in my pocket.ScenesMonica: I love you. (They hug and kiss.)ScenesChandler: Skidmark’s still got a way with the ladies.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Rachel enters carrying a shopping bag.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi! I just want to apologize. I’m really sorry I was a baby.ScenesPhoebe: That’s ridiculous Rachel, we were all babies once. (Rachel looks at her.) Oh, you mean today.ScenesRachel: Yeah. Yeah, and y’know you-you deserve to win. And-and y’know I was thinking about it, if-if you’re Monica’s maid of honor that means I get to be yours.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah!ScenesRachel: Yeah! Oh, umm when-when Monica and Chandler got engaged I started putting some stuff together, y’know just in case…ScenesPhoebe: Oh that’s so sweet thanks.ScenesRachel: Here is a book of poetry that I know Monica loves. And-and ohh God this is funny, look, this is a picture of one Halloween where she dressed up as a bride. (Shows Phoebe the picture.) And look, she made me carry her train, which was weird because I was Wonder Woman. Oh and here’s a little purse that I found. (Hands her the purse) Y’know I just thought that maybe they could hold the rings in there.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh.ScenesRachel: And umm, vintage handkerchiefs y’know ‘cause, people cry at weddings. (Starting to cry.) I’m just gonna grab a couple of these.ScenesPhoebe: This stuff is great!ScenesRachel: Oh, I forgot this was in here. Umm, this was the uh garter that I was saving for my wedding and I wanted it to be Monica’s something borrowed and it’s blue. (Starts to cry again.) Yeah…ScenesPhoebe: Y’know Rach, I think that, I think you should be Monica’s made of honor.ScenesRachel: You do? Why?ScenesPhoebe: Because I think it means more to you.ScenesRachel: But Pheebs, y’know you earned it.ScenesPhoebe: Its fine. I mean, this is something that you’ve been thinking about since you were what, 14? (She’s referring to the Halloween picture.)ScenesRachel: No, I was ten. I just developed early.ScenesPhoebe: (looking at the picture again) Man alive!ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey, what’s going on?ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Well, we just decided that Rachel is gonna be your maid of honor.ScenesMonica: (gasps) Ohh, wow! That’s great! (Rachel and Monica hug.) Oh wow! We really have to start planning! I have, I have a lot of really specific ideas! We should probably get together like four times per week. You can come over to my place; we’ll get together before work! What do you say, 6:30, my place? I’m so excited! (Runs out leaving Rachel completely stunned and Phoebe laughing.)ScenesRachel: Yeah okay, you laugh now, but she’s gonna be yours. (Phoebe gets suddenly scared.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Ross are napping together again and both wake up at the same time.]
rows.Content: Joey: Great nap.ScenesRoss: It really was.Scenes(Suddenly Rachel clears her throat and the camera cuts to the rest of the gang staring at them. Needless to say Joey and Ross are shocked and slowly turn their heads to see the gang.)ScenesJoey: (reacting first by jumping up) Dude! What the hell are you doing?! God! (Heads for his room leaving Ross.)ScenesRoss: (slowly stands up and says quietly) Excuse me. (Exits.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With Ross’s BookScenesWritten by: Scott SilveriScenesDirected by: David SchwimmerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is eating breakfast as Rachel enters having just woken up.]
rows.Content: Joey: Morning!ScenesRachel: Hi! Oh, how was your date last night?ScenesJoey: Pretty good.ScenesRachel: Oh good. (She walks to the closed bathroom door, opens it, and finds a naked woman wrapped in a towel.) Ahhh! My God, sorry! (She closes the door and confronts Joey.)ScenesJoey: Okay, really good. Anyway I gotta go; I’m late for work.ScenesRachel: What-what?! You’re gonna leave this person with me?!ScenesJoey: Yeah—Hey, don’t worry, she’s a terrific girl. And hey listen, could you do me a favor? When she comes out could you just mention that I’m not looking for a serious relationship; that’d be great.ScenesRachel: Why?! What?! Are you kidding?!ScenesJoey: Just casually slip it in, y’know lay the groundwork. Tell her uh, I’m a loner—No! An outlaw! Tell her she doesn’t want to get mixed up with the likes of me.ScenesRachel: Y’know what? That’s a lot to remember, can’t I just tell her you’re a pig?ScenesJoey: Hey, I’m gonna call her later! Honest! Oh come on, Chandler used to do it! He’d even make the girl pancakes! Plus, he’d make extras and leave ‘em for me.ScenesRachel: Well forget it, I’m not telling that girl anything. That is not my responsibility.ScenesJoey: Fine! (Pause) Now, where’d we land on those pancakes? (She chases him out the door as his date emerges from the bathroom.)ScenesJoey’s Date: Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesJoey’s Date: Sorry about that, but I couldn’t get that lock to work on the door.ScenesRachel: Yeah, Joey kinda disabled it when I moved in.ScenesJoey’s Date: You must be Rachel, I’m Erin.ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesErin: Hi. I don’t mean this to sound like high school, but did he say anything about me?ScenesRachel: (pause) Would you like some pancakes?ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: N.Y.U’s University Library, Ross is entering with Chandler.]
rows.Content: Chandler: …Come on! Why are we here?!ScenesRoss: Okay, okay take a guess.Scenes(An old woman pushes a cart full of books past.)ScenesChandler: The hot chicks?ScenesRoss: Okay, okay, I was typing names into the library computer earlier, y’know-y’know for fun, and I typed mine in and guess what came up? My doctoral dissertation! It’s here! Yeah, it’s right-it’s right down here! In the biggest library in the university! (They start heading that way, towards a secluded section behind the racks.)ScenesChandler: Wow that’s actually pretty cool.ScenesRoss: (stopping quickly) Oh umm, there’s also a book here by a woman named Wendy Bagina. (They both laugh, but stop when the hear moaning coming from the next aisle.) What is that?ScenesChandler: Sounds like two people are really enjoying the Dewey decimal system.Scenes(They go around the last row of bookshelves and find a couple doing what college coeds do in secluded corners of university libraries. For those of you who don’t know what I’m talking about, let’s just say that clothing is undone. Ross gasps and the couple gets up and runs away.)ScenesFemale Student: (as they are moving past Ross) I’m so sorry!ScenesMale Student: Sorry!ScenesChandler: You didn’t bring me here to do that, did you?

rows.Scenes: Monica’s Restaurant Kitchen, Monica is cooking as a waitress enters carrying a plate of food that has been sent back.]
rows.Content: Monica: She sent the chicken back again?!ScenesThe Waitress: She says it’s to dry now and she wants to come back here and explain to you exactly how she wants it.ScenesMonica: Well fine! I want to meet this chicken expert! Send the Colonel in!Scenes(The waitress lets her in as Monica is about to throw a lobster into a pot of boiling water (Although, she hasn’t taken off the rubber bands that hold the claws, so she can’t be that good of a chef). Anyway, guess who the Colonel is by the following phrase.)ScenesThe Colonel: OH…MY…GAWD!!!! (Yep, it’s Janice.)ScenesMonica: (to the lobster) Lucky bastard! (Throws the lobster in and turns around to face the planet’s most annoying woman, next to Dr. Laura and Kathy Lee Gifford of course. She’s the most annoying female TV character however.) Janice.ScenesJanice: How are you Ms. Hot Shot chef with the big fancy restaurant with the best chicken ever! (Does the laugh.)ScenesMonica: I’m fine.ScenesJanice: (notices Monica’s engagement ring) Ohh! What is that on your finger?! I’m blind!ScenesMonica: Oh… Uh…ScenesJanice: So, who’s the lucky guy?Scenes[Cut to Monica and Chandler’s just after Monica has finished telling Chandler what happened.]ScenesChandler: OH…MY…GAWD! I am so sorry sweetie, are you okay? You didn’t tell her we were getting married, did you?ScenesMonica: Well, she saw the ring.ScenesChandler: Did she freak out?ScenesMonica: Well, she was shocked when I told her, but then again so were most people.ScenesChandler: Right.ScenesMonica: Well, she actually has a boyfriend y’know herself, named Clark. Uh, she also kinda invited herself to our wedding. Clark too.ScenesChandler: (laughs) You said no right?ScenesMonica: Huh?ScenesChandler: You said no right?!ScenesMonica: Well, she corned me! She asked if the wedding was in town! I mean, what was I supposed to do?!ScenesChandler: Lie!!! How hard is that?! The check’s in the mail! Oh your baby is so cute! I can’t wait to read your book Ross!!ScenesMonica: Come on! So she comes to the wedding! I mean it won’t be so bad.ScenesChandler: What do you think she’s just gonna sit there quietly? You don’t think she’s gonna want to make a toast? You don’t think she’s gonna want to grab the microphone and sing Part-time Lover?!ScenesMonica: Oh my God, she’s not gonna like the chicken that night either is she?!ScenesChandler: Y’know what? It’s gonna be okay. Y’know what? She’s probably not gonna even want to come.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesChandler: No! That was a lie! See how easy that was?ScenesMonica: So-so you would’ve just lied?ScenesChandler: Yes!!ScenesMonica: Would it really have been that easy?ScenesChandler: Yes!!!ScenesMonica: Good, so do it Saturday night because we’re going to dinner with her and Clark.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is coming back from work to find Phoebe, Rachel, and someone else with her back turned is there.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! What’s up?ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, who’s your friend? (Erin turns around to face Joey, startling him) Hey!!ScenesErin: Hey Joey!ScenesJoey: Erin! Still here!ScenesRachel: Yeah, we ended up spending the day together and had such a great time!ScenesJoey: Why wouldn’t ya? Erin is great! Then-then there’s you guys.ScenesErin: Ohh, listen. I’ve got to get going. Today was great, thanks!ScenesRachel: I know!ScenesPhoebe: Okay!ScenesErin: Bye Joey. (Kisses him.) Last night was fun.ScenesJoey: Yeah. I’ll uh, I’ll call ya.ScenesRachel: Oh and I’ll call ya too!ScenesErin: Or I’ll call you!ScenesPhoebe: And call me!ScenesJoey: (to Erin) Okay, good to see you again.ScenesErin: Bye.ScenesJoey: Bye-bye.ScenesRachel: Bye!Scenes(Joey closes the door behind her.)ScenesJoey: So, system kinda broke down huh?!ScenesRachel: Oh Joey, I’m sorry I just couldn’t tell her all those things you wanted me to tell her. And y’know we got to talking and I…ScenesPhoebe: We want you to marry her!ScenesJoey: What?!!ScenesPhoebe: She is so amazing! You have no idea.ScenesJoey: No idea? Who do you think brought her here?ScenesRachel: Cupid.ScenesPhoebe: Joey, she’s so cool. She speaks four languages.ScenesJoey: Man, do you know what guys want!ScenesRachel: Look Joey, come on she’s so perfect for you! I mean she’s sweet, she-she likes baseball, and she-she had two beers at lunch.ScenesJoey: My beers?! Look you guys, she’s a very nice girl. Okay? We had a good time, but I just—I don’t see it going anywhere.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but you always say that.ScenesRachel: Yeah, maybe if you gave this girl a chance it would go somewhere.ScenesJoey: Look I’m sorry you guys, I-I just don’t think so.ScenesPhoebe: Whatever.ScenesRachel: Fine. (They start to walk away.)ScenesJoey: Hey, don’t start judging me! (To Rachel) Huh? You’re the one who’s in love with her assistant! (To Phoebe) Huh? And you, you’re the one having the affair with the guy who keeps the pigeons on the roof!ScenesRachel: Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Secret affair!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel and Joey are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: People are doing it in front of my book!ScenesRachel: I’m sorry?ScenesRoss: My doctoral dissertation is in the library at school, I went to see it, and there were students makin’ babies right in the middle of the Paleontology section!ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Did you get to see anything good?ScenesRoss: Let me ask you something, at your school was there a like uh a place on campus where students went to uh, fool around.ScenesRachel: Yeah, there was. It was—there the corner of the library where-where all these dusty books that nobody ever read—Yes, there was.ScenesRoss: Great! Because people kept showing up, I think it’s like uh-a thing!ScenesJoey: Now hold on a second, fifth floor against that back wall?ScenesRoss: Oh for cryin’ out loud! (He storms out.)ScenesJoey: All right, so we should go catch our movie.ScenesRachel: Well now what’s the rush?ScenesJoey: I like to see the previews. (Rachel looks at him.) The candy.ScenesPhoebe: (entering with Erin) Oh. Hey!ScenesRachel: Well look who’s here!ScenesErin: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesErin: Joey.ScenesJoey: Erin.ScenesErin: Hey Rachel.ScenesRachel: Hi! Well, we were just about to take off and see a movie. Oh no!ScenesErin: What’s wrong?ScenesRachel: Oh Phoebe, we forgot that party we have to go to.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no.ScenesJoey: (skeptical) What party?ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: A birthday party.ScenesJoey: Who’s birthday party?ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: Allison’s birthday party.ScenesJoey: (still skeptical) Oh, and how is Allison?ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: 32. (Joey’s not buying it.)ScenesRachel: (does a retching sound) Wait a minute! Why don’t you guys do something?!ScenesJoey: (still skeptical) Yeah, look how that worked out.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Library, Ross enters and heads to the desk to talk to the male librarian on duty.]
rows.Content: Ross: Excuse me. Hi, I’m a professor here. Do you know the Paleontology section, fifth floor, stack 437?ScenesThe Librarian: Well, yes! Just give me five minutes, I just have to find someone to cover my shift.ScenesRoss: No! No!! No! Can I speak to someone in charge please?! (The librarian brings his boss over.)ScenesThe Head Librarian: How can I help you?ScenesRoss: Hi, I was wondering if it is possible to increase security in the Paleontology section? See I-I wrote a book up there and instead of reading it people are-are-are well, rolling around in front of it.ScenesThe Head Librarian: We are aware of the problem you are referring too. (He turns to look at the previous librarian.) But as far as increasing security, I’m afraid the library is very understaffed. I, I can’t help you.ScenesRoss: Well, fine. Fine! If-if I’m the only person with any appreciation of the sanctity of the written word, I’ll go up there and defend it myself! (Starts to do so, but stops and to the previous librarian) And don’t you follow me!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel and Phoebe are doing dishes as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: How did it go with Erin?ScenesJoey: Oh, unbelievable! We had the best time!ScenesPhoebe: Yay!! Oh so, you’re not, you’re not mad at us anymore?ScenesJoey: No! No! No! You guys were totally right! This is so much better than the first time we went out. Y’know? That was so awkward, we were really nervous.ScenesPhoebe: Didn’t you sleep together?ScenesJoey: Yeah that really calms me down. And! We have so much in common! She loves sandwiches, sports, although she is a Met fan, not much of an issue now but if were ever to have kids, well that’s a…ScenesRachel: (gasps) Oh my God! Listen to you talkin’ about having kids. Oh my Joey. (She goes over and hugs him.) Oh, please don’t get married before I do.ScenesJoey: Okay.

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, Monica and Chandler are on their date with Janice and Clark, however Clark is a no show and Janice is crying the Mississippi River about it.]
rows.Content: Janice: Oh. Oh I just cannot believe Clark stood me up!ScenesMonica: He might still show up.ScenesJanice: Oh, what are you, stupid? It’s been three hours.ScenesMonica: Is that all?ScenesJanice: I should just go on to happier things, okay? Umm, why don’t you tell about your lovely wedding?ScenesChandler: Well actually uh, there was something we wanted to tell you about the wedding. Um, it’s going to be a small ceremony. Uh, tiny! We’re not even sure why we’re having it.ScenesMonica: It’s actually going to be just family.ScenesJanice: Oh…wait…you two think of me as family?! Oh, I have to ask you something now and be honest; do you want me to sing Careless Whisper or Lady In Red?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is entering and arguing baseball with Erin. Phoebe and Rachel are already there.]
rows.Content: Joey: How can you say that?! The Mets have no closer!ScenesErin: What about Benitez?ScenesJoey: What about Game 1 of the Series?ScenesErin: What about shut up?ScenesJoey: You shut up! (To Phoebe and Rachel) I love arguing with her. (To Erin) I’ll be right back.ScenesErin: Okay. (Joey goes to get some coffee and Erin sits down.)ScenesRachel: So how’s it goin’ with Joey?ScenesErin: Uh, okay.ScenesRachel: Okay? Wait okay, tell-tell me that you like him, please? I mean tell me that you like him.ScenesErin: Look, he’s a really great guy and I know that you really want this to work out, but I just don’t see this having a future.ScenesRachel: But you said that you liked him! I mean what happened?! Did ya just change your mind?!ScenesErin: Kinda.ScenesPhoebe: Then change it back!ScenesErin: I’m sorry I… It’s just there’s no real spark.ScenesPhoebe: No spark? Didn’t you sleep together?ScenesErin: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Ugh, tramp!ScenesPhoebe: Does Joey have any idea?ScenesErin: I really don’t think he does. And y’know what? Maybe you guys could help clue him in. Y’know, tell him I’m-I’m not interested in a serious relationship or something.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, you mean like that you’re kind of a loner.ScenesErin: Yeah! That would be great!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, and maybe that you’re a real (She says something in Italian, and it doesn’t matter what she said. It’s not important so I don’t need everyone who speaks Italian telling me what she said.)ScenesErin: I’m sorry?ScenesPhoebe: Oh well, I guess Italian isn’t one of the four languages you speak.ScenesJoey: (returning) Hey! You wanna go?ScenesErin: Yeah, let’s go.ScenesJoey: Okay. See you guys later.ScenesErin: Bye guys.ScenesRachel: Yeah, see ya.ScenesJoey: (whispers to Phoebe and Rachel) Hey, thank you so much. (They both exit.)ScenesRachel: Wow. Well, I guess it was Cupid who brought her here.ScenesPhoebe: No, just a regular old flying dwarf.

rows.Scenes: The library’s Paleontology section, Ross is patrolling as a couple walks up.]
rows.Content: Ross: Yes? Yes?! How can I help you?ScenesGuy: Yeah, we were…we were just looking around.ScenesRoss: Oh-oh, you’re-you’re fellow scholars. What exactly were you looking for, hmm? Perhaps, (Grabs a book from the shelf behind him) perhaps Dr. Chester Stock’s musings on the Smiledon Californicus?ScenesGuy: Uhh….ScenesRoss: Ah… Ah…Get out of here! (The couple retreats. Ross starts looking through the previously mentioned book as a beautiful woman walks into the section.) Uh, meeting someone? Or-or are you just here to brush up on Marion’s views on evolution?ScenesWoman: Uh, actually I find Marion’s views far to progressionist.ScenesRoss: I find Marion’s views far to progressionist.ScenesWoman: I’m sorry, who are you?ScenesRoss: I’m a professor here uh, Ross…Geller.ScenesWoman: Ross Geller, why do I know that name? It’s uh—Wait! (Grabs his book off of the shelf.) Did you write this?ScenesRoss: Yes! You’re the person who checked out my book?!ScenesWoman: Y’know, you look nothing like I would’ve thought. You’re…you’re so young.ScenesRoss: Well I uh, I skipped forth grade.Scenes[Time Lapse, Ross and the woman are now in a state of partial undress and are standing in front of the head librarian with two security guards watching them.]ScenesRoss: I am very…very sorry.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Phoebe and Rachel are watching TV as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: So how was, how was your date?ScenesJoey: Oh, it was great! I mean we walked all around the village. We went to this ice cream place, split a milkshake, 70/30 but still… And guess what, I’m thinking about taking her upstate to one of those bed and breakfasts.ScenesPhoebe: Oh really? She said she wants to go away with you?ScenesJoey: No-no-no-no-no! It’s a surprise, but it’s gonna be tricky thought because she said she was gonna be pretty busy at work for a while.ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: Oh no, yeah.ScenesRachel: Jo-Joey, look honey we-we need to talk okay? Umm, I kinda got the feeling from her today that uh, she’s not lookin’ for a serious relationship.ScenesJoey: Where are you gettin’ this?ScenesRachel: Well, she told me. She said she’s kinda a loner.ScenesJoey: Oh. Oh.ScenesRachel: Joey…ScenesJoey: No hey Rach, it’s cool okay? Y’know I’m a loner too! (Heads for his room.) Right?ScenesPhoebe: Hey Joey, y’know what? You are way to good for her.ScenesRachel: Yeah and honey I promise next time that I will just say good-bye and tell ‘em you’re not looking for a relationship.ScenesJoey: No! No. Don’t do that, just next time make sure she really likes me.ScenesRachel: Well that too. (Joey goes into his room.) Joey?ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Do you want some pancakes?ScenesJoey: (coming back out) Finally!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler and Monica are sitting at the kitchen table and are still trying to decide what to do about Janice.]
rows.Content: Monica: What are we gonna do?ScenesChandler: I say we go with Careless Whisper.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Janice enters.)ScenesJanice: Chandler?ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Did she see us yet? Did she see us?ScenesMonica: Janice, what umm, what are you doing here?ScenesJanice: Well umm, I thought I was going to go back to my apartment but then I just felt I couldn’t really be alone tonight. (Joey walks into view of the open door behind Janice, sees her, gets a terrified look on his face, and flees in horror.) I was wondering if I could maybe stay here with you, just I really feel that I need to be with family.ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) Our kids are gonna call her Aunt Janice aren’t they?ScenesJanice: Please, it’s because otherwise I really don’t know what I might do.ScenesChandler: Aren’t you just a tinsy bit curious?ScenesJanice: (starting to cry) Do you have any tissues?ScenesMonica: Yeah, in-in-in the bathroom.ScenesJanice: Okay! (She runs for the bathroom)ScenesMonica: We’ll just…we’ll just let her stay.ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no, if we let her stay, she will stay forever!ScenesMonica: Kinda like your Barca lounger.ScenesChandler: Is that what you’re thinking about right now?ScenesMonica: I never stop thinking about it.ScenesJanice: Hey you guys, umm do either one of you want to get in there before I take my bath.ScenesChandler: Janice, I’m sorry but umm, you can’t stay here tonight.ScenesJanice: Why not?ScenesChandler: Honestly? Our apartment is a hotbed for electromagnetic activity. Now Monica and I have been immunized, but sadly you have not.Scenes(And she does the laugh.)ScenesJanice: Okay, I’m going to need a comforter, but did you have a hypoallergenic one because otherwise I get very nasal. (Makes some weird sound) Do you have a cat? ‘Cause it’s already happening. (Makes a nasal sound) Do you hear that? (She keeps making the nasal sound.)Scenes(Chandler does the same nasal sound to Chandler.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Oh my God! You have to go!ScenesJanice: Why?ScenesMonica: Because Chandler still has feelings for you!ScenesJanice: He does?ScenesChandler: Say again?ScenesMonica: That’s right. That’s right. And that is why you can’t stay here tonight. And probably why you shouldn’t come to the wedding.ScenesChandler: Feelings, such strong feelings.ScenesMonica: I mean, I realize that his feelings may never completely go away, but you can.ScenesJanice: Oh…my Gawd, I-I understand. I-I am so sorry, I’ll go. (Starts for the door.) Good-bye Monica (hugs her), I wish you a lifetime of happiness with him. Chandler, (hugs him) you call me when this goes in the pooper. (Hurries out.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: The library’s Paleontology section, Ross is on patrol and stops a security guard through the stack of books.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to the guard) Don’t sweat it, I’ve got this section covered. Yeah, in fact I’ve got this little baby (Turns on a mini-flashlight) to shine in people’s eye—(The guard walks away)—Okay, see you later.Scenes(Ross resumes his patrol when his best friend and sister walk up and start to take off their coats, but they stop when they see him.)ScenesChandler: I just wanted to show Monica your book. (Ross just glares at him.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Chandler Doesn’t Like DogsScenesWritten by: Patty LinScenesTranscribed by: Eric AasenScenesWith Help from: Didi Chow

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is in the kitchen, Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe are sitting around the table writing one notepads while Chandler is looking over their shoulders.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering) Hey everybody! Happy Thanksgiving!ScenesChandler: No, no, no. No-no-no.ScenesJoey, Rachel, and Phoebe: Shhhh!ScenesRoss: What, are we keeping Thanksgiving a secret this year?ScenesChandler: No, we're playing this game I learned at work. You have to name all the states in six minutes.ScenesRoss: What? That's like insanely easy!ScenesChandler: Now, that's a lot harder than it sounds. You always forget at least one, or in some cases... fourteen (looks over to Monica).ScenesMonica: It's a stupid game and I wasn't playing against other people, so technically I didn't lose.ScenesRoss: What? You forgot fourteen states?ScenesMonica: Nobody cares about the Dakotas. (That’s true in so many ways, trust me, I’ve lived in one and been to the other.)Scenes[Chandler's watch beeps]ScenesChandler: Oh, okay, time's up!ScenesRachel: All right, I got 48.ScenesChandler: Oh that's not bad, Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I got tired of naming states. So I decided to list the types of celery, and I have one: regular celery.ScenesChandler: Okay, so Rachel's got 48 and Phoebe has the lead in…vegetables, Joey?ScenesJoey: Say hello to the new champ of Chandler's dumb states game.ScenesRoss: Wow, how many have you got?ScenesJoey: Fifty-six!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's. Ross is sitting in the couch doing Chandler's game. Chandler is sitting in his barca-lounger. The girls are in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! How is New England not a state? Huh? They have a sports-team!ScenesChandler: Does South Oregon have a sports-team? (Joey strikes one from his list) There you go.Scenes[Cut to the girls in the kitchen.]ScenesRachel: (counting the place settings) How come we have one extra place setting?ScenesMonica: 'Cause you invited your assistant.ScenesRachel: Oh, right. Sorry. But Tag's not coming; his girlfriend came into town, so he's spending Thanksgiving with her.ScenesMonica: Oh! Why didn't you tell me? I made him his own individual sweet potato stuffed pumpkin.ScenesRachel: Well, I was going to, but then I figured, you know... you're food is so delicious and perfect, you can never have too many of those pumpkin things.ScenesMonica: Now you think I wouldn't enjoy that, because it is so fake, (Laughs) but I still do.ScenesPhoebe: Regular Celery! (Starts to write that on her list) Oh, I already have that. (She gets up and heads for her room)ScenesRoss: Done! With time a-to-spare.ScenesChandler: Oooh that may be a New World's record (Looks at his watch and picks up Ross' pad)ScenesRoss: You know, I hate to lecture you guys, but it's kinda disgraceful, that a group of well-educated adults and Joey can't name all the states. Did you ever see a map, or one of those round, colorful things called "a globe?" Hmm?ScenesChandler: Uh, Magellan? You got 46 states. (Smiles and hands Ross back his pad)ScenesRoss: What? That's impossible.ScenesJoey: 46. Wow! Who's well educated now, Mr. I-forgot-ten-states?ScenesMonica: All right, I'm out of oven space. I'm gonna turn on Joey's. Please, watch him! Do not let Joey eat any of the food!ScenesChandler: I am only one man! (Monica heads out) Okay Ross, time is up!ScenesRoss: No, just give me another minute.ScenesChandler: Look Ross, if you don't know them by now, you will never know them, okay? That is the beauty of this game. It makes you want to kill yourself.ScenesRoss: This-this is crazy! I can do this! All right, uhh, I bet I can get all 50 before dinner.ScenesChandler: Okay, but if you can't…no dinner!ScenesRoss: You're on!ScenesJoey: (gets up) All right. Don't look at my list, Ross, 'cause there's a lot on there that you don't have.ScenesMonica: (entering, to Joey and Rachel) Hey, did you guys know, that your oven doesn't work?ScenesJoey: But the drawer full of take-out menus is okay, right?ScenesMonica: Ross, I'm gonna use yours, okay?ScenesRoss: Pshhshhh!ScenesMonica: Chandler? Can you give me a hand? (Grabs her jacket)ScenesChandler: Sure, and Joey; do not let Ross look at any of the maps or the globe in your apartment.ScenesJoey: Don't worry, Chandler, it's not a globe of the United States.Scenes[Chandler and Monica head out with some stuff. Phoebe comes out of her room with a bag.]ScenesPhoebe: Hey you guys I'm gonna go out and take a walk.ScenesRoss: Phoebe, why is your bag moving?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it's not!ScenesRachel: Seriously, it's moving!ScenesJoey: What the hell is in there?ScenesPhoebe: It's just my knitting that's all! (A dog sticks its head out of Phoebe's bag. Everyone looks puzzled.) Yes! I knit this. I'm very good.

rows.Scenes: Ross' apartment, Monica and Chandler enter.]
rows.Content: Monica: Ross’s apartment is nice! How come we don't hang out here more often?ScenesChandler: I don't know. Maybe it's because it smells a little weird. It's like old pumpkins or something.ScenesMonica: That's my pie!ScenesChandler: Which smells delicious!ScenesMonica: Uh-oh! Uh-oh!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: We left Joey alone with the food! (Walks towards the window and looks out) Yep! Yep, I knew it! There he is... feeding stuffing to a dog!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Ross is still doing his list. Rachel and Joey are feeding the dog as the phone rings.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (answering the phone) Hi Geller-Bing residence. How can I help?ScenesMonica: Phoebe, why is there a dog in our apartment?ScenesPhoebe: I'm sorry, who's this?ScenesMonica: Phoebe, there's a dog sitting on my couch!ScenesChandler: Tell her, I'm allergic, and I will sue!ScenesPhoebe: No, there's no dog here?ScenesMonica: Yes there is! He's black and white and shaggy and [Cut to Monica’s apartment] he's sitting next to Rachel and licking Rachel's hand.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my god! Where are you? (Looks around.)ScenesMonica: I'll be right there!ScenesPhoebe: (Phoebe hangs up and someone knocks on the door. She gasps.) They're here already? How are they doing this?ScenesRachel: (gets up and opens the door) Hi Tag! What are you doing here?ScenesTag: I, uh, wanted to see if your offer to spend Thanksgiving with you is still good.ScenesRachel: Well, sure! Come in! (He enters) Well, what-what happened to your girlfriend?ScenesTag: We kinda broke up this morning.ScenesRachel: Oh, I'm sorry.ScenesTag: Yeah, so she went back to Ohio.ScenesRoss: Ohio!! Thank you!Scenes[Time lapse, Chandler and Monica enter.]ScenesChandler: Huh! Where is the dog?!ScenesRoss: What dog? There-there's no dog here.ScenesJoey: Yeah that dog left!ScenesMonica: (walks to Phoebe's door) Phoebe! Phoebe, open up!ScenesPhoebe: There's no dog in here.Scenes[The dog barks.]ScenesChandler: Phoebe, we can hear the dog barking!ScenesPhoebe: No that's just me coughing! (Doing some weird coughing noises and the dog barks again. Phoebe comes out of the room.) Oh, good, there you are! Listen, um, I have a dog in my room.ScenesChandler: What is it doing here?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I'm watching it for some friends who went out of town. Wait. (She bends down, picks up the dog, and waves with one of its paws) Hello, my name is Clunkers. May I please stay with you nice people?ScenesMonica: Oooh, I wish she could stay here, but Chandler is allergic!ScenesChandler: Extremely allergic, okay? If I'm anywhere near a dog for more than 5 minutes, my throat will just close up!ScenesPhoebe: That's odd, 'cause this dog's been living here for the past 3 daysScenesChandler: (gasping) Really?ScenesMonica: Chandler, if that dog's been here that long, and you haven't had a reaction, maybe you're not allergic to this dog?ScenesChandler: Well, it still has to go, right?ScenesMonica and Phoebe: Why?ScenesChandler: Okay, it's um…ScenesJoey: (interrupting him) Don't do it!ScenesMonica: Don't do what?ScenesChandler: (to Joey) I have to! Okay? It's time! (Joey shrugs as if to say, "Do what you have to do") Okay, I hate dogs.ScenesAll: What?ScenesPhoebe: Are you crazy?ScenesRoss: Are you out of your mind?ScenesPhoebe: Why?ScenesJoey: Told ya. (Waves bye-bye.)ScenesChandler: They are needy, they are jumpy, and you can't tell what they are thinking, and that scares me a little bit.ScenesRoss: Right, they are scary. (He jumps up, screaming) Ahh, she just ate a treat out of my hand!!!ScenesRachel: Wait a minute. Do you not like all dogs? I mean, not even puppies?ScenesChandler: (scared) Is there a puppy here?ScenesTag: You don't like puppies?ScenesChandler: (to Tag) Okay, you are new!ScenesJoey: Look, Chandler, I told you, never tell anyone about this dog thing. It's like Ross not likin’ ice cream.ScenesPhoebe: You don't like ice cream?ScenesRoss: It's too cold.ScenesChandler: Okay, it's just that dogs make me a little uncomfortable.ScenesRoss: (to Phoebe) It hurts my teeth.ScenesChandler: And I don't wanna say this, I don't you guys to hate me, but uh, I don't think, I can be around that dog anymore. Okay, so either the dog goes, or I go. (An awkward silence ensues.) Oh my god!!Scenes[Time lapse, Ross is still doing Chandler's game. Tag is heading for the balcony.]ScenesRoss: How can I not get this? I'm a college professor; I got 1450 on my S.A.T.s.ScenesMonica: 1250.ScenesRoss: Damn, I forgot you were here.ScenesPhoebe: All right. We're gonna take Clunkers to Ross’s. We'll be back in a minute. (Gets up with Monica to do so.)ScenesRachel: Oh, wait before you guys go, can I just ask you a question?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesRachel: When a guy breaks up with his girlfriend, what is an appropriate amount of time to wait before you make a move?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I'd say about a month.ScenesMonica: Really? I'd say 3 to 4.ScenesJoey: Half hour. (Rachel turns to look at him and he nods yes.)ScenesRachel: Interesting.ScenesMonica: When it's your assistant, I would say never.ScenesJoey: All right, Rach, the big question is, does he like you? All right? Because if he doesn't like you, this is all a moo-point.ScenesRachel: Huh. A moo-point?ScenesJoey: Yeah, it's like a cow's opinion. It just doesn't matter. It's moo.ScenesRachel: (to Monica and Phoebe) Have I been living with him for too long, or did that all just make sense?ScenesMonica: Please, don't listen to Joey, okay. Would you look at him? He-he’s obviously depressed. He's away from his family; he's spending Thanksgiving with strangers.   What he needs right now is for you to be his friend.ScenesRachel: You're right, I'm sorry. Thank you. Okay, that's what I'm gonna do.ScenesJoey: Fine! Take their advice. No one ever listens to me. When the package is this pretty, no one cares what's inside.Scenes[Cut to the balcony, Tag is looking down while Rachel enters.]ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesTag: Hey.ScenesRachel: How are you holding up?ScenesTag: Not bad.ScenesRachel: Yeah? I'm sorry about your girlfriend.ScenesTag: Thanks.ScenesRachel: So were you guys together a long time?ScenesTag: A year. On and off. I kinda thought we'd end up together. I don't anymore.ScenesRachel: Now that she broke up with you?ScenesTag: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Yeah. Hmmmm.ScenesTag: It's weird. I always used to assume, that I would meet someone and fall in love and be happy and all that was just a given. But lately it's like what if it's not. Do you ever have that feeling?ScenesRachel: No…Yeah, all the time, constantly. It's terrifying. But you know that I figure it…it has to work out.ScenesTag: Why?ScenesRachel: Because, uh—it has to.ScenesTag: You have all the answers, don't you?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I know, I do. I really do.ScenesTag: Hey, thanks for talking to me.ScenesRachel: Well, what is a boss for? Hug it out! (They hug)ScenesJoey: (through the window) All right, he likes you back! Huh? Told ya, you should go for it!ScenesTag: What?ScenesJoey: (realizes what he said) Street noise drowned any of that out? (Rachel moves madly towards him) No, all right, I see you later, okay... (Turns away embarrassed)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Balcony, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Tag: What did Joey say? I like you back?ScenesRachel: Uh, yeah, well, see, he… Joey knows, that I'm-I'm very insecure about my back and, and…you're hugging me, so obviously you are not repulsed by it, yeah!ScenesTag: Wait-wait a minute; that doesn't make any sense.ScenesRachel: No? (He shakes his head) All right, here's the truth um, Joey said what he said, because um, I'm attracted to you.ScenesTag: Wow. (He starts to walk towards the railing.)ScenesRachel: Yeah, I admit it. I have a crush on you, and uh, and, and I know that's crazy because we work together, and-and nothing could ever happen, and the last thing I want to do is-is to freak you out or make you feel uncomfortable. Which is why it would be really great if you said something right about now.ScenesTag: (looking at the street) Oh my god! Those guys are stealing my car! (He points down to the street)ScenesRachel: What?ScenesTag: Right there! That's my car! (Sound of a breaking car-window) Hey!!ScenesRachel: Okay, that's gonna take them a minute. Do you have anything else you wanna get off your chest?ScenesTag: I can't believe this! (He walks back in again)ScenesRachel: (she hurries after him) Wait, we still have time to talk and they’re-they're not even in the car yet! (She takes a quick look down the street.) Oh look, there they go, okay. (She hurries in, too)

rows.Scenes: Ross' apartment, Monica and Phoebe sitting on the floor next to Clunkers basket.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay Phoebe, we should probably go back now.ScenesPhoebe: (doing Clunkers) Please don't leave me, I'll be lonely.ScenesMonica: Stop it. Stop! Okay let's go. We can be strong.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, okay.Scenes[They both get up and head for the door. Clunkers whines a little]ScenesMonica: Oh my god! Did you hear that? She said Monica! (She goes back to Clunkers again) Oooh, I can't leave her!ScenesPhoebe: You know if you want, we can sneak the dog back in and Chandler wouldn't even know.ScenesMonica: That's not gonna work.ScenesPhoebe: I've had that dog there for three days and Chandler had no idea. He's not so smart.ScenesMonica: Hey! I didn't know either.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but you kinda knew that something was going on, didn't you?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I knew.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's. Ross lays a lot off small papers, shaped like the U.S. states onto the floor making a map with the states. Phoebe enters]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Where's Chandler?ScenesChandler: (comes out of the bathroom) Here I am.ScenesPhoebe: Wash your hands!!!ScenesChandler: How did you…know? (Heads back into the bathroom)Scenes[Phoebe waves Monica in. Monica sneaks in with the bag with Clunkers in it and heads for Phoebe's room.]ScenesRoss: Hey! What's she doing back here?ScenesMonica: Relax, Ross. She's not made of ice cream!ScenesRoss: Hey look, Phoebe. I, uh, I laid out the states geographically...ScenesPhoebe: (interrupts him) No, no, we don't really have time for this right now. Okay, we have to keep Chandler away from my bedroom.ScenesRoss: Yeah, but, but look what I'm...ScenesPhoebe: See, this is exactly what we do not have time for. (She rushes into her room)ScenesChandler: (comes out of the bathroom) Where's Monica?ScenesRoss: Um, in Phoebe's room. You can't go in there.ScenesChandler: Why not?Scenes(We can hear the dog whining at a high pitch.)ScenesRoss: Monica's crying. She's very upset about this whole Clunkers thing.ScenesChandler: Well, I, I should go in there.ScenesRoss: No. No, no. She doesn't want to see you right now.ScenesChandler: Why not?ScenesRoss: Because you sent away the dog!ScenesChandler: This is ridiculous. (He heads for Phoebe's bedroom)ScenesRoss: Oh, is it? Is it? Look, when Monica and I were kids, we had a dog named Rover. And, uh, one day, my dad decides, he doesn't like dogs. So Monica and her friend…Phyllis…take away the dog. And that was the last time we ever saw him. Don't you see? This is just like that. Only with a few details changed.ScenesJoey: (entering) Okay, I'm in my sweat pants. Bring on the food! (Sees that Chandler has a worried look on his face) What's the matter?ScenesChandler: Monica's all upset, because I sent Clunkers away.ScenesJoey: So? Bring the dog back, you're a hero.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I can be a hero, I could do that. I could, I could do... I, w-w-what if, what if it attacks me?ScenesJoey: Chandler, it's like a big gerbil.ScenesChandler: And that doesn't scare you? (He walks out)ScenesJoey: Ross, you need some help?ScenesRoss: From you? (He does a weird desperate laughter, like he's almost crying) Yes, please!ScenesJoey: (sits down next to Ross) First of all, Utah? Dude, you can't just make stuff up!Scenes[Time lapse, Ross still laying a lot out the states.]ScenesRoss: I hate America! When I finish this game, I swear I am moving.Scenes[Joey stands up again. Rachel enters the door]ScenesJoey: Hey! Tag's still talking to the police.ScenesRachel: Yeah, ohh! Why, damnit, why did I open my mouth? (In a girlish voice) I have a crush on you; I am attracted to you. (Back to normal again) Gee, I-I know that I freaked him outScenesJoey: If you said it like that, you probably did, yeah.Scenes[Rachel walks past Joey towards the couch]ScenesPhoebe: (opens her bedroom door and peeks out) Hey, is Chandler here?ScenesChandler: No, no he went for a walk.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, but you cannot tell him... but look whose back!Scenes[The dog barks, runs out of Phoebe's room and jumps onto the couch]ScenesRachel: (gasps) Hi!ScenesJoey: Oh No-no-no-no-no-no-no! He went over to Ross' to bring the dog back here!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, the dog's not going to be there!ScenesJoey: You think?Scenes[The door opens and Chandler comes in. Rachel covers the door with a blanket]ScenesMonica: Hi, honey.ScenesChandler: Please, please, please, don't be mad at me.ScenesMonica: What? Why, why would...ScenesPhoebe: (interrupts her, to Monica) Shh, wait and see. Maybe we will, maybe we won't.ScenesChandler: Okay, I went over to Ross' apartment to bring back Clunkers. Y’know, for you, and…(Clears his throat) I left the door open and she must have gotten out and I looked everywhere, all over the apartment, including the roof, which FYI Ross, one of your neighbors, growing weed. I couldn't find him, and I am so, so, so, sorry. But I do know where we could all go ease the pain. (Points up and then over to the street)ScenesPhoebe: We have good news, look whose back!ScenesRachel: (uncovers the dog) Hi!ScenesChandler: Clunkers?! Oh my god!ScenesMonica: That's right, she came back all by herself.ScenesPhoebe: It's a Thanksgiving miracle!ScenesChandler: (to Clunkers) It is so good to see you!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, she came all the way back from Ross' building. Oh, the things she must have seen! And then she climbed up the fire escape and she tapped on the window with her teeny little paw and then we ran to let her in…(Realizes, that Chandler starts to not believing her) I went to far, didn't I? When should I have stopped?Scenes[Time lapse, after dinner. Ross stands up from his self-made map.]ScenesRoss: Okay, maybe this is so hard, because there aren't 50 states. Let me tell you something, I have 49 states, and there are no more! I-I think, I should be able to eat something.ScenesChandler: It's up to you.Scenes[Ross whines and starts working again. The door opens and Tag enters.]ScenesRachel: Oh, hi! How are you doing?ScenesTag: I'm okay. I gotta go down to the police station and look at mug shots.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesTag: Thanks for having me over, you guys.ScenesRoss: Tag? Y-You're going? (Comes over to Tag) Uh we didn't, uh we didn't get the chance to talk. Uh, so, where did you say you're from again?ScenesTag: Colorado.ScenesRoss: Ah, what good are you. (Walks back to his map dejectedly.)Scenes[Rachel and Tag go into the hall.]ScenesRachel: Look, um, I think we should talk about what happened on the terrace.ScenesTag: Okay.ScenesRachel: Ah, I-I never should have said what I said. It—y’know what? It just doesn't matter how I feel.
