(Hands her the phone.) Good luck explaining all the calls to China.Scenes(Phoebe opens the door and Tom, an older gentleman with white hair, enters.)ScenesTom: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel) Wow! How long were we arguing for?ScenesRachel: (laughs) You’re not the man who left the cell phone.ScenesTom: No that’s my assistant.ScenesRachel: Is-is he coming? (Looks hopefully out the door.)ScenesTom: Umm, no.ScenesPhoebe: Could you-could you umm, give us one second?ScenesTom: Sure!ScenesRachel: We’ll be right back sir.ScenesTom: Sure.Scenes(They walk into the living room.)ScenesPhoebe: Wh-what do we do?ScenesRachel: I don’t know!ScenesPhoebe: Can you believe this? (Rachel exhales in amazement.) We were waiting for a hot guy and then an even hotter one shows up!ScenesRachel: I know! (Realizes what Phoebe said.) What?!ScenesPhoebe: Hmm, they just don’t make ‘em like that anymore!ScenesRachel: (turning and looking at Tom again) No-no they do but, you just have to wait.ScenesPhoebe: Rachel, listen—I mean, if you let me have him then I will really owe you one.ScenesRachel: (fake disappointment) All right. All right Phoebe I will let you have him, but you owe me; you owe me big!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! You’re such a great friend!ScenesRachel: Ohh…ScenesTom: So, which one of you lovely ladies am I going to take to dinner huh?ScenesPhoebe: Oh that’d be me. Sir. (Hands him the cell phone.) After you.ScenesTom: Okay. Okay. (Exits and Phoebe checks him out.)ScenesPhoebe: (whispering) Nice!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Cecilia is entering the living room from Joey’s room followed by Joey.]
rows.Content: Cecilia: Well, you certainly own that room.ScenesJoey: Actually I rent the whole place and, I just got what you meant. Thank you.Scenes(She laughs as Rachel enters.)ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesJoey: Hey!Scenes(Rachel stops dead in her tracks when she sees whom Joey is with.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Oh my God!! Ohh, Jessica Lockhart!! In my apartment!! I am such a huge fan! I am such a huge fan!ScenesCecilia: Well, it’s nice to know that you…ScenesRachel: (screaming) MONICA!!!! MONICA!!!! (Runs to Monica’s.)ScenesJoey: That uh, that is my roommate Rachel.ScenesCecilia: Oh that explains all the women’s underwear.ScenesJoey: (shrugs) Sure. Yep.ScenesMonica: (entering with Rachel) Oh my God! It’s true!! Oh my God you are so amazing! Oh my God, can I just ask you to do me oh, just one favor?ScenesCecilia: Certainly.ScenesMonica: Would you slap me? Would you slap me right here in the face?! (Points to her cheek.)ScenesCecilia: I’d love to, but my lawyer said I can’t do that anymore.ScenesRachel: God. You seem really, really nice.ScenesJoey: Okay, bye-bye.ScenesRachel: I mean n-not-not fake at all like most famous people.ScenesJoey: All right, here we go. (He grabs them and starts to pull them out of the apartment.)ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: (breaks away) Oh wait, just one more thing! One more minute! (To Cecilia) Umm, you’re a stupid bitch.ScenesCecilia: I really can’t slap you. (Monica walks away angrily)ScenesRachel: You are so beautiful.ScenesMonica: Nice to meet you! My God you’re great!ScenesJoey: Thanks for stopping by. See ya! (Throws them out and closes the door.) (To Cecilia) I-I am so sorry. I…ScenesCecilia: Oh no-no-no-no, being adored. I’m used to it, don’t worry about it.ScenesJoey: (notices something in the mail that Rachel brought in) Oh my God!ScenesCecilia: What?ScenesJoey: They sent me today’s script! They never send the script!ScenesCecilia: They don’t?ScenesJoey: Well no, I’m just in a coma. This must mean I have lines! (Realizes what that means.) Oh…ScenesCecilia: How does it happen?ScenesJoey: (flipping to the last page) Ew, you get thrown from a horse into an electric fence.ScenesCecilia: Ah what?! Jessica hates horses!ScenesJoey: Yeah well, I’m guessing after this she’s not going to be crazy about electricity either.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Monica have gathered to hear Ross perform his interpretation of Celebration by Cool and the Gang on the bag pipe.]
rows.Content: Ross: …now remember you have to imagine me in a kilt.ScenesRachel: (giggles) (To Ross) I can imagine you in a short plaid skirt and knee socks.ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) Do you wanna start telling secrets?ScenesRachel: No!ScenesRoss: (stands up) Now umm, remember I’m still learning.Scenes(As he prepares to start, he makes several horrible noises that scares Rachel into retreat.)ScenesRoss: One, two, three, four!Scenes(He starts. And well, Celebration was never meant to be played on the bagpipe, so even the best bag pipe players in the world would have trouble with that particular song. So of course, for a beginner like Ross, it sounds absolutely dreadful. The assembled audience minus Phoebe, are horrified. Phoebe, immune to bad music, seems to enjoy it.)ScenesRoss: You know the song! Sing along!Scenes(Ross resumes playing, this time accompanied by Phoebe screeching out E’s in tune with Ross. While Phoebe is singing along, Rachel is having a very difficult time keeping a straight face. Thankfully, Ross gives up after a little while.)ScenesRoss: So?ScenesMonica and Chandler: No!Scenes(Ross throws the bagpipes down in disgust.)

rows.Scenes: Silvercup Studios, a scene is being shot where Dina and Fredrick are celebrating Jessica’s horrible accident by drinking champagne.]
rows.Content: Dina: Loosening the saddle on mother’s horse was brilliant Fredrick. And the electric fence, inspired.ScenesFredrick: Thank you sweetheart. (They clink glasses.)ScenesDina: I can’t believe she’s really gone. Look around you, all of this is ours. (They move into kiss but; they’re stopped by Joey entering with a huge bandage wrapped around his head.)ScenesJoey: (as Jessica) I don’t think so.ScenesDina: Who are you?!ScenesJessica Lockhart: What’s the matter Dina? Don’t you recognize your own (Does a hair flip) mother?!ScenesThe Director: Cut! That was great everybody! Thank you!ScenesCecilia: (running out to Joey) That was so wonderful! (Hugs him) Ohh, I think that you’re a better Jessica than I ever was!ScenesJoey: Oh noo…ScenesCecilia: Well of course not, but you were very good.ScenesJoey: Thanks!ScenesCecilia: And guess what? Good news! I got another job!ScenesJoey: Great! Hey! All right! Well-well what is it?!ScenesCecilia: A film in Guadalajara!ScenesJoey: The airport?ScenesCecilia: No that’s La Guardia. (Joey nods in recognition.) This is Mexico.ScenesJoey: Ohh. Wow! Well how-how, how will you be gone?ScenesCecilia: Eight months.ScenesJoey: That’s a really long time.ScenesCecilia: Yeah, but you can come and visit me. I bet that you could uh, own a few places down there.ScenesJoey: Well I tell ya, I should probably buy a place in the city first. (Realizes.) And I just got what you meant again—That is—I tell ya, that is a tricky one!ScenesCecilia: That is a tricky one. Well, Joey I really wanna thank you. You’ve, well you made a very difficult time for me a little less painful.ScenesJoey: Good luck.ScenesCecilia: You too.Scenes(They kiss and both put their hands on the other’s face like Jessica would do.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Monica have gathered to hear Ross perform his interpretation of Celebration by Cool and the Gang on the bag pipe. Yes, I typed that earlier. We’re seeing this again, only this time Ross as already started playing.]
rows.Content: Ross: You know the song! Sing along!ScenesPhoebe: Eeee!!! Eee!! Eee!!Scenes(Monica (Courtney Cox) and Chandler (Matthew Perry) are laughing. That then causes Lisa and Jennifer come out of character and start laughing hysterically. And that finally causes David Schwimmer to come out of character and start laughing as well. Matthew decides to sing along now as well.)ScenesMatthew Perry: Eee!! (This causes more laughter.)ScenesLisa Kudrow: Do it again!Scenes(Matthew mimics the sound again.)ScenesEndScenes(Why was this the trailer? Well, that’s because it was an introduction into the special out takes episode that immediately followed the show. The entire out takes episode, Friends: The Stuff You’ve Never Seen can be read by following this link.)ScenesThe One With The Truth About LondonScenesTeleplay by: Zachary RosenblattScenesStory by: Brian Buckner & Sebastian JonesScenesDirected by: David SchwimmerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is filing her nails as Ross and Ben enter.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hi.ScenesRachel: Hi! Hi Ben!ScenesBen: Hi.ScenesRoss: Hi, we have a little bathroom emergency.ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah go ahead.Scenes(Ben starts to go, but Ross stops him.)ScenesRoss: Uh, before we do uh, are any of Joey’s special romance magazines in there?ScenesRachel: No. No.ScenesRoss: (to Ben) Okay! All clear!ScenesBen: (running to the bathroom) Thanks Phoebe!ScenesRachel: Ben, its Rachel! (He closes the door.) But whatever.ScenesRoss: (to Ben) Everything okay in there?ScenesBen: Don’t talk to me now!ScenesRachel: Awww, just like his daddy.ScenesRoss: Hey listen can you do me a big favor? The dean’s office just called and said there was an urgent meeting. Can you watch Ben for like an hour?ScenesRachel: What-what about Monica?ScenesRoss: Oh, she isn’t home.ScenesRachel: (nervous) So it would just be, me alone?ScenesRoss: Well, Ben would be there.ScenesRachel: Huh umm…ScenesRoss: What’s the matter?ScenesRachel: Well that—y’know it’s just uh, I’ve never done that before. Me and him alone.ScenesRoss: Rach, he’s not an ex-con.ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay. Okay. Uh, what do I, what do I do with him?ScenesRoss: I don’t know! Just-just talk to him-entertain him and keep him alive.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: Okay. (Ben enters) Ben? Come here. All right, I’m gonna leave you here with Aunt Rachel for about an hour. Okay? Are you gonna be okay?ScenesRachel: Yeah I think so.ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) I wasn’t talking to you.ScenesBen: I’ll be okay.ScenesRoss: Okay, I’ll see you soon buddy. (He hugs and kisses him.) Be back in an hour.ScenesBen: Bye dad.ScenesRachel: Bye. (Ross exits.) Ahhh… (Silence) So this is fun, huh?ScenesBen: Not really.ScenesRachel: Okay. Uh, want something-want something to drink?ScenesBen: Okay.ScenesRachel: Uh great! How do you feel about Diet Coke?ScenesBen: I’m not allowed to have soda.ScenesRachel: Okay. Well that’s pretty much all that we have—Oh! Oh! Have you ever had a virgin margarita? (Holds up a bottle of margarita mix.)ScenesBen: What’s a virgin?ScenesRachel: Water it is.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica and Chandler are talking. Joey and Phoebe are getting coffee.]
rows.Content: Monica: What about the second minister we meet with? I kinda liked him.ScenesChandler: You mean the spitter?ScenesMonica: Come on! It wasn’t that bad!ScenesChandler: Easy for you to say; you’ll be wearing a veil.ScenesMonica: All right, what about the third guy?ScenesChandler: You mean the guy who kept staring at your chest?ScenesMonica: Can you blame him?ScenesChandler: Sorry, I just don’t like the idea of when I say, "I do," he’s thinking, "Yeah, I’d do her too!ScenesMonica: Well then we still have a problem.ScenesChandler: Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: (returning with Joey) With what?ScenesMonica: Well, we’re trying to find someone to perform our wedding and they’re all either boring or annoying or y’know, can’t stop staring at the ladies. (Points to her chest.)Scenes(Joey nods his approval.)ScenesPhoebe: Oo! You should have one of us do it!ScenesMonica: Phoebe, we’re getting married, married; not sixth grade married.ScenesPhoebe: No! No! It’s-it’s uh a real thing! Anyone can get ordained on the Internet and perform like weddings and stuff!ScenesMonica: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: Yes! A friend of mine did it and it’s totally legal!ScenesJoey: I call it!!ScenesPhoebe: What?! No! It was my idea!ScenesChandler: Guys thank you very much but neither of you is marrying us.ScenesJoey: Does calling it not mean anything anymore?!ScenesChandler: We are going to have a legitimate member of the clergy! And when I say legitimate I mean, gay and in control of his saliva!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel and Ben are sitting on the couch bored out of their minds.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ben y’know when uh, when you were a baby, you and I used to hang out all the time. ‘Cause I was, I was your daddy’s girlfriend.ScenesBen: But you’re not anymore!ScenesRachel: No, I’m not.ScenesBen: ‘Cause you guys were on a break.ScenesRachel: Hey! We were not on a—Okay. That’s fine! Fine. Y’know what Ben? One day when you are a lot older I am going to tell you that entire story over a pitcher of real margaritas, okay?ScenesBen: When’s my daddy coming back?ScenesRachel: (checks her watch) Fifty-two minutes. (Pause) So no-no brothers and sisters, huh? That must be nice. You don’t have to share stuff.ScenesBen: Sharing is good.ScenesRachel: Oh, you’re one of those. But y’know what? I have two sisters of my own and we just-just tortured each other.ScenesBen: Really? Like how?ScenesRachel: Well y’know, we would umm, repeat everything the other said, or uh, we’d jump out of closets to scare each other, or switch the sugar for the salt so they’d put salt on their cereal.ScenesBen: (laughs) That’s a good one.ScenesRachel: Yeah? You like that one?ScenesBen: Yeah, you’re funny.ScenesRachel: I’m funny? Oh thank God! Well hey, I’ve got a ton of these! Umm, oh hear—Do you want a good one? Here’s a good one. Umm, you uh, you take a quarter, take a quarter and, and you blacken the edge. Right? (Does so.) And then you say to person, I bet you can’t roll this quarter from your forehead to your chin without it leaving your face. And then when they do it, they’re left with a big black pencil line right down the center of their face.ScenesBen: Can I do it to you?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I-I-I-I’m funny Ben, but I’m not stupid. Okay?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica and Chandler are eating lunch as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: So, did you uh, find anyone to marry you guys yet?ScenesChandler: No, but Horny for Monica Minister called, wanting to know if we were still together.ScenesMonica: We’re never gonna find anybody.ScenesJoey: Well then let me do it!ScenesChandler: Joe…ScenesJoey: No-no-no! Look, I’ve been thinking about it. I’m an actor right? So I won’t get nervous talking in front of people.ScenesMonica: Joey look it’s really sweet…ScenesJoey: No-no-no-no look no! I won’t spit, and I won’t stare at Monica’s breasts! Y’know? Everyone knows I’m an ass man!ScenesMonica: That is true.ScenesJoey: Yeah and the most important thing is that it won’t be some like, stranger up there who barely knows you. It’ll be me! And I swear I’ll do a really good job. Plus, y’know I love you guys and-and it would really mean a lot to me.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Y’know, we haven’t found anybody else.ScenesMonica: It might be kinda cool.ScenesJoey: So I can do it?ScenesChandler: Yeah you can do it.ScenesJoey: All right!!! Okay!! All right! Okay-okay, I gotta get started on my speech! Oh, wait a minute, Internet ministers can still have sex right?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Okay.Scenes(Phoebe enters slowly.)ScenesMonica: Hey Pheebs, how’s it going?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I have a headache. A horrible headache!ScenesMonica: Oh, I’m sorry. Can I get you something?ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, you’ve got to stop chattering!ScenesMonica: Here, take a couple of these. (She gets up to grab a couple of pills.)ScenesPhoebe: What is it?ScenesMonica: It’s Hexadrin.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, I don’t believe in Western medicine. No, if you just apply pressure to these points right here. (She’s pinching the bit of skin between her right thumb and forefinger with her left hand.) Then your hand starts to hurt and you still have a headache, so thanks. (Takes the pills.)ScenesMonica: Okay, while we’re waiting for these pills to kick in, I’m gonna sit you down on the couch. Come on. (Phoebe gets up and goes with her.) Get some nice soft pillows under your head, I’m gonna turn the TV on and you can watch whatever you want. And I’m—Sit down—(She sits down on the couch)—gonna make you some tea. And then, I’m gonna rub your feet.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesJoey: Oh! My head! Oh! (He’s sitting on the chair, lies back, and puts his feet up for Monica to rub.) Oh!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is reading and there is knock on the door which she answers.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Coming.Scenes(She opens the door to reveal Ross with a pencil mark from his forehead to his chin.)ScenesRoss: I have a bone to pick with you.ScenesRachel: Uh-oh.ScenesRoss: Yes! Ben learned a little trick.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah? Did he pull the old… (She is waving her hand up and down her face. She’s thinking about the pencil mark.)ScenesRoss: That’s right! That’s right! Saran Wrap on the toilet seat so the pee goes everywhere!ScenesRachel: Oh that.ScenesRoss: Yeah that! You know I hate practical jokes! They’re mean and they’re stupid and-and I don’t want my son learning them!ScenesRachel: Oh, come on! Saran Wrap on the toilet seat, you don’t think that’s just a little funny?!ScenesRoss: I was barefoot. Now tell me, the toilet thing is the only thing you taught him right?ScenesRachel: (looking at his mark) Yes.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe, Chandler, and Monica are there.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: It’s amazing! My headache is completely gone! What are those pills called?ScenesMonica: Hexadrin. (She gets the box out of her purse.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I love you Hexadrin! (She kisses the box.) Oh look! It comes with a story! (She pulls out the instructions and side affects paper.)ScenesMonica: No Phoebe, those are like the side affects and stuff.ScenesPhoebe: Say what?ScenesMonica: Y’know, the possible side affects.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! (Starts reading them.) Dizziness, nervousness, drowsiness, facial swelling, nausea, headache—Headache. Vomiting, stomach bleeding, liver damage! Now okay, I don’t recall any of this coming up when you gave me these little death capsules! Oh I’m sorry, extra strength death capsules!ScenesMonica: Phoebe, relax none of that stuff ever happens! They just put it on there for legal reasons!ScenesPhoebe: Why?ScenesMonica: In case it happens.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Say hello to Reverend Joey Tribbiani! (Holds up the piece of paper bearing the proof of his ordination.)ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: You did it! You got ordained?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, I just got off the Internet! Man, there is a lot of porn out there!ScenesChandler: Our minister…ScenesPhoebe: I have liver damage. Ow! Oh! (She grabs the left side of her torso.)ScenesMonica: Phoebe, your liver is right here. (She points to the right side of her torso.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, then I must be disoriented.ScenesJoey: Anyway, I started working on what I’m going to say for the ceremony, do you wanna hear it?ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesJoey: Now-now, listen this is just a first draft so… (Starts to read the piece of paper he brought.) "We are gathered here today on this joyous occasion to celebrate the special love that Monica and Chandler share." (Monica and Chandler like it so far.) Eh? (He continues reading.) "It is a love based on giving and receiving. As well as having and sharing. And the love that they give and have is shared and received. And through this having and giving and sharing and receiving." (Phoebe nods her approval.) "We too can share and love and have and receive.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Should we call the spitter?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Carol and Susan’s, there is a knock on the door and Carol opens it to reveal Rachel.]
rows.Content: Carol: Hey Rachel! (The camera cuts to her face and we see that Ben pulled the quarter trick with her as well.)ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesCarol: What a nice surprise! What are you doing here?ScenesRachel: Well y’know I was just in the neighborhood and I passed by your building and I thought to myself, "What’s up with Carol and sweet, little Ben?ScenesCarol: Can I ask what—Come on in.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesCarol: Umm uh, I’ll make some coffee and we can uh, chat.ScenesRachel: I’d love that. I would loooove… (Carol goes to make the coffee and she sits down.) So uh, so where is sweet little Ben? I would love to have a little...ScenesBen: (jumping up from behind her chair) Gotcha!! (Rachel jumps up startled.)ScenesRachel: I found him! (To Ben) Very funny, come here! (She sits down on the coffee table and Ben walks up.) That is exactly why I’ve come here to talk to you okay?ScenesCarol: (from the kitchen) Rach, do you want some sugar in your coffee?ScenesRachel: Yes oh—(To Ben)—Do I want sugar in my coffee? (Ben nods no.) No, just some milk would be good Carol. Thanks. (To Ben) Okay, do you remember all that stuff I taught you yesterday?ScenesBen: (mimicking her) Remember all that stuff I taught you yesterday?ScenesRachel: Don’t do that.ScenesBen: Don’t do that.ScenesRachel: Seriously, your dad doesn’t like pranks.ScenesBen: Seriously, your dad doesn’t like pranks.ScenesRachel: Oh damnit!ScenesBen: Oh damnit!ScenesRachel: No! Don’t say that! Don’t say that!ScenesBen: Damnit!ScenesRachel: No don’t! Go back to repeating!ScenesBen: Damnit!ScenesRachel: Oh crap!ScenesBen: Oh crap!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler, and Monica are returning from Central Perk.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: I feel like my face is swelling. (To Monica) Is my face swelling?ScenesMonica: Phoebe, your face is fine! Come on, none of this stuff is going to happen to you! Stop being such a baby!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, interesting you should call me that! Now that I may never have one! (Holds up the warning label.)ScenesJoey: Okay you guys, I got a little more written. Are you ready?ScenesChandler: Yeah. O-okay.ScenesJoey: (reading) "When I think of the love that these two givers and receivers share, I can not help but envy the lifetime ahead of having and loving and giving and…" And then I can’t think of a good word for right here. (He points to the stop on the paper where he left off.)ScenesMonica: How about receiving?ScenesJoey: Yes!ScenesChandler: See Joe, not that that’s not grrreat! But, one of the cool things about having somebody we know perform the ceremony is that it can be about us! Y’know, it can be more personal. You can tell stories about us!ScenesJoey: Ooh, like the time you and I went to Atlantic City and I made you laugh so hard you threw up your whole steak?! Remember?ScenesChandler: No, not us… (Motions Joey and him.) Us! (Motions Monica and him.)ScenesMonica: I gotcha. Sorry. (To Monica) So, did you ever make him throw up a whole anything?ScenesPhoebe: Did you ever feed him a poison capsule that made him bleed from the eyes?ScenesMonica: It doesn’t say that!ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Suddenly somebody knows all about the side affects!ScenesChandler: See Joe, we want you to tell stories but y’know, romantic stories. Nice stories.ScenesJoey: Oh. Okay. Ooh! Ooh! Okay, maybe I’ll talk about London! Y’know when you two hooked up! Only, only I won’t say hooked up. I’ll say, "Began their beautiful journey…ScenesMonica: There you go!ScenesJoey: "…by doin’ it.ScenesChandler: Joe?ScenesJoey: Okay. All right. Umm, so uh, so how did it happen? Did your eyes meet across the room? And then the next thing y’know you’re in the bathtub together and she’s feeding you strawberries?ScenesChandler: Isn’t that what happened with you and the bride’s maid?ScenesJoey: Yeah!! I call that London style.ScenesMonica: No that is not what happened with us. Well, I was umm, I was really sad that night because this guy that I was Ross’s mom.ScenesJoey: Oh.ScenesMonica: And then Chandler was, was really sweet and he consoled me. And well we drank too much…ScenesJoey: Yeah baby!ScenesChandler: And I was a perfect gentleman and I walked her to her hotel room and said goodnight.ScenesJoey: Oh.ScenesChandler: But then later that night…ScenesJoey: Yeah baby!Scenes[Cut to London, Chandler’s hotel room. He is getting ready for bed by doing push-ups. One push-up. Just as he gets under the covers, there’s a knock on the door.]ScenesChandler: (answering the door) Hey!ScenesMonica: (standing outside) Cute PJ’s! You’re really livin’ it up here in London huh?ScenesChandler: Well I was… I was exactly expecting company after…(He looks at his watch.) 9:15.ScenesMonica: (entering) Is Joey here?ScenesChandler: Well, last time I saw him he was heading out the door with the bride’s maid and a bucket of strawberries. So uh, you’re not still upset about what that guy told ya are ya?ScenesMonica: Wouldn’t you be?ScenesChandler: Well, look it’s been a really emotional time y’know, and you’ve had a lot to drink. And you’ve just got to let that go okay? I mean you were the most beautiful in the room tonight!ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesChandler: You kidding? You’re the most beautiful woman in most rooms… (She jumps up and kisses him.) (Breaking the kiss.) Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What’s going on? You and I just made out! You and I are making out?ScenesMonica: Well, not anymore.ScenesChandler: But we don’t do that.ScenesMonica: I know, I just thought it would be fun.ScenesChandler: How drunk are you?ScenesMonica: Drunk enough to know that I want to do this. Not so drunk that you should feel guilty about taking advantage.ScenesChandler: (thinks) That’s the perfect amount!ScenesMonica: Okay!Scenes(They run to the bed, sit down, and start making out again.)ScenesMonica: (breaking the kiss) Y’know what’s weird?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: This doesn’t feel weird!ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesMonica: You’re a really good kisser.ScenesChandler: Well, I have kissed over four women. (They kiss again.) Do you wanna get under the covers?ScenesMonica: Hm-hmm!ScenesChandler: Okay!Scenes(They do so and they take off their clothes.)ScenesMonica: Wow! You are really fast!ScenesChandler: It bodes well for me that speed impresses you.ScenesMonica: We’re gonna see each other naked.ScenesChandler: Yep!ScenesMonica: Do you wanna do it at the same time?ScenesChandler: Count of three?ScenesMonica: One!ScenesChandler: Two!ScenesMonica: Two!ScenesMonica and Chandler: Three! (They lift up the covers and check each other out, then come back up with silly grins on their faces.)ScenesChandler: Well I think it’s safe to say that our friendship is effectively ruined.ScenesMonica: Eh, we weren’t that close anyway!ScenesChandler: Eh!Scenes(They start making out again, and it takes Joey trying to enter to stop them.)ScenesChandler: Joey! Joey! Joey! J-J-Joey-Joey-J-Joey! (Monica hides under the covers as Joey enters. Remember?)ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey Joe! I was just watching a movie-e-e… (Notices that the TV is turned off.)ScenesJoey: Oh, dude I’m so sorry!ScenesChandler: No! No! No!ScenesJoey: Hey no-no-no-no! It’s cool! It’s cool! I-I’ll only be a second, I’m still with my bride’s maid, I just—Where are those condoms you brought?ScenesChandler: They’re in my bag over there. (Points.)ScenesJoey: Ah. (Joey walks to Chandler’s bag by getting as far away from Chandler’s bed as possible.)ScenesChandler: Uh, could you leave me one?ScenesJoey: (pause) For just you?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Hey listen, why don’t you come downstairs with me? There’s some really nice girls down there.ScenesChandler: No I-I-I’m fine.ScenesJoey: All right, here you go buddy. (He tosses him one.) Go nuts. (Exits.)Scenes[Cut back to Monica and Chandler telling Phoebe and Joey the story.]ScenesJoey: That’s what that was?! ‘Cause that other thing? I thought you were on to something, but it did nothing for me.ScenesMonica: Okay, can we change the topic? Because it’s really doing nothing for me.ScenesJoey: Oh… (To Chandler) Can you imagine if I hadn’t left you that last one? You two might’ve never gotten together. Ooh-ooh! Could you imagine if I sent that hooker up to the room like I was gonna?! It’s like it was in the stars!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, it’s totally meant to be. (To Monica) Tell him who you originally wanted to hook up with that night.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesPhoebe: (To Joey) What?!ScenesChandler: Who did you originally want to hook up with?ScenesMonica: Okay, fine but please don’t be upset! Okay? I was really depressed okay? And really drunk! I just wanted something stupid and meaningless. I just wanted…just sex. So, when I…went to your room that night…I was actually looking…for Joey. (Joey smiles.)ScenesJoey: Yeah baby! (Chandler glares at him.) No baby!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, scene continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (To Monica) So you came to the room looking for Joey? Did you ever in-intend on telling me about this?ScenesMonica: No because it-it didn’t seem important.ScenesChandler: Oh, it’s not important? It’s not important?! If it wasn’t for a bride’s maid you’d be marrying him (Points to Joey) not me!ScenesMonica: Noo!! The point is that is was you that was there that night! It is you that I am marrying! It is you that I feel in love with!ScenesJoey: And it is a love that is based on having and giving and receiv—(Shuts up on Monica’s glare.)ScenesChandler: I don’t believe it. The most romantic night of my life and I’m runner up.ScenesMonica: Chandler, please! Do you know how unbelievably glad I am that Joey was not there that night?!ScenesJoey: Hey! (Monica turns and looks at him) Now I’m a man of the cloth, but I still have feelings!ScenesChandler: (To Joey) Look there is no way you’re doing this wedding now. Okay?ScenesJoey: What?! That’s not fair! It’s not my fault! I was off with my bride’s maid! And who’s to say I would’ve even said yes?! (To Monica) I mean I would’ve said yes. Chandler look y-y-you are making way to big a deal out of this, all right? Look, everything worked out okay!ScenesChandler: Okay, it’s just weird! Okay? I don’t want to be standing their saying my vows and then having the mental image of you and Monica! I-I-I need…I don’t know what I need. I need a walk.ScenesMonica: Wait Chandler come on, let’s—it’s not a big deal!ScenesChandler: It is to me. You wanted to sleep with Batman, and instead you had to settle for Robin. (Walks out and slams the door.)ScenesJoey: This is crazy.ScenesPhoebe: I know! Robin is so gay!

rows.Scenes: Carol and Susan’s, Rachel is talking with Ben.]
rows.Content: Rachel: So now what have we agreed?ScenesBen: No more pranks.ScenesRachel: And-and what else?ScenesBen: That you and daddy were not on a break.ScenesRachel: Very good.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Ross enters.)ScenesRoss: Rachel! What are you doing here?ScenesRachel: I’m just visiting my good friend Carol.ScenesRoss: Your good friend?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesRoss: What’s her last name?ScenesRachel: Carol…Lesbian?ScenesRoss: Nice. And by the way that uh, that line down my face?ScenesRachel: What line?ScenesRoss: Wh-wh-what line? The line that prompted a student in my last class of the day to say uh, (In a college frat boy voice) "Dude, don’t you ever was your face?ScenesRachel: All right, I’m sorry. I’m sorry I didn’t tell you but you were so mad already!ScenesRoss: Of course I was mad! I told you I-I hate this stuff! Okay? It-it’s not funny!ScenesCarol: (entering from the kitchen) Hey Ross!ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesCarol: What’s not funny?ScenesRoss: Practical jokes.ScenesCarol: Oh I…I think they’re funny.ScenesRoss: You have a line down your face.ScenesCarol: What? (Goes and checks.)ScenesRachel: Okay, maybe they are not funny to you…ScenesCarol: (yelling from the bathroom) Oh my God!ScenesRachel: Or Carol! But they’re funny to kids and who is it hurting?!ScenesRoss: Uh, y’know what? I’ll tell you who it hurts! It hurts the kid who has all his clothes stolen in gym class so he has to go to the principal’s office wearing nothing but a catcher’s mitt!ScenesRachel: That was you?! We heard about you in Junior High! Did you really just shake your fist in the air and shout, "I will be revenged?!ScenesRoss: I will be! Listen, I don’t want you teaching my son that stuff anymore. Okay?ScenesRachel: Fine. Fine, but I’ll have you know that once I taught him that stuff he called me Fun Aunt Rachel. And I loved being Fun Aunt Rachel but I’ll go back to being Boring and Uncomfortable Aunt Rachel if that’s what you want!ScenesRoss: No that’s not what I want. Uh, I’m glad you guys were bonding but I…ScenesRachel: Look he doesn’t have any brothers or sisters, somebody’s gonna have to teach him this stuff! And I haven’t taught him anything that a normal 6-year-old doesn’t know anyway!ScenesBen: (yelling from off camera) Crap!!ScenesRachel: I gotta go! (Runs out.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is sulking on the couch as Joey enters to talk with him.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey. Do you want this scone? (Holds up his plate) It came for me but it would probably rather sleep with you!ScenesJoey: Chandler, come on nothing even happened!ScenesChandler: Look Joe, I know you wanted to do the wedding…ScenesJoey: No-hey-no! If you don’t want me to do it, I except that. I don’t care about that. I just…I don’t want you to be upset.ScenesChandler: How can I not be upset? Okay? I finally fall in love with this fantastic woman and it turns out that she wanted you first!ScenesJoey: Yeah for like a half an hour one night! Chandler, she wants you for the rest of her life! You’re so lucky! Look what I missed out on by not being there! Although you know what? It could never have worked like you guys did, ‘cause you guys are perfect for each other. Y’know, we look at you and-and we see you together and it just…it-it fits. Y’know? And you just know it’s gonna last forever.ScenesChandler: That’s what you should say.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesChandler: When you’re marrying us; that’s what you should say.ScenesJoey: Really? I can do it?ScenesChandler: I’d love it if you would do it.ScenesJoey: Hey! (They hug.)ScenesChandler: But those are the words! Those exact words!ScenesJoey: Well I don’t know remember exactly but, it’s-it’s pretty much about having and giving and sharing and receiving.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is in the kitchen as Ross and Ben are entering.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey I’m sorry to do this to you again but uh, is there any way you can look after Ben for a little bit? I-I’ve got this meeting at school. And-and he-he asked for his uh, ‘Fun Aunt’ Rachel, so…ScenesRachel: Ohhh! Well of course I will watch him! We have fun, don’t we Ben? (He nods yes.)ScenesRoss: Okay, I’ll see you later pal.Scenes(Ross turns to leave.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, okay. (Ross has a sign on his back that reads ‘Poop.’) Wh—Ah-ha! (Ross stops and turns.) Wait a minute. Uh Ben, I can’t do it.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I can’t let him go out that way, he’s got a meeting. (To Ross) You’ve got something here on your back.ScenesRoss: What? (She takes the sign off and hands it to him.) That’s great. That is great. (Crumples up the paper and throws it down in anger.) What did we just finish talking about Ben?!ScenesRachel: Oh I…ScenesBen: What did we just finish talking about Ben?!ScenesRoss: All right, that’s it! (He runs over to Ben, but he runs past him and out the door.) Come—you—no! You are in big trouble young man!ScenesRachel: No! Wait! Come on!Scenes[Cut to the hallway, Ben runs upstairs with Ross in pursuit.]ScenesRoss: Wait! No! Ben, come here! I am not kidding!ScenesRachel: No you guys… (She walks out into the hallway.)ScenesRoss: I-I-am—(Suddenly Ross starts screaming and comes falling down the stairs landing just in front of Rachel.)ScenesRachel: EHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!! My God!!!!!!!!!!! Oh my God!!!!!!! (She runs over to him and finds that it was a dummy and that she had been had.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are entering. Phoebe and Joey are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey-hey.ScenesJoey: So are guys doing okay?ScenesChandler: Yeah, we talked and Monica made me see that I over reacted a little bit and some things in life are more important.ScenesMonica: Yeah baby! (Phoebe and Joey nod.)ScenesPhoebe: I’m really glad you guys are okay but, I just keep thinking what would happen if-if you two (Points to Monica and Joey) actually had hooked up.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Joey’s, Monica is cooking.]
rows.Content: Monica: Honey! Dinner’s ready!Scenes(Joey, whose new diet is working out great, he looks like he only weighs 375 down from 420 enters from the bedroom.)ScenesFat Joey: What’s my little chef got for me tonight?ScenesMonica: Your favorite!ScenesJoey: Ho-ho-ho, (pausing for a rest next to the fridge) fried stuff with cheese!ScenesMonica: Yep! And lot’s of it!ScenesFat Joey: Thanks sweetheart. Give me a little sugar here. (They kiss.) Okay.Scenes(Joey sits down.)ScenesMonica: Okay, in we go.Scenes(Monica gets behind him and in combination with his sliding the chair forward and her pushing with her leg manages to get up to the table.)ScenesFat Joey: Here we go! Here we go! Here we go! (Groans and picks up a piece of food.) How you doin’?ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is getting Phoebe some coffee.]
rows.Content: Joey: Here you go.ScenesPhoebe: (still reading the label) Oh my God! This is a six-hour pill! (Checks her watch) That’s it! I’m out of the woods! Ohh! What a relief!ScenesJoey: Good for you!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it’s like huge weight has been lifted! ‘Cause look, (reads the side affects) no hair loss, not a rash, no hives, I’m just so happy! Because no shortness of breath, no temporary euphoria—Oh.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Cheap Wedding DressScenesTeleplay by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesStory by: Brian Buckner & Sebastian JonesScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica, Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey are there. Monica is holding a piece of paper.]
rows.Content: Monica: So the wedding caterer sent me this list of twelve appetizers and I have to narrow it down to six.ScenesJoey: Food? Uh-huh gimme! (She hands him the paper.)ScenesChandler: So did Monica tell you about this great band called the Swing Kings that we’re trying to get to play at the wedding?ScenesPhoebe: Since when are you into swing music?ScenesChandler: Oh since forever! I used to go all over town listening to bands!ScenesMonica: Chandler.ScenesChandler: Gap commercial. (To Monica) So did you book them? Did you call?ScenesMonica: I will.ScenesChandler: Do you want me to call?ScenesMonica: No, I’ll do it. You just stick to your job.ScenesPhoebe: What is your job?ScenesChandler: Staying out of the way.ScenesJoey: This is impossible Monica, why don’t you just pick all 15? (Hands back the paper.)ScenesMonica: There were only twelve.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, I added three.ScenesMonica: What are peanut butter fingers?!ScenesJoey: Oh yeah… (He mimes sticking his fingers into a jar of peanut butter, scooping some out, and eating it off his fingers.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: A Street, Chandler and Ross are at a newsstand.]
rows.Content: Ross: (noticing a beautiful woman moving in down the street) Well hello! She’s cute! Should we uh, go try to talk to her?ScenesChandler: Sure! That’s one of the great things about being engaged. I’m not nervous talking to pretty girls anymore.ScenesThe Woman: Could you guys help me? (Chandler shyly exhales and looks away.)ScenesRoss: Uh yeah! Let me, let me get that for you.ScenesThe Woman: It-it’s really heavy.ScenesRoss: (exhales) I got it. (He lifts the box and grunts under the strain.) (Calmly) So hi, I’m uh, I’m Ross and this is my friend Chandler. (He shyly waves.)ScenesThe Woman: I-I am Kristen.ScenesRoss: Kristen, hi. Are you uh, new to the area, ‘cause if you are…I’d love to show you around sometime.ScenesKristen: I…I uh, actually just moved from four blocks over.ScenesRoss: Ah.ScenesKristen: But-but this block is like a whole other world.ScenesRoss: Y’know actually it does have a very interesting history. Uh, this street is the first street in the city to have an underground sewer system. (Kristen crinkles her nose at that.) Before that sewage and waste would just flow right down the street. Yeah, sometimes ankle deep! (He stops when he realizes what he’s talking about.)ScenesChandler: (To Ross) Smooth.ScenesKristen: (To Chandler) Excuse me? (Chandler does the shy thing again.)ScenesRoss: Umm, say you’re gonna be starving after all this moving. What do you say I take you to dinner tonight?ScenesKristen: Oh I’d like that.ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesKristen: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Great! Uh, let me take this up for you. (The box he’s holding.)ScenesKristen: After you.ScenesRoss: Oh no-no, after you. (She grabs a chair and heads upstairs.) (When she’s gone.) Oh my God! (He drops the box and Chandler can’t pick it up.)

rows.Scenes: A Bridal Shop, Phoebe and Rachel are waiting for Monica who is trying on her wedding dress.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (wearing a veil) Am I crazy or does this totally go?!Scenes(Monica enters from the dressing room wearing her gown.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God! You look so beautiful!ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel) Thank you Rachel but, look at Monica!ScenesMonica: This is it. Yeah, this is the one. I can’t believe I found it!Scenes(Another woman walks up.)ScenesThe Woman: Wow you look so beautiful! If I knew you, I’d cry.ScenesMonica: Well I’m Monica Geller, ball like a baby.ScenesThe Woman: I’m Megan Bailey.ScenesMonica: Have you found your dress yet?ScenesMegan: Oh no, these dresses are all so amazing but there is no way I could afford one.ScenesMonica: No, I can’t afford this either. No. I-I-I’m, I’m just to figure out which one I want then I’m gonna get it at Kleinman’s, this discount place in Brooklyn, day after tomorrow they are having a huge sale.ScenesMegan: Oh, thanks for the tip.ScenesMonica: Yeah! So-so when are you getting married?ScenesMegan: Oh I’m not, I just like to try these on.ScenesRachel: I do the same thing.ScenesMegan: I’m just kidding. I’m getting married July 25th.ScenesRachel: I’m just kidding too. (Laughs) I’m getting married in December. (Turns away not happy with herself.)ScenesMegan: (To Monica) So when are you getting married?ScenesMonica: Oh May 15th.ScenesMegan: Oooh it’s getting close!ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesMegan: So uh, who’s your photographer?ScenesMonica: Jeffery.ScenesMegan: We met with him. Did he show you the photos of the nude wedding he did?ScenesMonica: The best man? Wow!ScenesMegan: I know! I almost called off my wedding. Oh, who’s your band?!ScenesMonica: Oh, my fiancee wants the Swing Kings.ScenesMegan: Oh, you’re so lucky. My fiancee wants the heavy metal band Carcass.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, is that spelled with a ‘C’ or a ‘K’? Oh my God! It doesn’t matter; they’re both great!Scenes(Another woman walks past Rachel carrying a wedding dress.)ScenesRachel: Oh y’know what? Y’know what? Now that you know what you want you should go to Kleinman’s and get it half off. This place is so overpriced.ScenesThe Woman: I own this store.ScenesRachel: So, does this (The dress) come in another color or… (The store owner walks away.)

rows.Scenes: A Street, Joey is walking by Kristen who is still moving in.]
rows.Content: Joey: (checking her out) Hi! You uh, movin’ in or movin’ out?ScenesKristen: I’m moving in.ScenesJoey: Oh uh, can I give you a hand?ScenesKristen: Oh okay. But y’know what? Be careful. Because a guy was helping me before had to leave because he hurt his back.ScenesJoey: Boyfriend?ScenesKristen: No.ScenesJoey: I’m Joey. (They shake hands.)ScenesKristen: Kristen.ScenesJoey: Oh wow, what a beautiful name! (Pause) What is it again?ScenesKristen: Kristen.ScenesJoey: Got it! (He picks up a lamp.) So…ScenesKristen: So uh, do you live around here?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah! Right down there. (Points.) Hey listen; let me give you a little tip. Do not take a nap on this stoop (Points to hers) or you can wake up with your shoes gone.ScenesKristen: I’ll remember that.ScenesJoey: Okay. Yeah. Listen would you uh, would you like to have dinner with me tonight?ScenesKristen: Oh I, I have plans tonight.ScenesJoey: Oh.ScenesKristen: But how about tomorrow?ScenesJoey: Sounds great! Okay all right, well where does this go? (The lamp he’s holding.)ScenesKristen: You look strong, why don’t I take that and you grab one of the boxes.ScenesJoey: Okay. Yeah. (She leaves and he goes to pick up a box marked books, but decides to take the box marked pillows instead.) Yeah, I’ll grab this one. (He follows her upstairs.)

rows.Scenes: Kleinman’s, a horde of women including Rachel, Phoebe, and Monica are waiting for the store to open.]
rows.Content: A Woman: What is taking so long?! I mean whatever!ScenesRachel: (To Phoebe) So this is Brooklyn.ScenesMonica: All right, listen up. There is usually only one dress in each size so when they open those doors, fan out. Now, this is what you’re looking for! (Holds up a picture of it.) Memorize it! When you locate the dress, blow on these. All right? (She passes out whistles to them.) Three short blasts, when you hear it. Come running.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Got it.ScenesMonica: All right.Scenes(A worker comes to open the door and the horde starts to press forward.)ScenesA Woman: Here he comes! Hurry!ScenesRachel: Oh they’re pushing! They’re pushing!!ScenesMonica: (To Rachel) Hey! Don’t be a baby!ScenesRachel: Well I…Scenes(The door opens allowing the horde to charge in, knocking Rachel out of the way and to the ground.)ScenesA Woman: Let’s go!!ScenesPhoebe: (coming back out) Hey! Rachel! Come on!!!!Scenes[Time lapse, inside the store, Monica is frantically looking for her dress.]ScenesMonica: No. No. Not it. Not it. Not it. (Checks another rack and another woman tries to reach around her.) (To the woman) Don’t crowd me! (Finds it) This is it! This is the dress! Oh my God, it’s perfect! (She takes it off of the rack and someone has a hold of it on the other side of the rack and tugs on it.) I’m sorry, this one’s taken! (The other woman tugs harder pulling Monica through the rack.) Whoa!ScenesMonica: Megan!ScenesMegan: Monica!ScenesMonica: You came?!ScenesMegan: Yeah!ScenesMonica: This is my dress!ScenesMegan: No!ScenesMonica: Yes it is! You saw me wearing it!ScenesMegan: And now you’ll see me buying it.ScenesMonica: What? You freak! You wouldn’t even have known about this place if it wasn’t for me!ScenesMegan: Look, you don’t want to fight me.ScenesMonica: Maybe I do! I’m pretty feisty! (She blows the signal.)Scenes[Cut to Phoebe in another part of the store.]ScenesPhoebe: (hearing the signal) I’m coming! I’m coming! (She takes off towards the signal and almost knocks another woman over.)ScenesWoman: Hey!Scenes(She hears another signal in another direction.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay! (Runs that way and hears another whistle blast.) Hey! (Heads the other way and hears another blast.) What do I do?!! (She runs in the second direction and finds that the whistling is coming from inside a rack. She moves the dresses out of the way to find Rachel curled up in a fetal position frantically blowing on the whistle.) What are you doing? (Rachel doesn’t stop.) Did you find the dress? (Rachel won’t stop so Phoebe pinches her nose shut which causes her to spit the whistle out.)ScenesPhoebe: Did you find the dress?ScenesRachel: No! You gotta get me out of here Phoebe! These bargain shoppers are crazy!ScenesPhoebe: I—We gotta get Monica. (She starts to leave.)ScenesRachel: No! You gotta hold my hand!!ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!! (She grabs Rachel’s hand and drags her towards Monica.) Excuse me! Excuse me! (She’s knocking women and veils out of the way as she moves.)Scenes(She gets to Monica who has the dress balled up in one hand and is sitting on Megan who is sprawled out on the floor.)ScenesMonica: (handing Phoebe the dress) Go! Go! Go!ScenesRachel: (seeing who’s trapped) Hey…ScenesMonica: NOW!!!!!!!! (Rachel runs off and Monica gets up to follow her.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: So Ross, how was your date the other night? Did you tell her about the magical ride that starts with the flush of every toilet?ScenesRoss: Laugh all you want but uh, she actually left me a message saying she’d like to go out again.ScenesChandler: Huh.ScenesRoss: Yeah in fact, I’m gonna go call her right now. And I’ll make sure to tell her my friend Chandler says… (He mimics the shy reaction Chandler did.)ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey Chandler!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Listen, sorry I didn’t stop by last night but I had a date.ScenesChandler: Uh Joe, when it’s one o’clock in the morning and you don’t come by? That’s okay!ScenesJoey: Well check it out, I was with this really hot girl who just moved in right across the street!ScenesChandler: Really? Right across the street?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesChandler: When’d you meet her?ScenesJoey: Two days ago.ScenesChandler: Excellent! Y’know Ross met somebody too!ScenesJoey: Oh yeah?ScenesRoss: (returning) Hey.ScenesChandler: Hi! How’d it go?ScenesRoss: Oh great! We’re going out again Saturday. But I just found she’s also seeing some other guy.ScenesChandler: (sarcastically shocked) Really?! Joe? What would you do if you were in Ross’s situation?ScenesJoey: Well, I sorta am. I mean yeah, I’m dating this girl who’s also seeing another guy. But, I don’t know, I’m not to worried about it.ScenesRoss: Well you shouldn’t be. Believe me I wouldn’t want to be the guy who’s up against you. (Chandler laughs.) I mean that doofus is going to lose!ScenesChandler: So this is nice! I wish I didn’t have to go, believe me! But unfortunately I have to. (He gets up and Joey moves over next to Ross.) Oh uh, by the way, what’s the name the girl you’re dating?ScenesJoey and Ross: Kristen Lang.ScenesChandler: Bye! (Exits.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, time lapse from the earlier scene.]
rows.Content: Ross: Well obviously only one of us can keep dating her.ScenesJoey: Obviously! So, how do we decide?ScenesRoss: Well now let’s-let’s look at this objectively, I think I should date her…ScenesJoey: (not buying it) Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Or, or I’m the one who dates her.ScenesRoss: That’s interesting, but check this out. I date her…ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah I like that but just to go in another direction…ScenesRoss: Okay, okay. This can go on for a while.ScenesJoey: Yeah well we should order some food then.ScenesRoss: No Joey! Look why don’t, why don’t we just let her decide? Okay? Hey-hey, we’ll each go out with her one more time. And-and we’ll see who she likes best.ScenesJoey: (smiling) That sounds fair.ScenesRoss: Maybe I’ll take her to that new French restaurant down the street…ScenesJoey: Ah yeah—wait a second now! Look we’re gonna have to set a spending limit on the date. I don’t have the money to take her to a fancy place like that.ScenesRoss: Well sorry, that’s what I do on dates.ScenesJoey: All right, well I guess I’ll just have to do what I do on dates.ScenesRoss: So let’s decide on the spending limit…ScenesJoey: Yeah. Uh, (thinks)…a slice…(Thinks)…six dollars?ScenesRoss: I was thinking more like a hundred.ScenesJoey: Okay. Can I borrow 94 dollars?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are admiring Monica’s wedding dress.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh…ScenesPhoebe: I know. Hand me a tissue. (Monica hands her one.)Scenes(Rachel goes to the fridge, opens it, and blows on the whistle Monica gave her at the store, which causes Phoebe and Monica to turn around and look at her.)ScenesRachel: You’re out of Diet Coke.Scenes(The phone rings and Monica answers it as Rachel goes into the bathroom.)ScenesMonica: Hello? (Listens) What?! (Listens) You what?! (Listens) Hey you listen here missy! (Listens) Wh—(She is hung up on.)ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesMonica: That was that girl Megan! She booked the Swing Kings on the day of our wedding and said that I couldn’t have them back unless I gave her the dress!ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) Does that mean Carcass is available?ScenesMonica: What am I gonna do?! That is the dress! That is the dress! Wh…Chandler wants the band. What do I do?ScenesPhoebe: Well just figure out a way to talk him out of it.ScenesMonica: How?Scenes(There are three short whistle blasts from the bathroom.)ScenesRachel: You’re out of toilet paper!

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross is getting ready for his date with Kristen.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey! What’s up?ScenesJoey: I just wanted to come by and y’know, wish you good luck on your date.ScenesRoss: Oh thanks!ScenesJoey: Yeah. What time are you meeting her?ScenesRoss: We have 8:00 reservations at Grammercy Bistero.ScenesJoey: Wow, that’s in like 20 minutes. You’d better get dressed.ScenesRoss: I am dressed.ScenesJoey: Oh. Well good! (To himself) For me. (He picks up a jar of lotion.) What is this? Did you give yourself a facial?ScenesRoss: I have an oily T-zone!ScenesJoey: Okay dude! (Finds a receit.) Hey you uh, you sent Kristen flowers.ScenesRoss: That’s right.ScenesJoey: You spent a hundred dollars. That’s the limit. You’re screwed!ScenesRoss: Uh actually, I sent the flowers before the actual date. So techincally, technically I didn’t break any rules. Thanks for stopping by though.ScenesJoey: Oh-oh! So that’s the way it’s gonna be huh? Yeah I can break the rules too y’know!ScenesRoss: Oh yeah? What are you gonna do?ScenesJoey: I don’t know.ScenesRoss: Why am I not surprised?ScenesJoey: Y’know what Ross? I’m not gonna let you get away with this!ScenesRoss: I don’t think you have much choice.ScenesJoey: Well we’ll see!ScenesRoss: Bye-bye!ScenesJoey: Yeah bye-bye! (Exits and comes back in still holding the lotion.) Hey! So just a light layer?ScenesRoss: Yes. Yes. Just here (Runs his fingers down the bridge of his nose) and there (Runs his fingers across his forehead).

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is entering without touching anything with his hands. Phoebe, Monica, and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Joey got meat sauce on the banister again! (He goes into the bathroom to wash his hands.)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, swing music is so out.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, he’s gotta be in the room for that to work.ScenesChandler: (returning) What are you guys talking about?ScenesMonica: Well umm, we were just talking about the y’know, the Swing Kings and just wondering whether y’know, they were the right way to go.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I went to a wedding once where they had swing music and uh, two months later the couple got divorced. And now I’m not saying that there’s any connection here y’know, but they did tell me that’s why they got divorced.ScenesChandler: But I love swing music!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah but the Swing Kings? Y’know they suck so much that people actually die at their concerts—They just stop living.ScenesChandler: Look all I know is when Monica and I went to see them, we had fun! And there’s another reason too.ScenesRachel: Well, what is the other reason?ScenesChandler: I don’t want to say.ScenesRachel: Well you have to because maybe it’s stupid.ScenesChandler: Well it’s just while Monica and I were dancing to them it was…the first time I knew that…you were the woman I wanted to dance all my dances with.ScenesMonica: Oh crap!

rows.Scenes: Grammercy Bistero, Ross and Kristen are waiting for their table to be ready. Ross is returning from talking to the matire’d.]
rows.Content: Ross: So they said our table will be ready in just a few minutes.ScenesKristen: Oh great!ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesKristen: Is your back feeling better?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah it’s fine. I guess the more muscles you have the more they can spasim out of control.ScenesJoey: (entering) Kristen?ScenesKristen: Joey!ScenesJoey: Hi!ScenesKristen: Hi! What are you doing here?ScenesJoey: Oh I like this place. And technically, technically I’m not breaking any rules so I…ScenesKristen: Well uh, Ross? This is Joey. Joey? Ross.ScenesJoey: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hi. (They shake hands.) It’s nice to meet you. I used to have a friend named Joey. I don’t anymore.ScenesKristen: Our table will be ready in a couple minutes.ScenesRoss: Yeah. So…ScenesJoey: Sure! I would love to wait with you guys! Thanks! (Sits down.)ScenesRoss: So Joey umm, you look familiar. Are uh, are you on TV or something?ScenesKristen: Well Joey doesn’t like to talk about it but, he’s one of the stars of Days Of Our Lives.ScenesRoss: That’s right! That’s right, don’t you play a woman?ScenesJoey: A woman in a man’s body.ScenesRoss: Much better.ScenesJoey: So y’know Ross it’s funny ‘cause, you look familiar to me too. Have you ever been married?ScenesRoss: Well yes, yes I have. In fact umm, just the other day Kristen and I were talking about how I’ve been married and how I have a son.ScenesKristen: Yeah, little Eric.ScenesRoss: That’s right! Wait no, Ben.ScenesJoey: So you’ve just married the one time then?ScenesRoss: Well umm…ScenesKristen: You’ve been married twice?ScenesRoss: Yes. And another time after that. Boy I’m getting hungry! Hey Joey, have you ever been so hungry on a date that when a girl goes to the bathroom you eat some of her food?ScenesKristen: You said the waiter ate my crab cake.ScenesJoey: (laughs that one off) Yeah. So uh Ross, well now—why did that first marriage breakup? Was it because the woman was straight or she was a lesbian?ScenesKristen: Do you two know each other?ScenesJoey and Ross: No. No.ScenesJoey: No. It just seems like Ross is the kind of a guy that would marry a woman on the verge of being a lesbian and then push her over the edge.Scenes(Kristen is not enjoying this.)ScenesRoss: Wait a minute! Were you on a poster for gonorrhea?ScenesJoey: Have you ever slept in the same bed as a monkey?!ScenesRoss: Hey you leave Marcel out of this!ScenesJoey: Fine! Have you ever got stuck in a pair of your own leather pants?!ScenesRoss: Hey-hey have you ever locked yourself in a TV cabinet VD boy?!ScenesJoey: Monkey lover!Scenes(They both notice that Kristen has left.)ScenesJoey: When do you think we lost her?ScenesRoss: Probably around gonorrhea.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is entering.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi, honey! I’m home!ScenesMonica: (from the bedroom) Don’t come in here!ScenesChandler: Why? Do you another boyfriend in there or something?ScenesMonica: No! We only mess around at his place!ScenesChandler: Y’know it’s funny I started it but, now it’s scary me. So could you come out here please?ScenesMonica: No, I’m wearing a wedding dress.ScenesChandler: Oh you got a wedding dress? That’s great!ScenesMonica: Yeah but I’m not keeping it.ScenesChandler: Well then why can’t I see it?ScenesMonica: Oh. I guess you can. Okay but; I-I have to return it, so you can’t like it.ScenesChandler: Okay I promise. I’ll-I’ll hate it. (She enters.) Wow! You-you look…hideous.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesChandler: Yeah, that’s like the most ugliest dress I’ve ever seen. Wh-why do you to return it?ScenesMonica: Oh because it doesn’t…really fit. Oh by the way, I-I booked the Swing Kings.ScenesChandler: Oh that’s great! Great! Thanks! But that dress I mean it’s like yuck! It’s terrible! It makes me wanna just rip it right off of you!ScenesMonica: Okay! But you can’t rip it. Well, maybe a little.ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are watching a basketball game on the couch.]
rows.Content: Monica: (entering) Hey guys! Do you wanna look at the song list for the wedding? (They ignore her.) Guys?ScenesChandler: (without turning around) I thought you were gonna be gone all day.ScenesMonica: All right? What’s going on?Scenes(They all slowly turn around to reveal that they are giving themselves a facial.)ScenesMonica: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I-I should probably leave you girls alone. (She heads for the bedroom.)ScenesRoss: Yeah, laugh all you want but in ten minutes we’re gonna have younger looking skin!ScenesJoey: Yeah! (Monica goes in the bedroom.) Y’know, she could use a little…(Whistles that she needs to do what they’re doing.) (Something happens on the game.) Oh nice shot!!! (They all cheer.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With Joey’s AwardScenesTeleplay by: Brian BoyleScenesStory by: Sherry Bilsing & Ellen PlummerScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Monica are there as Joey is entering excitedly.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! You guys! You’re not gonna believe this! I just got off the phone with my agent…ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! (Joey looks at her.) I’m sorry, too soon. You go.ScenesJoey: Okay. I got nominated for my part on Days of Our Lives!ScenesMonica: Joey!ScenesPhoebe: Good for you!ScenesMonica: Congratulations! Wow! I can’t believe you’re nominated for an Emmy!ScenesJoey: No-no.ScenesMonica: Oh Soap Opera Digest award!ScenesJoey: No! I’m up for a Soapie!ScenesMonica: Honey? Is that something you’re making up?ScenesJoey: No, no, no! It’s real! And it has been since 1998. (Rachel returns from the bathroom.) Hey Rach! Rach! I’m up for a Soapie!ScenesRachel: (gasps) Oh my God! Oh my God!! That is like the third most prestigious soap opera award there is!ScenesJoey: Thank you! Well, I guess now I know who I’m taking to the awards. (Points to Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Oh, stop that! Don’t kid about that! (Gasps) Will all the stars be there?ScenesJoey: Many are scheduled to appear.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Oh my God! I can’t go! I’m gonna be too nervous!ScenesMonica: (to Joey) Okay, I’ll go!ScenesRachel: No!! You are getting married! This is all I have.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: N.Y.U, Ross is giving a lecture.]
rows.Content: Ross: …and it was Ernst Muhlbrat who first hypothesized that the Velociraptor would expand it’s collar and emit a high pitched noise to frighten it’s predator. (A student raises his hand.) Yes Mr. Lewis?ScenesLewis: What kinda noise?ScenesRoss: Just a high pitched intimidating noise.ScenesLewis: But like how?ScenesRoss: Well we-we don’t know for sure. But in my head it-it sounded something like this. (He makes a high pitched noise and Alan doesn’t know what to make of it.) Of course, this is just conjecture. Okay, that’s uh, that’s all for today. (Everyone starts to get up.) Uh Mr. Morse, can I see you for a moment?ScenesMorse: Yes sir.ScenesRoss: Mr. Morse I need to talk to you about your mid-term exam, I’m afraid I-I had to fail you.ScenesMorse: (shocked) Why?!ScenesRoss: Well you need 60% to pass…ScenesMorse: What’d I get?ScenesRoss: Seven.ScenesMorse: That’s not so good.ScenesRoss: No-no it’s not. What-what happened there Ned?ScenesMorse: Well maybe you can cut me some slack. I’m sort of in love.ScenesRoss: Well I’m sorry but, that-that’s really not my problem.ScenesMorse: I’m in love with you.ScenesRoss: Well that brings me in the loop a little.ScenesMorse: You see, that’s why I did so bad on this test. I’m having a hard time concentrating. When you’re up there (Points to the podium) and you’re teaching and your face gets all serious…you look so good. (In a sexy voice) You wear that tight little turtleneck sweater…ScenesRoss: Okay! (Walks away from him.) Umm, I uh, I’m your teacher. I’m sorry, you’re-you’re a student and I-and I like women. In spite of what may be written on the backs of some of these chairs.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica and Phoebe are drinking coffee and Phoebe notices a cute guy checking them out.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh my God! That guy at the counter is totally checking you out!ScenesMonica: Really? (Looks.) My God, he’s really cute.ScenesPhoebe: Go for it.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, I’m engaged!ScenesPhoebe: I’m just saying, get his number just in case. But no Chandler is in an accident and can’t perform sexually and he would want you to take a lover to satisfy the needs that he can no longer fulfill.ScenesThe Cute Guy: (To Monica) Hi!ScenesMonica: Op, can I just tell you something? Very flattered but umm, I’m engaged. (Points to her ring.)ScenesThe Cute Guy: Wow! Uh, this is kind of embarrassing. I was actually coming over to talk to your friend.ScenesMonica: Well you should be embarrassed. (Leaves.)ScenesThe Cute Guy: (To Phoebe) I thought you knew I was looking at you.ScenesPhoebe: I did, but that was really fun.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is sitting in the chair.]
rows.Content: Joey: (pretending to be an announcer) And the winner is…Joey Tribbiani! (He then gets excited and goes over to the counter to practice his acceptance speech using a bottle of maple syrup as the award.) Oh… Wow! I honestly never expected this. I uh, I didn’t prepare a speech. But umm, I’d like to thank (Rachel enters quietly) my parents, who’ve always been there for me. I’d also like to thank my friends, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, Rachel…ScenesRachel: I’m fourth! (Joey is startled.) Look at you with your little maple syrup award!ScenesJoey: Yeah may-maybe you don’t tell anyone about this.ScenesRachel: What? No! It’s not a big deal! I do that too, with my shampoo bottle.ScenesJoey: Really?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesJoey: What award are you practicing for?ScenesRachel: Grammy, Best New Artist.ScenesJoey: Oh, hey listen! The Soapie’s called today and I also get to present an award.ScenesRachel: Ohh that’s great!ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesRachel: So you’ll definitely get onstage, even if you don’t win.ScenesJoey: (confused) What you-you don’t think I’m gonna win?ScenesRachel: Well of course I do! But y’know, favorite returning character is a tough category Joey. I mean you’re up against the guy who survived his own cremation.ScenesJoey: Yeah. No-no I-I know I might not win, but it’s just…I’ve never even been nominated before! I want it so much.ScenesRachel: Well Joey, you’ll probably get it. But you should probably your-your gracious loser face. Y’know when like the cameras are on you and you wanna look disappointed but also that your colleague deserved to win. Y’know? So it’s sorta like… (Does it, you’ll have to see it.)ScenesJoey: Hey! (Likes it.)ScenesRachel: Y’know?ScenesJoey: You practice losing the Grammies too?ScenesRachel: Oh no, at the Grammies I always win.ScenesJoey: Ah.

rows.Scenes: Monica’s Restaurant Kitchen, she’s cooking as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh hey!ScenesMonica: Hey! How’d your date go with Jake?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, great! We couldn’t keep our eyes off each other all night and then every once and a while y’know, he’d kinda lean over and stroke my hair and touch my neck. (Does that to Monica.)ScenesMonica: Okay, stop it Phoebe, you’re getting me all tingly.ScenesPhoebe: (laughs) All I could think of was y’know, "Is he gonna kiss me? Is he gonna kiss me?ScenesMonica: And did he?ScenesPhoebe: I’m a lady Monica, I don’t kiss and tell. But this hickey speaks for itself. (She starts to open up her blouse.)ScenesMonica: Okay-okay, I got it. I got it.ScenesPhoebe: I just like him so much that I just feel like I’ve had 10 drinks today and I’ve only had six.ScenesMonica: Oh, I haven’t had that feeling since I first started going out with Chandler. Wow, I’m never gonna have that feeling again am I?ScenesPhoebe: You sound like a guy.ScenesMonica: No, a guy would be saying, "I’m never gonna get to sleep with anyone else." Oh my God! I’m never gonna get to sleep with anyone else! I’ve been so busy planning the wedding that I forgot about all the things that I’d be giving up! I mean, I…I’m never gonna have a first kiss again.ScenesPhoebe: You’ll have a last kiss.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Ross is helping Joey with his tie.]
rows.Content: Ross: Can I ask you something? Have you ever had a guy have a crush on you?ScenesJoey: Is that why you wanted to tie my tie?ScenesRoss: There’s this kid in my class who said he’s in love with me.ScenesJoey: Whoa!ScenesRachel: (entering from her room) Whoa what?ScenesJoey: Ross has a boyfriend.ScenesRoss: I do-I do not have a boyfriend. There’s a guy in one of my classes who-who has a crush on me.ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesRoss: Yeah! I don’t know. I mean, last year Elizabeth now-now this kid. What-what-what-what is it?! Am I giving out some kind of…sexy professor vibe? (Rachel and Joey both look at him.)ScenesRachel: Not right now.ScenesRoss: It-it—The point is my natural charisma has made him fail his midterm.ScenesRachel: Oh, see now I feel bad for the kid! I had a crush on a teacher once and it was so hard! Y’know you—I couldn’t concentrate and I blushed every time he looked at me. I mean come on, you remember what’s it’s like to be 19 and in love.ScenesRoss: Yeah. I guess I can cut him some slack.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesJoey: How’d you get over that teacher?ScenesRachel: I didn’t. I got under him.ScenesJoey: (To Ross) Problem solved.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is saying good-bye to her boyfriend Jake at the door to Central Perk.]
rows.Content: Jake: Bye Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Okay bye. (They kiss.)ScenesJake: All right. Bye. (Backs out the door.)ScenesPhoebe: Bye! (Phoebe goes over and joins Monica on the couch.) We said good-bye at the door so as not to flaunt our new love.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, it’s okay. You don’t have to tip toe around me. I-I’ve been thinking about it and umm, y’know what? I’m okay about not having that new relationship feeling…ScenesJake: (yelling through the window to Phoebe) I miss you already!!ScenesPhoebe: (yelling back) I miss you too!!!! (He walks away.)ScenesMonica: See? That’s what I mean. I mean that, that’s great! But I wouldn’t trade in what I have for that. I mean I’m gonna be with Chandler for the rest of my life, and that’s what makes me happy. (Chandler approaches.) Hey sweetie, come here! Come sit down. Hey Phoebe and I were just talking about how our relationship is deep and meaningful. It really is don’t you think?ScenesChandler: Oh totally! (Holds up his finger.) Pull my finger.

rows.Scenes: The 2001 Soapie Awards, Joey’s category is up next and the presenter walks to the podium.]
rows.Content: Announcer: Presenting the award for Favorite Returning Male Character is McKensize…Scenes[Cut to Joey and Rachel’s table.]ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) This is it! This is my category.ScenesRachel: I know! My God! Do you have your speech?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I got my speech!ScenesRachel: Do you got your gracious loser face?ScenesJoey: Yeah. (Does it.)ScenesRachel: Now Joey remember, if you win you have to hug me! You hug me!ScenesJoey: Okay. Can I squeeze your ass?ScenesRachel: On TV?! Yeah!ScenesJoey: ‘Kay!Scenes[Cut to the presenter.]ScenesThe Presenter: …in the category of Favorite Returning Male Character the nominees are: John Wheeler from General Hospital (Applause), Gavin Grant from The Young and the Restless (Applause), Dunkin Harrington from Passions (Applause), and Joey Tribbiani from Days of Our Lives (Applause). And the Soapie goes to…(She opens the envelope)…Gavin Grant from The Young and the Restless!ScenesJoey: What the?! (Joey pounds the table and starts yelling at Rachel, and which is drowned out by applause. Rachel is desperately trying to tell Joey that he’s on TV right now. He finally notices and he does his gracious loser face.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The 2001 Soapie Awards, the announcer is introducing the next presenter.]
rows.Content: Announcer: Presenting the award for Favorite Supporting Actress is Joey Tribbiani from Days of Our Lives. (Applause as Joey angrily walks to the podium and eyes the trophy.)ScenesJoey: (angrily and monotone) Any one of the brilliant actresses nominated for this award tonight deserves to take it home. Unfortunately only one can. (Shakes his head in disgust.) The nominees for Best Supporting Actress are from Passions Erin Goff. (There is applause, which Joey disgustedly waits to dye out.) From One Life to Live Mary Loren Bishop (They start to applaud again, but Joey interrupts in with the rest of the nominees), from All My Children Sarah Mchann, and from Days of Our Lives Jessica Ashley. And the winner is…(Opens the envelope)…Jessica Ashley from Days of Our Lives. (Applause) Uh, unfortunately Jessica couldn’t be with us tonight so I’ll be accepting this award on her behalf. (Realizes something) And I’m sure that Jessica would like to thank my parents who always believed in me. She’d also like to thank my friends, Chandler, Monica, Ross, Phoebe, and Rachel who’s sittin’ right there! (Points at Rachel.) (The music starts and his microphone is turned off, this angers Joey again and he disgustedly exits.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Rachel are entering.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Joey! Why did we have to rush out of there so fast?!ScenesJoey: Rach we had to get out of there because, look what I won! (He whips out the award for Best Supporting Actress that he accepted for Jessica.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God you stole her award!ScenesJoey: No-no! No, I’m accepting it on her behalf. (He puts it up above the TV to display it.)ScenesRachel: Joey I don’t think you know what behalf means.ScenesJoey: Sure I do! It’s a verb! As in, "I behalfin’ it!ScenesRachel: Joey, you have got to take this back!ScenesJoey: But why?! I should’ve won one and I really want it and she didn’t even care enough to come to the thing! It could also be a Grammy.ScenesRachel: (looking at the award) No! Joey!ScenesJoey: Come on Rach! No one saw me take it! There was a whole table full of ‘em.ScenesRachel: Do you really want an award you didn’t win?ScenesJoey: No! I want an award I did win! But nobody’s giving me any of those! Plus—Hey Rach, if-if I put it up there (Points to the TV) right? When people come over they’ll see it and they’ll think I won it.ScenesRachel: Joey is says Best Supporting Actress!ScenesJoey: I can scratch that right off.ScenesRachel: Joey no, this is wrong! You have to take it back, okay? You don’t want to win an award this way. You’re very talented. And someday you’re gonna win one of these for real and that one is gonna mean something.ScenesJoey: All right!ScenesRachel: All right? (He sets the award down.) Thank you.ScenesJoey: I’ll take it back tomorrow.ScenesRachel: Thank you.Scenes(He goes into his room and closes the door. Rachel goes to pick it up and…)ScenesJoey: (opening his door) If I can’t have it you can’t have it! (Rachel walks away angrily.)

rows.Scenes: Ross’s Classroom, he is writing on the board and Alan is coming in to see him.]
rows.Content: Lewis: Professor Geller?ScenesRoss: (turning towards him) Yes Mr. Lewis, how can I help you?ScenesLewis: I know I didn’t do well on my midterms and stuff but, I was kinda hoping you could change my grade.ScenesRoss: And why exactly would I do that? (Goes back to writing on the board.)ScenesLewis: Because I’m in love with you.ScenesRoss: (turning around and dragging the chalk down the board) What?!ScenesLewis: Yeah, I’m all…in love with you and stuff. So could you change my grade?ScenesRoss: No!ScenesLewis: Well why not you changed Ned’s grade!ScenesRoss: Well that’s different! Okay? Because he, he was actually in love with me!ScenesLewis: No he’s not! He’s totally yanking your chain! He’s done this with three other teachers!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesLewis: He’s got a girlfriend!ScenesRoss: I can’t believe someone would do that for a grade.ScenesLewis: I know! It’s awful. I love you.Scenes(Ross glares at him.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is sitting on the couch as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Have you seen Chandler?ScenesPhoebe: No. Why?ScenesMonica: ‘Cause I just keeping thinking about all these things that I’m not gonna have and it’s freaking me out. I don’t know what to do about it.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, don’t sweat it. (Looking around her.) Chandler is nowhere around so go ahead get it out of your system. That guy’s cute. (Points to a guy sitting behind Monica.)ScenesMonica: Phoebe! Come on I’m serious! I just got to talk to him about all this.ScenesPhoebe: No that is the last thing you want to do!ScenesMonica: Why?ScenesPhoebe: Because you’re marrying him!ScenesMonica: You gotta help me out here Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I’ve never been engaged and I’ve never really been married, but I can only tell you what my mother told me. Whenever you have doubts or fears or anxieties about a relationship, do not communicate them to your husband.ScenesMonica: So I’m not supposed to share my doubts and fears with the guy I’m gonna spend the rest of my life with?ScenesPhoebe: That is correct! Yes, you’re supposed to take all of that stuff and put it in a little box in your mind and then lock it up tight.ScenesMonica: Your mother told you this?ScenesPhoebe: Yes!ScenesMonica: The woman that got married a bunch of times and killed herself when you were 13?ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! You’re right! Go! (Monica starts to leave.) Go tell Chandler! Hurry before it’s too late! Wait no! (Monica stops.) Does this also mean putting out doesn’t get you love? (Monica is shocked.)

rows.Scenes: Silvercup Studios, Joey and Rachel are there to give Jessica her award.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I cannot believe I’m gonna meet Jessica Ashley!ScenesJoey: Okay wait-wait p-please be cool! Okay? I work with this woman.ScenesRachel: Okay, I’m totally cool! (She coolly knocks on the door)ScenesJessica Ashley: Come in.Scenes(The enter.)ScenesJoey: Hey Jessica.ScenesRachel: (coolly) Hey Jess.ScenesJoey: Ah, this is my friend Rachel.ScenesJessica Ashley: Hi.ScenesRachel: ‘Sup? (Joey glares at her.)ScenesJoey: Uh listen, here’s your Soapie. I accepted it for ya. (Hands it to her.)ScenesJessica Ashley: (shocked) Oh my God! I won! Do you have any idea what this means?! (She rolls her eyes and throws it onto the couch.)ScenesJoey: Well, that-that-that’s it? You’re gonna, you’re gonna put it on your self or anything?ScenesJessica Ashley: No, I try to save that for real awards. Now, if you’ll excuse me. (She exits.)ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) Take it back?ScenesRachel: Absolutely.ScenesJoey: Y-y-yeah! (As they start to leave, Rachel pauses and steals a vase with flowers in it.) Yeah you do. (They exit.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is talking to Chandler.]
rows.Content: Monica: Honey, as we get closer to the wedding, is there anything that you would like to talk about or share?ScenesChandler: Okay. Well, I think the centerpieces are too bigScenesMonica: You’re wrong! The centerpieces are fine! Do you ever get scared at all?ScenesChandler: Kinda. They’re really big.ScenesMonica: Doesn’t it ever just freak you out that-that you’re never gonna be with anybody new again?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: Just, I love you so much. Just…It’s just sometimes it bothers me that I’m never gonna have that feeling. Y’know when you meet someone for the first time and it’s new and exciting? Y’know that rush?ScenesChandler: No. No, see when I first meet somebody it’s uh it’s mostly panic, anxiety, and a great deal of sweating.ScenesMonica: Okay, but all right you’re a guy, does it not freak you that you’re never gonna sleep with anybody else?ScenesChandler: Sleeping with somebody new, anxiety, panic, and I’m afraid even more sweating.ScenesMonica: Even with me?ScenesChandler: I was dangerously dehydrated during the first six months of our relationship. (Monica laughs.) Look, for me the rush is knowing that we are gonna be together for the rest of our lives.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesChandler: Well yeah! But now that I know that you’re having these thoughts, I’m back to panic, anxiety, and uh I’m definitely gonna need some kind of sports drink.ScenesMonica: Come here! Come here! (They hug.) Sweetie you don’t have to worry. No, besides y’know what? I’m gonna have a lot of new things with you. The first time we buy a house. Our first kid. Our first grandkid…ScenesChandler: (hoarsely) Water! Water! Water!

rows.Scenes: Ross’s classroom, he has just finished his lecture and the students are filing out.]
rows.Content: Ross: Uh Mr. Morse, can I speak to you for a moment?ScenesMorse: (walking up) That was a great lecture today. Did you get a little hair cut?ScenesRoss: Uh-hmm, yeah-yeah do you like it?
